ASIAN EXPORTERS FEAR DAMAGE U.S.-JAPAN RIFT Mounting trade friction U.S. Japan raised fears among many Asia 's exporting nations row could inflict far-reaching economic damage , businessmen officials said .
told Reuter correspondents Asian capitals U.S. Move Japan might boost protectionist sentiment U.S. lead curbs American imports products .
exporters said conflict would hurt long-run , short-term Tokyo 's loss might gain .
U.S. said impose 300 mln dlrs tariffs imports Japanese electronics goods April 17 , retaliation Japan 's alleged failure stick pact sell semiconductors world markets cost .
Unofficial Japanese estimates put impact tariffs 10 billion dlrs spokesmen major electronics firms said would virtually halt exports products hit new taxes .
`` would n't able business , '' said spokesman leading Japanese electronics firm Matsushita Electric Industrial Co Ltd & lt ; MC.T > .
`` tariffs remain place length time beyond months mean complete erosion exports ( goods subject tariffs ) U.S. , '' said Tom Murtha , stock analyst Tokyo office broker & lt ; James Capel Co > .
Taiwan , businessmen officials also worried .
`` aware seriousness U.S .
Threat Japan serves warning us , '' said senior Taiwanese trade official asked named .
Taiwan trade trade surplus 15.6 billion dlrs last year , 95 pct U.S .
surplus helped swell Taiwan 's foreign exchange reserves 53 billion dlrs , among world 's largest .
`` must quickly open markets , remove trade barriers cut import tariffs allow imports U.S. Products , want defuse problems possible U.S .
Retaliation , '' said Paul Sheen , chairman textile exporters & lt ; Taiwan Safe Group > .
senior official South Korea 's trade promotion association said trade dispute U.S. Japan might also lead pressure South Korea , whose chief exports similar Japan .
Last year South Korea trade surplus 7.1 billion dlrs U.S. , 4.9 billion dlrs 1985 .
Malaysia , trade officers businessmen said tough curbs Japan might allow hard-hit producers semiconductors third countries expand sales U.S .
Hong Kong , newspapers alleged Japan selling below-cost semiconductors , electronics manufacturers share view .
businessmen said short-term commercial advantage would outweighed U.S. Pressure block imports .
`` short-term view , '' said Lawrence Mills , director-general Federation Hong Kong Industry .
`` whole purpose prevent imports , one day extended sources .
Much serious Hong Kong disadvantage action restraining trade , '' said .
U.S. Last year Hong Kong 's biggest export market , accounting 30 pct domestically produced exports .
Australian government awaiting outcome trade talks U.S. Japan interest concern , Industry Minister John Button said Canberra last Friday .
`` kind deterioration trade relations two countries major trading partners serious matter , '' Button said .
said Australia 's concerns centred coal beef , Australia 's two largest exports Japan also significant U.S. Exports country .
Meanwhile U.S.-Japanese diplomatic manoeuvres solve trade stand-off continue .
Japan 's ruling Liberal Democratic Party yesterday outlined package economic measures boost Japanese economy .
measures proposed include large supplementary budget record public works spending first half financial year .
also call stepped-up spending emergency measure stimulate economy despite Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone 's avowed fiscal reform program .
Deputy U.S. Trade Representative Michael Smith Makoto Kuroda , Japan 's deputy minister International Trade Industry ( MITI ) , due meet Washington week effort end dispute .

JAPAN REVISE LONG-TERM ENERGY DEMAND DOWNWARDS Ministry International Trade Industry ( MITI ) revise long-term energy supply/demand outlook August meet forecast downtrend Japanese energy demand , ministry officials said .
MITI expected lower projection primary energy supplies year 2000 550 mln kilolitres ( kl ) 600 mln , said .
decision follows emergence structural changes Japanese industry following rise value yen decline domestic electric power demand .
MITI planning work revised energy supply/demand outlook deliberations committee meetings Agency Natural Resources Energy , officials said .
said MITI also review breakdown energy supply sources , including oil , nuclear , coal natural gas .
Nuclear energy provided bulk Japan 's electric power fiscal year ended March 31 , supplying estimated 27 pct kilowatt/hour basis , followed oil ( 23 pct ) liquefied natural gas ( 21 pct ) , noted .
THAI TRADE DEFICIT WIDENS FIRST QUARTER Thailand 's trade deficit widened 4.5 billion baht first quarter 1987 2.1 billion year ago , Business Economics Department said .
said Janunary/March imports rose 65.1 billion baht 58.7 billion .
Thailand 's improved business climate year resulted 27 pct increase imports raw materials semi-finished products .
country 's oil import bill , however , fell 23 pct first quarter due lower oil prices .
department said first quarter exports expanded 60.6 billion baht 56.6 billion .
Export growth smaller expected due lower earnings many key commodities including rice whose earnings declined 18 pct , maize 66 pct , sugar 45 pct , tin 26 pct canned pineapples seven pct .
Products registering high export growth jewellery 64 pct , clothing 57 pct rubber 35 pct .

Indonesia , world 's second largest producer palm oil Malaysia , forced import palm oil ensure supplies Moslem fasting month Ramadan .

Indonesian exports CPO calendar 1986 530,500 tonnes , 468,500 1985 , according central bank figures .

INDONESIAN COMMODITY EXCHANGE MAY EXPAND Indonesian Commodity Exchange likely start trading least one new commodity , possibly two , calendar 1987 , exchange chairman Paian Nainggolan said .
told Reuters telephone interview trading palm oil , sawn timber , pepper tobacco considered .
Trading either crude palm oil ( CPO ) refined palm oil may also introduced .
said question still considered Trade Minister Rachmat Saleh decision go ahead made .
fledgling exchange currently trades coffee rubber physicals open outcry system four days week .
`` Several factors make us move cautiously , '' Nainggolan said .
`` want move slowly safely make mistake undermine confidence exchange . ''
Physical rubber trading launched 1985 , coffee added January 1986 .
Rubber contracts traded FOB , five months forward .
Robusta coffee grades four five traded prompt delivery five months forward , exchange officials said .
trade ministry exchange board considering introduction futures trading later rubber , one official said feasibility study needed first .
decisions likely Indonesia 's elections April 23 , traders said .
Trade Minister Saleh said Monday Indonesia , world 's second largest producer natural rubber , expand rubber marketing effort hoped development exchange would help .
Nainggolan said exchange trying boost overseas interest building contacts end-users .
said teams already South Korea Taiwan encourage direct use exchange , delegation would also visit Europe , Mexico Latin American states encourage participation .
Officials say infant exchange made good start although trading coffee disappointing .
Transactions rubber start trading April 1985 December 1986 totalled 9,595 tonnes , worth 6.9 mln dlrs FOB , plus 184.3 mln rupiah rubber delivered locally , latest exchange report said .
Trading coffee calendar 1986 amounted 1,905 tonnes 381 lots , valued 6.87 billion rupiah .
Total membership exchange nine brokers 44 traders .

Osaka-based Sumitomo , desposits around 23.9 trillion yen , merged Heiwa Sogo , small , struggling bank estimated 1.29 billion dlrs unrecoverable loans , October .
despite link-up , Sumitomo President Koh Komatsu told Reuters confident bank quickly regain position .
`` 'll back position first place within three years , '' Komatsu said interview .
said merger initially reduce Sumitomo 's profitability efficiency , vastly expand Sumitomo 's branch network Tokyo metropolitan area relatively weak .
financial analysts divided whether quickly gamble pay .
said Sumitomo may paid much Heiwa Sogo view smaller bank 's large debts .
Others argue merger cost effective creating comparable branch network scratch .
analysts agreed bank aggressive .
expanded overseas , entered lucrative securities business geared domestic competition , questioned wisdom moves .
`` 've made bold moves put everything place .
's largely hands , '' said Kleinwort Benson Ltd financial analyst Simon Smithson .

Regulations change near future , various things .
wait two three years , 21st century , '' Komatsu said .

Article 65 Securities Exchange Act , Japan's version U.S. Glass-Steagall Act , separates commercial investment banking .
walls two crumbling Komatsu said hopes deregulation create new opportunities .
`` need find new business chances , '' Komatsu said .

's kind deregulation want . ''
changes occur , Sumitomo focus domestic securities business profitable government bond dealing strengthening relations Meiko Securities Co Ltd , holds five pct share , Komatsu said .

SUBROTO SAYS INDONESIA SUPPORTS TIN PACT EXTENSION Mines Energy Minister Subroto confirmed Indonesian support extension sixth International Tin Agreement ( ITA ) , said new pact necessary .
Asked Reuters clarify statement Monday said pact allowed lapse , Subroto said Indonesia ready back extension ITA .

`` seventh accord believe unnecessary . ''
sixth ITA expire end June unless two-thirds majority members vote extension .
BUNDESBANK ALLOCATES 6.1 BILLION MARKS TENDER Bundesbank accepted bids 6.1 billion marks today 's tender 28-day securities repurchase pact fixed rate 3.80 pct , central bank spokesman said .
Banks , bid total 12.2 billion marks liquidity , credited funds allocated today must buy back securities pledged May 6 .
14.9 billion marks drain market today earlier pact expires , Bundesbank effectively withdrawing net 8.1 billion marks market today 's allocation .
Bundesbank spokesman said answer enquiries withdrawal funds reflect tightening credit policy , seen context plentiful liquidity banking system .
Banks held average 59.3 billion marks Bundesbank first six days month , well clear likely April minimum reserve requirement 51 billion marks .
Bundesbank spokesman noted bidding 12.2 billion marks , outgoing 14.9 billion , banks shown felt plenty liquidity .
Dealers said Bundesbank keen prevent much liquidity accruing market , would blunt effectiveness security repurchase agreement , main open-market instrument steering market interest rates .
Two pacts likely month next two weeks .
Bundesbank currently steering call money 3.6 3.8 pct , although short-term fluctuations outside range possible , dealers said .

Australia Canada could increase wheat exports competitive U.S. , said .

Beef citrus imports .
countries already cutting U.S. Market share .

U.K. MONEY MARKET DEFICIT FORECAST 250 MLN STG Bank England said forecast shortage around 250 mln stg money market today .
Among main factors affecting liquidity , bills maturing official hands take-up treasury bills drain 505 mln stg , bills repurchase market remove around 194 mln .
addition , rise note circulation bankers ' balances target drain around 110 mln stg .
Partly offsetting outflows , exchequer transactions add 690 mln stg system today .
SOUTH KOREA MOVES SLOW GROWTH TRADE SURPLUS South Korea 's trade surplus growing fast government started taking steps slow , Deputy Prime Minister Kim Mahn-je said .
told press conference government planned increase investment , speed opening local market foreign imports gradually adjust currency hold surplus `` proper level . ''
said government would allow appreciate much short period time .
South Korea pressure Washington revalue .
U.S .
Wants South Korea cut trade surplus U.S. , rose 7.4 billion dlrs 1986 4.3 billion dlrs 1985 .
Kim , also economic planning minister , said prospects bright South Korean economy , government would try hold current account surplus around five billion dlrs year next five years .
`` government projections eight pct GNP growth , five billion dlrs ( current account ) surplus 12 pct growth exports seemed reasonable early year .
surplus growing faster expected , '' said .
Trade ministry officials said South Korea 's exports rose 35 pct 9.34 billion dlrs first three months year , imports rose 8.5 pct 8.2 billion dlrs .
Kim said swing South Korea 's current account surplus 4.65 billion dlrs 1986 890 mln dlr deficit 1985 significant .
surplus enabled country reduce foreign debt last year first time .
South Korea 's foreign debt , fell 44.5 billion dlrs 1986 46.8 billion 1985 , still among largest Asia .
`` huge amount foreign debt one major constraints development ... Last year major turning point Korean economy , '' Kim said .
Kim said government plannned reduce ratio foreign debt country 's GNP 20 pct 1991 , 50 pct 1986 .
`` government , however , want accelerate reducing debt making excessive trade surplus , '' said .
Kim said sudden rise surplus would cause inflation lead trade friction Seoul 's major trading partners , particularly United States .
`` need surplus reduce debt , taking measures hold size surplus proper level , '' Kim said .

prospective plant would cost estimated 270 mln Canadian dlrs would produce methyl tertiary butyl ether ( MTBE ) raw materials available locally , said .
partners study Neste Oy , Celanese Canada Inc , Hoechst Celanese Corporation Trade Mountain Pipe Line Company Ltd , Vancouver , B.C .
Edmonton site suitable raw materials availability , proximity pipeline transportation important capital operating advantages gained locating existing Celanese Canada site , statement said .
partners would look feasibility plant producing 500,000 tonnes per annum MTBE , octane enhancer replace tetra ethyl lead .
MTBE would targeted United States lead levels gasoline lowered health concerns , statement added .
Canadian lead limits currently 11 times high U.S. Limit lead scheduled virtual elimination Canada 1993 , create Canadian demand MTBE , said .
Finland 's Neste Oy , whose turnover last year five billion dlrs , extensive experience MTBE .
major investment MTBE plant Saudi Arabia .
Edmonton , Alberta plant would scheduled go stream late 1989 , statement said .

Foreign banks allowed operate susbidiaries Norway since 1985 .
Foreign banking analysts Oslo said access Norway's second-hand securities equities markets , approved later spring , lower primary reserve requirements would make profit year .
Citibank lost 490,000 crowns Norway 1985 , Sejerstad said profit likely year planned liberalisation better economic performance , helped steadier oil price around 18 dlrs barrel .

''

High short-term interest rates , bullish stock market increasingly stable currency reflect massive inflow fresh funds last two months , largely Japanese U.S. Investors , analysts polled Reuters said .
Fund managers want quality markets park cash settled Australia , Britain Canada diversify volatile U.S. Dollar instruments , said .
one percentage point fall key 10-year bonds rates past month , record share prices 10-month high currency 0.71 U.S. Dlrs illustrated inflow .
Official figures latest inflow investment capital available , brokers said received almost daily inquiries Japan United States .

ending attraction high interest rates reasonable currency stability , '' National Australia Bank Ltd economist Brian Hamley said .

`` put money Australia entry cheap currency looks stable ? ''
turning capital permanent productive investment depends government economic policy , said .
`` disappear people lose confidence direction economy , '' Buttrose said , adding offshore investors would carefully watch government 's promised tough economic statement May 14 .
happy invest bonds vehicles yielding interest unobtainable elsewhere , fund managers could easily reverse flow -- particularly Japanese , badly hurt past rapid falls Australian dollar hefty jumps bond rates , analysts said .
`` remain edgy money .
something delivered , statement n't considered tough enough , one might see substantial outflow , '' Buttrose said .

`` giving us benefit doubt think would like leave money , '' Buttrose said .

Reserve Governor Bob Johnston last week acknowledged element targeting rate yen currency policy said authorities could take `` eyes yen '' crucial role Japanese investors .

followed Wall Street markets , also setting trend response weight domestic offshore funds pouring equities , particularly gold sector .

ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT - KUWAITI ECONOMY Kuwait 's oil-reliant debt-ridden economy started pull nosedive oil prices determine pace recovery , bankers economists say .
Crucial ability 13-member OPEC hold oil prices around new benchmark 18 dlrs barrel northern hemisphere summer demand usually slackens .
Bankers estimate economy , measured terms gross domestic product ( gdp ) , shrank 19 pct real terms last year contracting 8.1 pct year .
taking account inflation consumer prices 1.5 pct 1985 , slowing 1.0 pct 1986 .
Factors depressing economic activity include 6-1/2-year-old Iran-Iraq war Kuwait 's doorstep , threatens emirate 's vital oil export lifeline Gulf sapped business confidence .
sentiment received much-needed boost September , series piecemeal steps combat debt crisis caused 1982 crash local stock market , comprehensive new debt settlement program introduced .
share crash , result speculative spree forward trading , left 95 billion dlrs post-dated cheques default .
cheques also used collateral consumer spending , thus generating informal credit system .
Much debt watered big sums still owed individuals companies .
4.4 billion dinars ( 15.7 billion dlrs ) outstanding bank credit end 1986 , one-quarter one-third estimated bankers rank bad doubtful debt .
government repeatedly said allow banks go .
new debt settlement scheme entails rescheduling problem credit 10 15 years , depending whether debtors regular cash flows .
Banks ' shareholders depositors rights guaranteed government -- edict vital significance country 1.7 mln people financial sector biggest oil .
Kuwait better placed OPEC country ride oil glut , bankers economists say .

strategic diversification downstream operations Europe several years ago hefty refining investment home gives guaranteed markets abroad enables sell one-half output high-grade refined oil products .

Bankers say rebound oil prices major reason cautious optimism .
reasons low domestic inflation , bottoming fall imports recent years signs government spending productive sectors remain steady .
External accounts good shape , estimated 1.8 billion dinar current account surplus 1986 , 16 pct 1985 , still achievement recession-hit Gulf .
Kuwait 's petrodollar reserves mid-1986 put officially 80 billion dlrs , earning investment income equivalent 3.65 billion dlrs year .
first time since end oil boom , reserves may enough prevent `` real '' budget deficit 1986/87 fiscal year ending June 30 , bankers say .
budget portrayed bankers mildly contractionary , revenues 1986/87 cut 38.6 pct spending 11 pct , doubling nominal deficit 1.33 billion dinars .
left income state reserves , usually excluded official budget accounting , forecast bankers 1.0 billion dinars 1986/87 , resulting shortfall .

MALAYSIA MAY MEET 1987 OIL PALM TARGET Malaysia unlikely meet targeted output five mln tonnes oil palm calendar 1987 , oil palm growers told Reuters .
Output 1987 expected reach around 4.5 mln tonnes , unchanged 1986 , drought , low use fertiliser overstressed palms , said .
growers asked reaction Oil World newsletter report Malaysia 's oil palm output likely drop sharply year .
Palm oil sells around 700 ringgit tonne , 115 ringgit less soybean oil , Malaysia must sell palm oil prevent stock buildup could damage industry , leading grower told Reuters .
country 's palm oil stocks total 500,000 tonnes 800,000 last March , growers said .
growers expect palm oil prices ease later year due pressure South American U.S .

recently reported first-half 1986/87 net fell 15.02 mln dlrs 17.09 mln year earlier due Australian housing downturn , although foreign earnings rose .

Manila court yesterday issued injunction barring UCPB selling shares , represent 31 pct SMC's outstanding capital stock 121 mln shares , hearings April 21 petition filed Eduardo Cojuangco , former chairman SMC UCPB .
Cojuangco said Coconut Industry Investment Fund ( CIIF ) 1.4 mln farmers rightful owners shares .
Cojuangco said shares held trust UCPB represented blue chip investment .
petition said UCPB's plans sell shares SMC `` serious breach fiduciary duties . ''
SMC sources said proposed share sale could also held second derivative suit filed Securities Exchange Commission ( SEC ) Eduardo de los Angeles , government nominee company 's board .
De los Angeles , represents SMC 's minority stockholders , asked SEC block transaction , approved last week company 's board .
April 2 board sanctioned repurchase sequestered shares 4.79 billion pesos 126 pesos per share .
De los Angeles told SEC company 's retained earnings 1.33 billion pesos would wiped purchase shares would prevent declaration dividends .
De los Angeles said share purchase would also violate SMC agreement creditors maintain 2.2-to-1 debt equity ratio .
quoted SMC 's chief financial director Ramon del Rosario telling board transaction would boost ratio 2.5-to-1 .
petitioning SEC , de los Angeles amended earlier suit two weeks ago charged SMC Chairman Andres Soriano III nine directors violating duties .
De los Angeles ' earlier complaint related SMC assuming last December 26.5 mln dlr loan contracted SMC 's Hong Kong subsidiary & lt ; Neptunia Corp > payment shares .
loan assumption ratified last week 's board meeting .
arbitration panel set President Corazon Aquino resolve ownership issue expected submit report April 15 .
`` amended suit filed Eduardo de los Angeles part continuing attempt certain elements , complete disregard facts questionable motives , delay early disposition sequestered shares , '' San Miguel Corp said statement .
`` Coming , San Miguel Corp UCPB reached agreement price shares method payment , suit direct contravention government 's expressed desire reach amicable settlement controversy April 15 , '' statement added .
San Miguel spokesman said comment Cojuangco 's court petition , adding : `` statement coming us might interpreted adversarial . ''
Meanwhile , Ramon Diaz , head government panel sequestered shares last year , said Soriano eligible buy major portion shares United States citizen .
sequestered shares split 24 mln `` '' shares , owned Filipinos , 14 mln `` B '' shares available foreign buyers .

said shares would purchased & lt ; A.Soriano > group companies , SMC , Neptunia unnamed institutional investors .

RAIN BOOSTS CENTRAL QUEENSLAND SUGAR CANE CROP Good rains one four inches past 10 days boosted moisture-stressed sugar cane crops Mackay-Burdekin region Queensland 's central coast , Australian Sugar Producers ' Association spokesman said .
previously reported , region undergoing severe dry spell , partly relieved scattered rainfall , since December , following virtual failure summer wet season .
Mills area reporting crops beginning look healthy greener putting growth since rains began , spokesman said Brisbane .
Although Mackay-Burdekin crop outlook much better , cane losses , spokesman said .
early say rain needed restore sub-soil moisture .
Elsewhere , far north Queensland , Bundaberg region southern Queensland , cane excellent condition mills forecasting record crops , said .
Initial 1987 crop estimates probably compiled towards end May , said .
cane crush normally runs June December .

NICKEL PRICES UNLIKELY RISE MUCH - SHEARSON Nickel prices unlikely rise significantly current levels unless steps taken reduce production , Shearson Lehman Brothers said quarterly nickel market report .
market recovered slightly around 1.72 dlrs lb yesterday four year low 1.55 dlrs early January , due absence Soviet nickel cathode deliveries , Shearson sees Soviet shipments soon returning last year's buoyant levels , ease current tightness .
Output reductions producers take effect later year likely offset increases elsewhere .
Shearson said nickel market virtually balance 1987 , total non-Socialist world demand 556,000 tonnes , compared estimated 544,000 tonnes 1986 , production 505,000 tonnes ( 504,000 ) imports Socialist countries 47,000 tonnes ( 50,000 ) .
forecast prices edge higher year first quarter average 1.67 dlrs lb 1.77 dlrs last quarter .
year 's average around 1.72 dlrs lb compared 1.76 dlrs 1986 , using London Metal Exchange cash metal prices dollar terms assuming average 1987 sterling exchange rate 1.55 dlrs .

speech Institute Contempory German Affairs , Poehl said `` would extremely risky policy aim substantial decline value dollar correct trade deficit . ''
said United States could face vicious circle depreciation , inflation depreciation took route .
Poehl noted West Germany already taken steps meet U.S .
Demands greater stimulation domestic economy , accelerating tax cuts , cutting interest rates tolerating above-target money supply growth .
said would happy brought forward five billion marks tax cuts planned January 1988 beginning year , said government faced political constraints getting measures upper house West German parliament .
also limits impact West Germany could accept exports rising mark , said .

`` appreciation mark could even obstacle growth , '' said .

underlying rate inflation two pct , reported negative inflation rates last year , West Germany affected exchange rate developments .

must careful , '' said .
said shared U.S. Concern Japan's trade surpluses , affected European countries well United States .

partners agreed dollar right level , changes would damage growth , said .

PROXMIRE OUTLINES INSIDER TRADING LEGISLATION Senate Banking Committee Chairman William Proxmire ( D-Wis ) said planned introduce legislation shortly require greater public disclosure corporate takeovers fairer treatment shareholders .
Speaking National Association Manufacturers , Proxmire said recent insider trading stock scandals increased chance Congress act curb abuses .
`` proposing legislation would provide disclosure , would fairer shareholders , would insure takeovers properly financed , '' said .
Among provisions , bill would reduce threshold notifying Securities Exchange Commission investor group acquired percentage stock company three pct current five pct threshold within 10 days , Proxmire said .
addition , would pre-notificaton requirement investor intended aquire three pct would filed SEC .
Proxmire said pre-notification requirement meant prevent arbitragers jump general public knowing coming takeover attempts .
Proxmire said would call extending period tender offer must kept open Williams Act 60 business days current 20 business days .
bill would provide private suits acquiring company violated time period tender offer .
correct abuses financing takeovers , Proxmire said legislation would aim insuring current margin requirments properly enforced .
Federal Reserve Board 50 pct margin requirement purchasing stock , Proxmire said generally enforced hostile takeovers .
Rather , groups individuals leading takeover declare raise capital takeover without actually putting money , Proxmire said .
said bill would allow private suits damages failure meet Federal Reserve 's 50 pct margin requirements .
bill also would require disclose several investors form alliance hostile takeover .
`` Pickens Icahn get together want people know , '' Proxmire said .
Proxmire said favored approach used Britain towards two-tiered tender offers insures shareholders recieve equal treatment .
said expected amendments bill also would cover defensive mechanisms green mail poison pills .
Proxmire said intended introduce bill later month predicted Senate committee would act spring .
said hopeful Congress could pass bill year .

BANKERS TRUST & lt ; BT > PUTS BRAZIL NON-ACCRUAL Bankers Trust New York Corp said placed approximately 540 mln dlrs medium- long-term loans Brazil non-accrual status first-quarter net income reduced seven mln dlrs result .
Brazil suspended interest payments 68 billion dlrs medium- long-term debt February 22 .
U.S. banking regulations require banks stop accruing interest loans payments 90 days overdue , Bankers Trust said acted `` high potential continued suspension would result reaching 90-day limit second quarter 1987 . ''
Assuming cash payments current interest rates received rest 1987 , Bankers Trust estimated full-year net income would reduced 30 mln dlrs .
Bankers Trust said assumes debt negotiations Brazil commercial bank lenders lead resumption interest payments .
negotiations resume New York Friday central bank governor Francisco Gros expected ask banks 90-day rollover 9.5 billion dlrs term debt matures April 15 .

declined say measures would discussed ahead communique Group Seven ministers later today .

`` fundamental weakness Paris accord , '' said .
`` looking ways strengthening , want discuss .

`` Louvre agreement honored market , '' said .

Conditions generally good average sowing date crop expected around April 11 , April 23 last year , 10-year average April 14 , spokesman added .
`` far early yet say kind output expect comes harvest September , least crop good start , '' said .
Last year , Netherlands planted record 137,600 hectares sugar beet produced record 1.2 mln tonnes white sugar , substantially country 's combined `` '' `` B '' quota 872,000 tonnes .
year , however , self-imposed quota system introduced aim cutting plantings 130,000 hectares reducing white sugar output around 915,000 tonnes minimise amount non-quota `` C '' sugar produced .
farmers record growing suger beet allotted quotas .
expected prevent area boosted dairy cereal farmers moving sugar .

ZAMBIA PLAN RETAIL MAIZE PRICE HIKE Zambian government immediate plans follow last week 's increase producer price maize hike retail price maize meal , official ruling party said .
Last December , 120 pct increase consumer price refined maize meal , Zambian staple , led food riots least 15 people died .
price increase , President Kenneth Kaunda later revoked , followed pressure International Monetary Fund ( IMF ) reduce government 's subsidy bill .
However , producer price rise , 6.10 dlrs 8.67 dlrs per 90-kg bag , accompanied retail price increase , government spend subsidies , practice discouraged IMF .
`` way raise subsidy levels meal .
( government ) would choose demands IMF people , '' Ministry Agriculture economist said .

talks Baker apparently convinced Goria , declined attend February meeting Group Seven Paris , Italy would participate fully meaningful decisions .

ENERGY/U.S .
PETROCHEMICAL INDUSTRY Cheap oil feedstocks , weakened U.S. dollar plant utilization rate approaching 90 pct propel streamlined U.S. petrochemical industry record profits year , growth expected least 1990 , major company executives predicted .
bullish outlook chemical manufacturing industrywide move shed unrelated businesses prompted GAF Corp & lt ; GAF > , privately-held Cain Chemical Inc , firms aggressively seek acquisitions petrochemical plants .
Oil companies Ashland Oil Inc & lt ; ASH > , Kentucky-based oil refiner marketer , also shopping money-making petrochemical businesses buy .
`` see us poised threshold golden period , '' said Paul Oreffice , chairman giant Dow Chemical Co & lt ; DOW > , adding , `` 's major plant capacity added around world .
whole game bringing new products improving old ones . ''
Analysts say chemical industry 's biggest customers , automobile manufacturers home builders use lot paints plastics , expected buy quantities year .
U.S. petrochemical plants currently operating 90 pct capacity , reflecting tighter supply could hike product prices 30 40 pct year , said John Dosher , managing director Pace Consultants Inc Houston .
Demand products styrene could push profit margins much 300 pct , said .
Oreffice , speaking meeting chemical engineers Houston , said Dow would easily top 741 mln dlrs earned last year predicted would best year history .
1985 , oil prices still 25 dlrs barrel chemical exports adversely affected strong U.S. dollar , Dow profits 58 mln dlrs .
`` believe entire chemical industry headed record year close , '' Oreffice said .
GAF chairman Samuel Heyman estimated U.S. chemical industry would report 20 pct gain profits 1987 .
Last year , domestic industry earned total 13 billion dlrs , 54 pct leap 1985 .
turn fortunes once-sickly chemical industry brought combination luck planning , said Pace 's John Dosher .
Dosher said last year 's fall oil prices made feedstocks dramatically cheaper time American dollar weakening foreign currencies .
helped boost U.S. chemical exports .
Also helping bring supply demand balance gradual market absorption extra chemical manufacturing capacity created Middle Eastern oil producers early 1980s .
Finally , virtually major U.S. chemical manufacturers embarked extensive corporate restructuring program mothball inefficient plants , trim payroll eliminate unrelated businesses .
restructuring touched flurry friendly hostile takeover attempts .
GAF , made unsuccessful attempt 1985 acquire Union Carbide Corp & lt ; UK > , recently offered three billion dlrs Borg Warner Corp & lt ; BOR > , Chicago manufacturer plastics chemicals .
Another industry powerhouse , W.R. Grace & lt ; GRA > divested retailing , restaurant fertilizer businesses raise cash chemical acquisitions .
experts worry chemical industry may headed trouble companies continue turning back manufacturing staple petrochemical commodities , ethylene , favor profitable specialty chemicals custom-designed small group buyers .
`` Companies like DuPont & lt ; DD > Monsanto Co & lt ; MTC > spent past two three years trying get commodity chemical business reaction badly market deteriorated , '' Dosher said .
`` think eventually kill margins profitable chemicals niche market . ''
top chemical executives share concern .
`` challenge industry keep getting carried away repeating past mistakes , '' GAF 's Heyman cautioned .
`` shift commodity chemicals may ill-advised .
Specialty businesses stay special long . ''
Houston-based Cain Chemical , created month Sterling investment banking group , believes generate 700 mln dlrs annual sales bucking industry trend .
Chairman Gordon Cain , previously led leveraged buyout Dupont 's Conoco Inc 's chemical business , spent 1.1 billion dlrs since January buy seven petrochemical plants along Texas Gulf Coast .
plants produce basic commodity petrochemicals building blocks specialty products .
`` kind commodity chemical business never glamorous , high-margin business , '' Cain said , adding demand expected grow three pct annually .
Garo Armen , analyst Dean Witter Reynolds , said chemical makers also benefitted increasing demand plastics prices become competitive aluminum , wood steel products .
Armen estimated upturn chemical business could last long four five years , provided U.S. economy continues modest rate growth .

COCOA EXPORTERS EXPECTED LIMIT SALES Major cocoa exporters likely limit sales weeks ahead effort boost world prices , sources close meeting Cocoa Producers Alliance ( CPA ) said .
sources said depressed world market one main topics discussed closed door meeting 11-member CPA began Monday .
said producers agreed cutting sales would aid buffer stock manager new international cocoa pact effort support prices .
Major cocoa producing consuming nations agreed operation rules buffer stock meeting London last month stock manager expected enter market soon .
Prices , weight three successive cocoa surpluses , recently fell level manager buy cocoa stock rules .
buffer stock aims keep prices within pre-set range buying prices fall selling rise .
`` world 's cocoa price present interesting , '' commented one delegate representing major CPA producer .
Another source said much 1986/87 ( October-September ) world cocoa crop sold , limiting sales near term concerns essentially next year 's harvest .
sources noted , however , cocoa industry Brazil , world 's number two producer , private hands .
means limiting sales difficult major West African producers , sales made authorized commodity marketing boards .
CPA includes world 's top three producers , Ivory Coast , Brazil Ghana , accounts 80 pct output .
meeting due end tomorrow evening .

agent said Honduras seeking U.S. .
2 better northern spring/DNS , 14 pct protein minimum 13 pct moisture maximum , U.S. .

J.P. MORGAN & lt ; JPM > NET HURT BRAZIL , TRADING J.P. Morgan Co Inc said first-quarter earnings fell 3.2 pct , largely reflecting previously announced decision place non-accrual status 1.3 billion dlrs medium- long-term loans Brazil .
decision , spurred Brazil 's suspension interest payments February 20 , reduced quarter 's net income 20 mln dlrs 226.4 mln dlrs , compared 233.9 mln first three months 1986 .
Morgan also reported loss 1.8 mln dlrs securities underwriting trading , contrast gain 45.4 mln dlrs year-earlier period .
fourth quarter 1986 , Morgan posted trading losses 5.5 mln dlrs setbacks trading underwriting Euromarket securities .
Conditions sectors Euromarket remained difficult last quarter , floating rate notes suffering heavy price falls , spokeswoman unable say whether Morgan 's trading losses restricted Euromarket .
positive side , Morgan reduced provision loan losses 35 mln dlrs 70 mln year earlier .
Foreign exchange trading income rose 82 mln dlrs 72.6 mln trust income increased 95.9 mln dlrs 75.9 mln .
Morgan said operating income , mainly fees commissions , rose 102.2 mln dlrs 88.4 mln , net investment securities gains dropped 43.1 mln 58.1 mln .
Net interest earnings 490.4 mln dlrs first quarter , 499.4 mln year earlier , net yield fell 2.79 pct 3.20 pct .
Brazil placed non-accrual , means interest recorded income payments actually received , net interest earnings would 525.9 mln dlrs net yield 2.99 pct .
Brazil resume payments , 1987 net would cut 72 mln dlrs , Morgan added .
provision loan losses , Morgan 's allowance credit losses end March totaled 953 mln dlrs compared 910 mln end-1986 815 mln year earlier .
reported net recoveries six mln dlrs charge-offs eight mln , compared net charge-offs 49 mln dlrs recoveries three mln year earlier .
Excluding Brazil , non-accruing loans quarter 's end 583 mln dlrs , 633 mln end-1986 684 mln year earlier .
Non-interest expenses rose 371.1 mln dlrs 303.5 mln dlrs , half increase related personnel costs , Morgan said .

BRAZIL GRAIN HARVEST FACES STORAGE PROBLEMS Storage problems Brazil 's record grain crop likely result losses five mln tonnes , Agriculture Ministry spokesman said .
Ministry spokesman Leonardo Brito , speaking Brasilia , told Reuters believed five mln tonnes year 's estimated crop 65 mln tonnes would lost .
said part would normal loss inevitable harvesting , would stem storage problems .
Brazil storage capacity 66 mln tonnes , theoretically sufficient crop .
Brito said storage capacity badly distributed .
states Sao Paulo , Parana Rio Grande Sul 70 pct nation 's capacity , responsible 50 60 pct production .
biggest problems concentrated Centre-West growing regions , rising production outpaced storage capacity .
Brito said Centre-West , whose crops include soya maize , 30 40 pct nation 's grains production 20 pct storage space .
addition poor distribution storage units , problem much capacity geared storing grain sacks , enough suitable storing loose grain , Brito said .
Finally , shortage lorries transport crops .
sheer scale task transporting record crop evident television reports , shown enormous queues lorries waiting outside granaries .

Makoto Kuroda , vice minister Japan 's Ministry International Trade Industry ( MITI ) , hold two days meetings Deputy U.S. Trade Representative , Michael Smith , Secretary Commerce , Bruce Smart .
new tariffs , go effect April 17 , retaliation Japan 's failure adhere agreement end dumping semiconductors world markets cost open home market U.S. semiconductor shipments .
imposed goods use semiconductors , including television audio equipment computers .
U.S. Japanese officials said little likelihood talks would anything avert 100 pct duties 300 mln dlrs worth Japanese shipments .
President Reagan announced planned tariffs March 27 said close monitoring July 1986 U.S.-Japanese semiconductor pact convinced U.S. officials Japan honoring agreement .
making annoucement , Reagan said `` committed full enforcement trade agreements designed provide American industry free fair trade . ''
Trade analysts said move aimed much Japan's semiconductor trade practices , said injured U.S. semiconductor industry , Congress , complained presidential timidity trade issues .
Congressional Democrats pledged enact aggressive trade laws counter contend Reagan's inaction redress growing U.S. trade deficit , last year reached 169.8 billion dlrs .
one-third deficit Japan .
Reagan said recent signs Japan beginning adhere pact terminating .
Kuroda said leaving Tokyo today new proposals explanation semiconductor situation .
told daily newspaper Ashai Shimbun Reagan's decision based inaccurate data exaggerated sense MITI 's power control Japanese traders .
`` United States excessive expectations. , '' said .
stabilize supply-demand relations disrupted excess inventories since 1985 take time . ''
also said U.S. firms aggressive enough trying sell Japanese market .

HEINEKEN SEES HIGHER PROFITS , WIDER PENETRATION Dutch brewer Heineken NV said hoped maintain number years similar earnings growth 7.5 pct increase net profit achieved 1986 , despite continuing investments reorganization program efforts extend world penetration .
Heineken last month reported 1986 net profit 285 mln guilders , 265 mln 1985 .
Chairman Freddie Heineken said company , Europe's leading beer producer six pct market share 1986 , said sales increased 6.3 pct 42.1 mln hectoliters .
volume increase due mainly rise U.S. , brand Amstel Lite saw great demand , Europe , sales accounted 25.5 pct total .
Turnover , despite losses guilder terms due weaker foreign currencies , rose 4.4 pct , 6.7 billion guilders .
consolidation foreign companies , including increase stake leading Spanish brewery & lt ; El Aguila S.A. > 51.2 pct , new ventures modernization , particularly French Spanish interests , eroded profit margins .
company still planned invest 700 mln guilders year restructuring marketing , Heineken said .
Heineken 's Spanish activities start yielding profit next year , Heineken said , adding French operations already turned profit vast rationalization last year .
Vice Chairman Gerard van Schaik said decision European Court Justice Luxembourg allow foreign beer closed West German market -- Europe 's biggest beer market -- offered interesting possibilities Heineken .
`` beer , distribution sales important point , '' van Schaik said , adding since ruling Heineken inundated German traders seeking joint ventures .
`` question want penetrate German market , , '' van Schaik said , adding widely traveled Germans seemed developing taste foreign beer , internal structure regionalized .
Heineken board member Hans Coebergh , responsible African operations , said saw Africa one important beer growth markets long term .
said company , present Africa since 1932 majority stakes six breweries interests 25 , hampered lack hard currencies .
Africa , beer consumption averages nine liters per head per year sales limited import restrictions currency risks , nonetheless accounted 6.5 pct total 1986 sales .
On-site production rendered expensive high price imports essential ingredients .
Heineken scientists looking possibilities .
balance costs imported malt , Heinken launched Nigerian market new beer made 50 pct sorghum , sold successfully , Coebergh said .
Heineken urging farmers grow traditional raw materials , Coebergh noted banana palm beer popular Rwanda .
`` possibility , could possibly achieve Heineken flavor , '' Coebergh said .
Chairman Heineken said company 's seven year efforts penetrate Soviet market finally resulted week contract relaxed restrictions faced .
, lack hard currencies limited Heineken's market potential .
Heineken seven bars Moscow enjoying good sales , bars accept western money .

COLOMBIA BUSINESS ASKED DIVERSIFY COFFEE Colombia government trade official urged business community aggressively diversify activities stop relying heavily coffee .
Samuel Alberto Yohai , director Foreign Trade Institute , INCOMEX , said private businessmen become called `` mental hostages '' coffee , traditionally Colombia 's major export .
National Planning Department forecast 1987 coffee account one-third total exports , 1.5 billion dlrs , oil energy products making another third non-traditional exports remainder .

Foreign Ministry statement said latest crisis two NATO members stemmed continental shelf dispute agreement issue would effect security , economy rights countries .

two countries approached armed confrontation last month Greece announced planned oil exploration work Aegean Turkey said would also search oil .
face-off averted Turkey confined research territorrial waters .

contents message disclosed .

GATT OFFICIAL MEETS U.S. FARM LEADERS official charge agricultural matters new round global trade talks Washington today tomorrow meet congressional Reagan administration officials .
Aart de Zeeuw , chairman General Agreement Tariffs Trade 's negotiating group agriculture , met morning members House Agriculture Committee .
Committee sources said De Zeeuw expressed concern protectionism high farm price supports .
House lawmakers noted 1985 United States took steps reduce loan rates , committee staff said .
`` Members told ( De Zeeuw ) lowered ( U.S. ) loan rates ca n't eliminate subsidies unilaterally , '' one source said .
De Zeeuw told U.S. lawmakers ' frustration Japan 's restrictive rice import policy , members defended U.S. dairy policy , aims cut surplus production subsidizing producers trim herds , sources said .
Later today De Zeeuw meet Senate Agriculture members Undersecretary State Affairs Allen Wallis .
Tomorrow , De Zeeuw meet House Ways Means Trade Subcommittee Senate Finance Committee , visiting Agriculture Secretary Richard Lyng .
De Zeeuw goes Canada later week .
trip North America part attempt meet farm policy leaders key GATT member states .
negotiating group agriculture held first meeting February expected meet May .

J.P. MORGAN & lt ; JPM > SAYS DLR MAY PREVENT FED EASING relatively high level real U.S. interest rates suggests scope declines money market rates , Federal Reserve unlikely promote drop long dollar remains volatile , said J.P. Morgan Co Inc chairman Lewis Preston .
said response reporter 's question bank 's annual meeting money market rates could decline , `` n't think Fed going encourage long exchange markets volatile . ''
hand , said , barring collapse dollar , see rates going much higher .
said Morgan 's recent rise prime lending rate `` purely reflection increase whole spectrum rates . ''
Preston reiterated earlier company forecasts U.S. economy show roughly 2.5 three pct real growth year .
also said consequence dollar 's decline oil price rises , inflation would rise `` moderately '' 3.5 four pct rate 1987 .

analysts meeting company said year ending April 30 , 1987 earn 73 mln dlrs , 5.15-5.35 dlrs share sales 500 mln dlrs .
year ago period , company earned 53.4 mln dlrs , 3.65 dlrs share , sales 402.8 mln dlrs .
Winston Wallin , Medtronic chairman , said company improve market share fiscal 1988 cardiac pacemakers expand cardiovascular therapeutic product line .
Wallin cautioned analysts quickly change per share estimates company said Medtronic heavy sales marketing expenses fiscal 1988 .
said company intends reinvest earnings businesses dividends .
`` Shareholders better grow business rather reinvest dividends share repurchases , '' said .
Wallin said sees Medtronic 's share total worldwide pacemaker market increasing 42 pct fiscal 1988 , 40 pct fiscal 1987 .
said worldwide market cardiovascualr therapeutic products , includes pacemakers , valves , catheters lasers , valued 2.5 billion dlrs 1990 double 1995 .
Wallin said , `` objective get hold new products start building market share beg , borrow steal get new markets . ''
past , Medtronic 's pacemakers plagued number problems leading product recalls .
Regulators also criticized industry , citing quality problems needless overprescription pacemakers .
`` knowledge major problems pacemakers leads , '' Wallin said .
`` intend re-establish company quality leader industry . ''
Glen Nelson , executive vice president Medtronics , said company intends diversify internally acquisitions companies areas Medtronic 's expertise , drug delivery systems .
Wallin said 15 pct earnings growth fiscal 1988 include dilutions acquisitions .
`` hope safety provisions wo n't major dilutions acquisition . ''
Wallin also said company virtual exclusivity rate responsive pacemakers fiscal 1988 .
company markets Activitrax , first single chamber pacemaker varies heartrate response physical activity .
Siemens AG , West German company , also developing rate responsive pacemaker .

High Command communique said Iraqi troops significant victory continuing advance .
Iraq said foiled three-pronged thrust 10 km ( six miles ) Basra , admitted Iranians occupied ground held Mohammed al-Qassem unit , one three divisions attacked .
communique said Iranian Revolutionary Guards assault warplanes , helicopter gunships , heavy artillery tanks .

( Iran said troops killed wounded 4,000 Iraqis stabilising new positions . )
Baghdad communique said Iraqi planes also destroyed oil installations Iran 's southwestern Ahvaz field raid today .
denied Iranian report Iraqi jet shot .

USDA PROPOSE FOREIGN MEAT INSPECTION RULE U.S. Agriculture Department preparing proposal would require foreign meat products inspected point arrival United States , USDA official said .
Donald Houston , administrator USDA 's Food Safety Inspection Service , FSIS , told House Agriculture subcommittee USDA developing proposed change regulations would put end current practice permitting foreign meat products unloaded one port inspected another port .
Houston said requirement would phased several years `` avoid disruptions economic hardship . ''

newly released annual report , Union Texas said replaced 71 pct production 56 mln barrels oil equivalent last year taking account sale 27 mln barrels U.S. reserves .
Union Texas , nation 's largest independent oil gas producer based revenues , privately-held company owned Kohlberg Kravis Roberts Co Allied-Signal Inc & lt ; ALD > .

majority company 's total energy production United Kingdom , Indonesia Pakistan .
United States , Union Texas said completed evaluation work oil find Alaska 's Colville Delta area .

FED 'S HELLER SAYS MONETARY GROWTH SLOWER Robert Heller , member Federal Reserve Board , said expects `` modest levels '' growth money supply year .
`` view , would logical , also desireable development , '' said speech prepared delivery economic forum Chapman College Orange , Calif. text released Washington .
said effect lower inflation financial deregulation monetary aggregates largely finished .
`` Consequently , monetary growth may return modest levels , '' Heller said .
noted growth money supply slowed mid-January .
`` would surprised monetary aggregates grow rather slowly balance year well , '' added .
Heller said danger renewed price inflation .
`` pricing behavior American producers response price increases foreign competitors crucial economic future , '' said .
Widespread domestic price rises response rising import prices would `` generalize inflationary forces emanating foreign trade sector '' might gain market share U.S. producers .
`` return stagflation late 1970s may well result behavior pattern , '' Heller warned .
said `` Federal Reserve disciplined conduct monetary policy . ''
Heller said said government also exercise fiscal discipline cut deficit spending restraint rather new taxes .
`` imposition new taxes would tend rekindle inflation certainly would make us competitive international markets , '' Heller said .
said U.S. economy expand nearly three pct 1987 , aided higher exports Europe Canada .
free trade agreement currently negotiated Canada `` would exceedingly helpful allowing American producers compete effectively country , '' Heller said .

U.S. MEAT , POULTRY INSPECTION CALLED FAULTY U.S. meat poultry inspection programs incapable protecting consumers contaminated products , groups representing inspectors consumers charged .
`` whole trend inspection last 10 years corrupt degrade system today public constant risk contaminated adulterated meat , '' Kenneth Blaylock , president American Federation Government Employees , told House Agriculture subcommittee .
`` American consumer little reason feel confident safety meat poultry offered today , '' said Rodney Leonard , executive director Community Nutrition Institute .
`` Company management less concerned risk health raising plant output company profits , '' Leonard told hearing House Agriculture Subcommittee Livestock , Dairy Poultry .
Kenneth Morrison , staff associate Government Accountability Project , said inspectors consistently disclose violations federal law , demonstrating `` serious breakdown entire inspection system . ''
Morrison told chicken fat flavoring contaminated `` intestines dragging water trough used flush away condemned product , fecal material , human spit , chewing gum paper towels used plant employees blow noses . ''
Donald Houston , administrator U.S. Agriculture Department 's Food Safety Inspection Service , FSIS , defended government 's program , calling `` one respected public health programs world . ''
FSIS inspects estimated 127 mln head cattle 4.5 billion chicken turkeys every year .
Houston said inspection programs kept pace change , conceded danger chemical residues meat poultry supply increased .
also said , although confident bacterium salmonella eventually could eradicated , would take time much money contain growing problem .
Salmonella , extreme cases cause death , found approximately 37 pct U.S. broilers , 12 pct raw pork three five pct raw beef , Houston said .
number reported cases doubled past 20 years , said , 40,000 cases annually .
`` certainly really found effective means turning disease around , '' said Rep. James Olin ( D-Va. ) National Research Council recommended 1985 FSIS intensify efforts develop rapid diagnostic procedures detecting microoganisms .
meat poultry industries said controls would cost much .
`` Hopefully overreact installing unnecessarily complicated procedures may become obstacles real goal providing increasingly safer , nutritious economical meat supply consumers , '' Stanley Emerling , executive vice president National Association Meat Purveyors , said .
Blaylock , speaking behalf food inspectors , said new program allowing elimination USDA inspection functions certain plants `` voids law letter spirit , must repealed see rising consumer fraud epidemic death illness prevention legal recourse . ''
Subcommittee Chairman Charles Stenholm ( D-Tex . )
said panel would hold hearing salmonella June 2 .

previous agreement Chrysler Renault , letter intent would terminated April nine agreement reached .

sale spirits division made company 's previously announced plan sell spirits wines businesses , said .
wine business sold last month 128 mln dlrs Heublein Inc , part Grand Metropolitan PLC , National Distillers said .
purchase price paid cash , National Distillers spokeswoman said .
sale permits National focus core businesses , chemicals propane marketing .

U.S.SENATE LIFTS BANS NATURAL GAS Senate unanimously approved legislation lift ban new construction natural gas-fired power plants large industrial gas-burning plants .
bill , sponsored Senate Energy Committee chairman Bennett Johnston , also repeals mandatory incremental pricing natural gas designed protect residential consumers major price increases forcing industrial users pay higher market prices .
`` legislation open new natural gas markets , '' Lousiana Democrat said .
gas restrictions enacted 1978 response shortage natural gas predictions higher prices .
`` oil gas prices severely depressed , '' Johnston said .
compromise coal producers , bill requires new baseload electric powerplants designed accomodate modifications necessary burning coal another alternate fuel .

RECENT U.S. OIL DEMAND 2.6 PCT YEAR AGO U.S. oil demand measured products supplied fell 2.6 pct four weeks ended April three 15.73 mln barrels per day ( bpd ) 16.16 mln period year ago , Energy Information Administration ( EIA ) said .
weekly petroleum status report , Energy Department agency said distillate demand 7.9 pct period 2.90 mln bpd 3.15 mln year earlier .
Gasoline demand averaged 6.76 mln bpd , 3.1 pct 6.98 mln last year , residual fuel demand 1.15 mln bpd , 16.9 pct 1.39 mln , EIA said .
far year , distillate demand fell 2.3 pct 3.20 mln bpd 3.28 mln 1986 , gasoline demand 6.63 mln bpd , 0.3 pct 6.65 mln , residual fuel demand fell 4.9 pct 1.35 mln bpd 1.42 mln , EIA said .
Year-to-date domestic crude output estimated 8.40 mln bpd , 7.6 pct 9.09 mln year ago , gross crude imports averaged 3.92 mln bpd , 27.1 pct 3.08 mln , said .
DEFICIT CUTS SEEN UNABLE CURE TRADE DEFICIT Financial analysts say pleased congressional moves trim next year 's federal budget deficit believe actions little help improve U.S. trade deficit buoy economy .
House Representatives expected vote tomorrow approve trillion-dollar budget blueprint coming fiscal year reduces deficit 38 billion dlrs .
Similarly , Senate Budget Committee approved plan would cut federal red ink 37 billion dlrs next year .
`` terms economy , 37-38 billion dlrs infinitesimal , cuts magnitude little impact economy trade deficit , '' said Stanley Collander , Touche Ross federal budget policy analyst .
`` best , small positive effect , '' Collander said interview .
Federal Reserve Board Chairman Paul Volcker repeatedly told Congress cutting federal red ink would go long way help reduce massive trade deficit also help ease downward pressure value dollar .
U.S. government attempted remedy trade imbalance driving value dollar .
Volcker warned fall dollar 's value fraught danger .
decline , said , could refuel inflation imported goods become expensive chase away foreign capital needed finance federal budget deficit .
addition , February , U.S. officials meeting major industrialized nations Paris agreed value dollar dropped enough world exchange rates stabilized around current levels .
part agreement , Japan West Germany agreed take steps stimulate economies United States agreed cut budget deficit .
alternative driving dollar way deal trade deficit , Volcker said recently , reduce U.S. consumption , particularly federal spending .
`` n't deal budget deficit , everything else going counterproductive , '' Volcker said recent testimony Senate Banking Committee .
Volcker also said would prefer tighten government 's purse strings Fed tighten credit supply action needed fight inflationary pressures assure continued flow foreign capital United States .
Analysts say Fed tightening could choke current modest economic expansion threaten recession .
Kemper Financial Services economist John Silvia stressed deficit reduction better none .
said size cuts consideration enough give Federal Reserve Board flexibility needs steer economy keep value dollar plunging world exchange markets .
`` 's doubt deficit reduction helps , objective stabilize dollar perserve Fed 's flexibility conduct monetary policy , answer , 's enough , '' Silvia told Reuters .
U.S. trade deficit become one government's vexing persistent problems .
1986 deficit 169.8 billion dlrs yet little indication year 's figure lower , though administration officials predicted drop 20 30 billion dlrs year 's end .
past , Volcker joked never lost sleep worrying whether Congress would cut much fat federal budget .
hand , also made clear attached gradually declining deficit ceilings set 1986-1991 period last year 's Gramm-Rudman balanced budget law .
new law set ceiling 108 billion dlrs next year 's federal deficit , House Senate Budget Committees conceded budget plans would fall short deficit reduction goal 25 billion dlrs .
`` political reasons , 35 40 billion dlrs 're going get '' Congress present time , said Touche Ross 's Collander .
`` something would extraordinary , remarkable , difficult . ''
Collander said real danger Congress end short deficit reduction goal set Budget panels .
`` extent , become minimum acceptable reduction level , '' explained .
`` Anything less look like failure Wall Street . ''
budget plan debate House floor would lower estimated 171 billion dlr deficit year beginning October one 133 billion dlrs cutting defense domestic programs 38 billion dlrs anticipated spending levels next year .
Senate Budget Committee called deficit nearly 134 billion dlrs 18.5 billion dlrs new taxes amount spending cuts .

ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT - TELECOM KEY JAPAN MINISTRY Japan 's little-known Ministry Posts Telecommunications ( MPT ) emerged international force reckoned , political analysts said .
MPT , thrust spotlight trade rows U.S. Britain , position strength due control lucrative industry ties important politicians , said .
`` ministry standing athwart regulatory control key industrial sector , telecommunications information , '' said one diplomatic source .
`` potent political force , '' diplomatic source said .
MPT finding domestic political prowess always help comes trade friction diplomacy , analysts said .
`` ministry minor ministry people internationalized , '' said Waseda University professor Mitsuru Uchida .
`` Suddenly 're standing centre world community sense , 're loss ( ) face situation . ''
recently ministry embroiled row London efforts Britain 's Cable Wireless Plc keep major stake one two consortia trying compete Japan 's lucrative overseas telephone business .
ministry favoured merger two rival groups , arguing market support one competitor Kokusai Denshin Denwa Co Ltd , monopolizes business .
also opposed major management role planned merger non-Japanese overseas telecommunications firm grounds international precedent exists .
ministry 's stance outraged London , threatened retaliate , Washington , says merger plan evidence Japan 's failure honour pledges open telecommunications market .
Washington also angry ministry moves says limited access U.S. Firms Japan 's car telephone satellite communications market .
Much MPT 's new prominence stems growth sector regulates .
`` happening important shift economy makes ministry important place , '' said James Abegglen , head consulting firm Asia Advisory Service Inc. decision open telecommunications industry competition new set laws passed 1985 boosted rather lessened MPT 's authority , analysts said .
`` legal framework eased , became de facto legal framework , '' said Bache Securities ( Japan ) analyst Darrell Whitten .
Close links powerful political faction ruling Liberal Democratic Party ( LDP ) nurtured former Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka another key MPT 's influence , analysts said .
`` factions ignored MPT ( 1970s ) , Tanaka faction forward looking ...
Recognized importance MPT , '' Uchida said .
Many former bureaucrats became members influential political group , added .
ministry also power financial sector due 100,000 billion yen worth deposits Postal Savings System , analysts said .
MPT helped block Finance Ministry plans deregulate interest rates small deposits , key element financial liberalisation , since change would remove Postal Savings System 's ability offer slightly higher rates banks , said .
Diplomatic sources , frustrated see MPT's obstructionist protectionist posture , characterized ministry feudal .
Critics charge MPT protecting turf , limiting competition sheltering former monopolies wing .
Providing consumers best service lowest price takes back seat considerations , said .
many ministry 's actions unlike bureaucratic counterparts much Western world including Britain , several analysts said .
`` United States really odd man , '' Abegglen said .
`` government take view wants keep order utilities markets unusual and/or unreasonable view , '' said .

GERMAN BANKERS ' REMARKS REVIVE TALK RATE CUT Remarks two leading central bankers sparked renewed speculation financial markets cut West German three pct discount rate may discussion , currency dealers said .
Bundesbank board member Claus Koehler said speech monetary growth resulting speculative capital inflows required cuts interest rates .
Separately , West Berlin state central bank president Dieter Hiss told journalists discount rate could fall lowest ever point 2.75 pct .
made clear making forecast interest rates , however .
Currency dealers Far East said dollar gained slight background support speculation .
German dealers noted Bundesbank kept 3.80 pct rate unchanged offered liquidity money market week , dashing expectations may either offer lower fixed rate money offer reduced minimum rate let strength banks ' demands set allocation rate .
allocated 6.1 billion marks new liquidity , much less 14.9 billion leaving market prior pact expired .
weakened sentiment Bundesbank could move accommodative monetary stance , dealers said .
Koehler said speech Surrey , England , speculative capital inflows may cause monetary growth , regardless whether central banks intervened exchange rates fell .
`` words , monetary policy measures required different -- sometimes diametrically opposed -- needed money stock increasing result mounting economic activity . ''
Though Koehler known liberal generally monetarist Bundesbank board , comments marked first time cuts rates concretely suggested counterpoint overly strong monetary growth , dealers said .

SOVIET TRADE DEFICIT WEST SOARS 1986 Soviet trade deficit West almost quadrupled last year , reaching 2.72 billion roubles compared 713 mln 1985 , official figures showed .
Statistics published monthly journal Foreign Trade showed Soviet trade turnover 1986 fell 130.9 billion roubles 142.1 billion previous year , drop 7.8 pct .
Moscow 's trade surplus East Bloc countries continued grow 1986 .
Western analysts attributed deficit rise West world oil price slump , hit Moscow 's main export cut hard currency earnings needed purchases West .

elaborate .

EUROPEAN MARKETS REACT QUIETLY G-7 COMMUNIQUE European currency markets reacted quietly G-7 communique , comments bankers dealers ranging disappointment concrete surprise markets expected much .
dollar opened lower virtually currencies traded narrow range communique , reaffirmed support Paris accord currency stabilisation contained moves strengthen .
Dealers Frankfurt Zurich saw dollar remaining broadly entrenched current trading range .
`` dollar likely stay within range 1.80 1.84 marks , '' said Gisela Steinhaeuser , senior dealer Chase Bank AG .
said resistance climbs .
However , said dollar could break range major surprises worse-than-expected U.S .
Merchandise trade deficit , due next Tuesday .
Theodor Stadelmann , dealer Bank Julius Baer Co Ltd Zurich , said expects dollar hold steady mark Swiss franc weaken yen , possibly 140 yen .
Milan banker shared Stadelmann 's view , saying expects dollar-yen range 140-150 short term .
London traders said G-7 communique failed curb underlying bearishness toward dollar negative sentiment yet strong enough tempt interbank operators test downside .
Concern finance ministers officials still Washington could issue concrete statements favour currency stabilisation kept players sidelined , along worries provoking fresh central bank intervention near term , traders said .
Paris dealers expressed disappointment communique , saying nothing changed reverse dollar's downward trend .
Traders several centres said market would look fresh opportunities test willingness central banks defend current ranges , communique said `` broadly consistent economic fundamentals basic policy intentions outlined Louvre meeting . ''
Dave Jouhin , senior dealer Midland Bank London , said `` 're going put somebody 's resolve test soon . ''
U.S. February trade data may provide trigger , dealers said .
However , dealers said London-based operators would unlikely open major positions next week ahead long Easter weekend .
saw near-term technical support 1.825 marks 145 yen resistance 1.83 marks 146 yen .
Chase Bank 's Steinhaeuser Frankfurt dealers said G-7 communique guaranteed relatively calm stable market foreseeable future compared extreme volatility seen first months year .
One dealer German bank said wording communique made clear leading nations want dollar drop , supporting dollar .
German dealer saw dollar gradually appreciating 1.87 marks , broadly seen upper limit within Louvre accord 's supposed currency target range .
Swiss bank economist said believed markets ready period `` mainly sideways movement . ''
Milan dealers sceptical communique contributing greater stability .
`` Nothing changed substantially give dollar big boost , '' said one dealer , another Italian banker said expects dollar trade 1.77 1.87 German marks next three months .
Swiss monetary source , asked named , said communique line realistic expectations produced disappointment .
`` problem changes needed fiscal trade policies redress current imbalances different timescale currency markets operate , '' source told Reuters , `` political process takes time . ''
Alois Schwietert , chief economist Swiss Bank Corp Basle , also questioned tone disappointment evident currency markets today .
`` people really expect patent remedy ? ''
asked .

senior economist Banque Indosuez said focus trade growth rather interest rates .
move Japan West Germany boost economic growth could lead quick change U.S .
Position .

Bundesbank allotted 6.1 billion marks yesterday new liquidity repurchase pact unchanged rate 3.80 pct , thus subtracting 8.8 billion marks market , outgoing 14.9 billion pact expired .
dealers said smaller volume awarded pact line present liquid money market conditions , exlude cut repurchase pact rate soon 3.70 pct money market rates continue present levels .
next opportunity Bundesbank lower rates repurchase pacts tender expected next Tuesday .
Bundesbank officials already said favour discreet rate adjustments repurchase pacts , rather public adjustment leading rates .

Dealers expect volume tender lower 15.2 billion marks flowing , offset incoming funds .
seven billion marks expected flow next week .
flow back market deposited banks .

G-7 members Britain , Canada , France , Italy , Japan , U.S. West Germany said statement consider currencies within ranges broadly consistent economic fundamentals .
Saito called G-7 member nation prepare intervene market strongly enough ensure exchange rates stabilised appropriate levels .

EUROPEAN MARKETS REACT QUIETLY G-7 COMMUNIQUE European currency markets reacted quietly G-7 communique , comments bankers dealers ranging disappointment concrete surprise markets expected much .
dollar opened lower virtually currencies traded narrow range communique , reaffirmed support Paris accord currency stabilisation contained moves strengthen .
Dealers Frankfurt Zurich saw dollar remaining broadly entrenched current trading range .
`` dollar likely stay within range 1.80 1.84 marks , '' said Gisela Steinhaeuser , senior dealer Chase Bank AG .
said resistance climbs .
However , said dollar could break range major surprises worse-than-expected U.S .
Merchandise trade deficit , due next Tuesday .
Theodor Stadelmann , dealer Bank Julius Baer Co Ltd Zurich , said expects dollar hold steady mark Swiss franc weaken yen , possibly 140 yen .
Milan banker shared Stadelmann 's view , saying expects dollar-yen range 140-150 short term .
London traders said G-7 communique failed curb underlying bearishness toward dollar negative sentiment yet strong enough tempt interbank operators test downside .
Concern finance ministers officials still Washington could issue concrete statements favour currency stabilisation kept players sidelined , along worries provoking fresh central bank intervention long term , traders said .
Paris dealers expressed disappointment communique , saying nothing changed reverse dollar's downward trend .
Traders several centres said market would look fresh opportunities test willingness central banks defend current ranges , communique said `` broadly consistent economic fundamentals basic policy intentions outlined Louvre meeting . ''
Dave Jouhin , senior dealer Midland Bank London , said `` 're going put somebody 's resolve test soon . ''
U.S. February trade data may provide trigger , dealers said .
However , dealers said London-based operators would unlikely open major positions next week ahead long Easter weekend .
saw near-term technical support 1.825 marks 145 yen resistance 1.83 marks 146 yen .
Chase Bank 's Steinhaeuser Frankfurt dealers said G-7 communique guaranteed relatively calm stable market foreseeable future compared extreme volatility seen first months year .
One dealer German bank said wording communique made clear leading nations want dollar drop , supporting dollar .
German dealer saw dollar gradually appreciating 1.87 marks , broadly seen upper limit within Louvre accord 's supposed currency target range .
Swiss bank economist said believed markets ready period `` mainly sideways movement . ''
Milan dealers sceptical communique contributing greater stability .
`` Nothing changed substantially give dollar big boost , '' said one dealer , another Italian banker said expects dollar trade 1.77 1.87 German marks next three months .

ministry spokesman said central areas , especially Rhineland , farmers taken advantage warmer weather started plantings past two days .

FAO SEES LOWER GLOBAL WHEAT , GRAIN OUTPUT 1987 U.N. Food Agriculture Organisation ( FAO ) said global wheat coarse grain output likely fall 1987 supplies would remain adequate meet demand .
FAO said monthly food outlook bulletin total world grain output expected fall 38 mln tonnes 1,353 mln 1987 , due mainly unusually high winter losses Soviet Union , drought China reduced plantings North America .
World cereal stocks end 1986/87 forecast rise 47 mln tonnes record 452 mln tonnes , softening impact reduced production .
stocks unevenly distributed , 50 pct held U.S. `` Thus food security prospects 1987/88 many developing countries , particularly Africa , depend crucially outcome year 's harvests , '' FAO said .
FAO said world cereal supplies 1986/87 estimated record 2,113 mln tonnes , five pct higher last season due mainly large stocks record 1986 harvest , estimated 1,865 mln tonnes .
FAO 's forecast 1986/87 world cereals trade revised upwards eight mln tonnes 179 mln due likelihood substantial buying China Soviet Union .

BUNDESBANK SEES CHANGE MONETARY COURSE Bundesbank sees current reason change monetary course , vice-president Helmut Schlesinger told Reuters telephone interview .
Schlesinger responding questions following remarks yesterday Bundesbank board member Claus Koehler West Berlin state central bank president Dieter Hiss , , dealers said , revived speculation German interest rate cuts may discussion .
Schlesinger said comment remarks two central bank council colleagues .
added last central bank council meeting April 2 discussed economic situation mood `` subdued optimism , '' particularly influenced news brought several state central bank presidents .
`` Much going better impression gained public January figures , meantime superseded , '' said .
German January industrial output fell 3.0 pct decline 0.9 pct December .
New industry orders fell 1.9 pct unchanged December .
Bank economists said two together showed economy would either stagnate contract first quarter 1987 .
Aside economic developments , Schlesinger added , steady monetary course important hold dollar/mark rate around current levels Bundesbank president Karl Otto Poehl said attending Washington World Bank/IMF meeting .
Asked , however , Bundesbank could move cut rates repurchase agreements setting next repurchase tender , due next Tuesday , Schlesinger said , `` Since central bank council gives opinion theme every 14 days , hardly probable . ''
Responding question whether Bundesbank moved away policy targetting monetary growth toward one targetting currency rates , Schlesinger said could comment subject negotiations still progress Washington .

Monetary sources said believed U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker considered Tokyo 's package , announced yesterday , major stimulation Japanese economy .
yesterday 's statement seven leading industrial powers endorses yen 's rise around 153 dollar , level February 22 Paris Accord , 145 today .
initial reaction currency markets Far East demonstrates financial markets unconvinced currencies yet reflect economic fundamentals , even though countries appear .
yen sank 145 one point despite intervention Bank Japan .

`` would say happened ( yen ) past several weeks outside range agreed discussions Paris , '' Miyazawa said yesterday .
supplementary budget worth 34.48 billion dlrs announced ruling Liberal Democratic Party eve Miyazawa 's departure Washington , attend yesterday's meetings leading industrial nations .
strongly worded statement terming Japanese action `` extraordinary urgent '' , meeting reaffirmed Paris Accord noting current exchange rates within ranges broadly consistent fundamentals , economic reality .

cooperation agreement resulted concerted central bank intervention 8 billion 9 billion dlrs halt dollar 's fall .
relatively unsuccessful , scale intervention many nations unprecedented recent years .

also said growing feeling among finance ministers central bankers cooperation medium-term policies replaced bickering short-term differences past meetings .

Bonn 's finance minister Gerhard Stoltenberg argues major currency shifts needed remedy huge imbalance West Germany Japan 's trade surpluses America's trade deficit already taken place .
mention made , however , U.S. commitment cut budget deficit even though implied reafffirmation Paris .
European nations Japan believe deficit cuts essential curbing record U.S. trade shortfall reached nearly 170 billion dlrs last year .
similar argument made Capitol Hill earlier week Federal Reserve Board chairman Paul Volcker .
sharp fall redress trade imbalances would `` clearly pose substantial risks renewed inflationary momentum could undermine confidence future financial stability , '' said .
Volcker warned dollar fall might force politically independent Fed drive interest rates .

ministers , meanwhile , also continued talks making policy coordination binding one , Canadian Finance Minister Michael Wilson , said good progress made .

sources said Reagan administration unsuccessfully sounded allies system target zones limit currency fluctuations February meeting .
