GLOBAL ECONOMIC SLOWDOWN RAISES NEW DEBT FEARS global economy expected weaken year , adding new worries already serious poverty outlook , economic analysts said .
finance ministers central bankers attending week 's semi-annual meetings International Monetary Fund World Bank , new figures released IMF add additional concern .
Fund estimated world output would grow 2.7 pct year , versus 2.9 pct last year , 3.1 pct 1985 .
industrial countries , Gross National Product , measure goods services , expected decline 2.3 pct year , compared 2.4 pct 1986 , IMF said .
developing countries , Gross Domestic Product , another measure economic growth , expected fall 3.0 pct 3.5 pct last year .
new figures considered major disappointment poorest countries .
hoped new vitality industrial countries brought sharp decline oil prices would assist economic recovery help cope growing mounds debt .
IMF officials , discussing outlook , said believed industrial country economies would move annual growth rate three pct end decade .
Economic analysts IMF saying time ability keep debt crisis turning economic rout rests sustained economic growth .
Since debtor countries must look wealthier states markets products well financial assistance , economic weakness developed nations ' economies poses fundamental worries .
Debtor countries , including poorest states , avenues open earning foreign exchange , including key one exports .
U.S. economy , fifth year expansion , served mainstay developing country exports , seen rather feeble year , growing 2.3 pct , according IMF .
reason high trade deficit , United States pressuring Japan West Germany ignite economies little apparent success .
IMF study also examines course dollar curious lack impact U.S. trade deficit .
Reagan administration officials saying impact beginning show , although much slower expected .
IMF observed World Economic Outlook `` recognized exchange rate adjustments take time work payments flows -- probably least three years get resonably complete effect . ''
report added , however , `` adjustments may take even time occasion . ''

SPANISH EMPLOYERS WORRIED HIGH INTEREST RATES head Spain 's employers' federation , Jose Maria Cuevas , said employers worried government 's monetary policies high real interest rates hampering investment .
told news conference wage pacts signed far year endangering government 's five pct inflation target .
government 's perceived need control inflation keeping tight rein credit unnecessary , said .
High real interest rates attracting influx speculative foreign capital undercutting government 's target monetary growth , Cuevas said .
Spain 's closely-watched measure money supply , liquid assets public hands , grew annualised rate 17 pct March , 11.4 pct December last year target range 6.5 9.5 pct 1987 .
combat , Bank Spain raised call money rate 14 times far year , 14.5 pct present 11.8 end-1986 .
Cuevas said employers heeding government 's call hold wage increases five pct inflation target year , increases salary reviews awarded last year new wage pacts averaging 5.6 pct first quarter 1987 .
agreements covered less 40 pct Spanish workers , Cuevas said , rest still wage negotiations .
said Spain 's current wave strikes mainly affected state sector , government trying impose five pct wage ceiling .
Cuevas said employers also worried trend Spain 's foreign trade balance .
trade deficit first two months 1987 totalled 233 billion pesetas , 68 pct increase corresponding period last year .
However , employers favour devaluation peseta correct imbalance .

INDIA FOODGRAIN TARGET 160 MLN TONNES 1987/88 India 's national foodgrain target fixed 160 mln tonnes 1987/88 ( Apr-Mar ) , unchanged 1986/87 target , Agriculture Ministry said annual report 1986/87 .
Actual output estimated 151 mln tonnes 1986/87 due failure monsoon rains 15 35 meterological sub-divisions country .
report gave targets various crops estimated harvested crops 1986/87 brackets following , mln tonnes - rice 65 ( 60 ) , wheat 49 ( 49 ) , coarse grains including sorghum millets 32 ( 29 ) pulses 14 ( 13 ) .
Despite failure monsoon rains recent years , possible maintain higher foodgrain production , signifying growing resilience agricultural sector , report said .
strategy increasing irrigation potential along greater use high yielding seed varieites improvement fertiliser efficiency yielding results , said , adding total foodgrain output 1985/86 , 1984/85 1983/84 respectively 150.5 mln tonnes , 145.5 mln record 152.4 mln .
India targeted produce 178 183 mln tonnes foodgrains last year seventh five-year development plan ending March 31 , 1990 .
Taking midpoint 180 mln tonnes target 1986/87 estimated production around 151 mln tonnes , gap 29 mln tonnes made remaining three years plan increasing grain output annually nine mln tonnes .
target achieved good weather , report said .
`` major thrust programme , therefore , better water ( irrigation ) management .
Simultaneously , efforts spread improved technology including timely use inputs ( farm materials like fertilisers ) adequate quantities vigrously pursued , '' said .

SPAIN 35 MLN DLR CURRENT SURPLUS FEBRUARY Spain 35 mln dlr current account surplus February compared 68 mln dlr surplus January 355 mln dlr surplus February last year , Bank Spain figures show .
Spain 's trade deficit narrowed 581 mln dlrs compared 664 mln dlrs January large increase non-oil imports contributed substantial increase 159 mln dlr deficit registered February 1986 .
Exports 2.58 billion dlrs 19 pct compared February last year , imports 46 pct higher last February , totalling 3.16 billion dlrs .
Non-oil imports totalled 2.79 billion dlrs compared 1.91 billion February last year , reflecting large ammount investment goods entering country recovery Spanish economy , Bank Spain said .
Spain 's tourism earnings continued grow totalled 655 mln dlrs February , compared 103 mln dlrs January 502 mln dlrs February last year .

forecast 1986/87 well target 14.8 mln tonnes fixed year , said , adding bad weather hit groundnut oilseed crops .

spokesman commenting VW confirmed would pay unchanged 10 mark dividend ordinary shares 1986 business , despite provision .

also said recommend unchanged dividend supervisory board .
company also set dividend 11 marks new preference shares , issued last year .

LAWSON SAYS COUNTRIES COULD CUT RATES Nigel Lawson , Britain 's Chancellor Exchequer , said countries may need cut interest rates aim maintaining exchange rate stability .
Speaking journalists one day Group Seven countries reaffirmed goals set Paris six weeks ago , said central banks would continue intervene `` necessary . ''
said G-7 countries concerned Japan stimulate domestic demand welcomed measures outlined Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa yesterday .
Lawson said still worried risk simultaneous recession United States , Japan West Germany , though less gave March 17 budget speech British Parliament .
`` anything 'm little bit less concerned , still risk , '' said .
Asked United States consider increasing interest rates support dollar , said , `` need changes relative interest rates , n't need rise interest rates United States . ''
Lawson said concern expressed yesterday's meetings slow progress United States made reducing budget deficit .
`` believe worthwhile progress reducing deficit year .
important thing continue year year , '' Lawson said .
February 22 Louvre accord called efforts stabilize currencies then-current exchange rates .
six weeks followed Japanese yen continued rise dollar despite massive central bank intervention .
Asked whether intervention sign weakness Louvre accord , said , `` n't think .
intervention would called sign weakness . ''
Although intervention could cause inflation , Lawson said , `` world appear inflationary mode ... one vigilant . ''
said yesterday 's G-7 statement , affirmed `` current levels '' exchange rates appropriate , `` carefully worded . ''
`` know mean , mean thing , '' said .
Lawson said financial markets seem believe Japanese measures outlined Louvre accord source weakness agreement .
Therefore , G-7 countries welcomed Miyazawa's presentation plans supplemental budget stimulate domestic demand .
particularly welcomed goal immediate increase public works spending , Lawson said package also involved second stage increase expenditures second half year .

POTATO FUTURES TRADING SUSPENDED Trading London potato futures market suspended , Richard Harris , Chairman London Potato Futures Association ( LPFA ) , said statement floor members .
response strong representations Potato Marketing Board ( PMB ) complaining gross distortion price say result large deliveries physical market April futures position expires .
PMB sought immediate suspension futures trading asked LPFA take action restore relationship futures physicals .
Farmers merchants alleged squeeze cornering market Harris pointed recent investigations Association Futures Brokers Dealers ( AFBD ) , International Commodities Clearing House ( ICCH ) parties , found evidence substantiate .
main complaint sections physical market say unrealistic futures premium PMB 's average ex-farm price .
April futures traded morning 168 170 stg per tonne compared PMB's average price 104 stg .
Bill Englebright , joint secretary LPFA said two-tier market physical potatoes .
said quality potatoes short supply prepackers paying 145 165 stg per tonne best samples .
lesser quality grades traded 100 stg .
merchants fear large tonnage delivered April futures contract end month , possibly disrupt physical market .
Harris said LPFA rule book allows management committee take steps necessary correct malpractice assured committee monitoring situation .

U.S. TREASURY 'S BAKER SAYS RATE SHIFTS ORDERLY Treasury Secretary James Baker said changes exchange rates generally orderly improved prospects reduction external imbalances sustainable levels .
remarks IMF 's policy-making Interim Committee , Baker reiterated Group Seven statement last night substantial exchange rate changes since Plaza agreement 18 months ago `` brought currencies within ranges broadly consistent economic fundamentals . ''
Baker said , `` exchange rate shifts generally orderly , improved prospects reduction external imbalances sustainable levels . ''
today , trade current account imbalances `` simply sustainable , '' Baker told ministers .
said Reagan administration resisting `` strong domestic pressure '' trade protection working closely U.S. Congress crafting trade bill .
`` yet sure outcome , ensure bill protectionist , '' said .
Baker also urged International Monetary Fund's executive board review possible modifications Fund's compensatory financing facility annual meeting fall .
`` pay particular attention lack continuing conditionality associated use CFF whether shortfalls export earnings indeed temporary , '' said .

said Administration wanted continue policy gradually reducing deficits restraining government spending promoting economic growth .
Sprinkel said cutting budget deficit best way lower trade deficit .

report , dated March 24 , noted Parana accounts 20 24 pct Brazil 's total soybean crop .
said generally favorable weather early December February helped compensate earlier dryness .
However , hot , dry weather past 20 30 days followed unseasonably brief cold spell second week march raised concern late planted soybeans still immature , impact may localized , report said .
corn crop expected record create serious storage problems , report said .
Due favorable support prices , corn area increased 25 pct expense soybeans , yields expected average , said .
Due late plantings 20 pct corn crop crop harvested .
field trip long truck lines noted grain elevators preference given soybeans corn , report said .
New crop wheat plantings expected decline -- Parana accounts 60 pct total production .
Major reasons decline expected reduced government support price good summer crop harvests .

U.S. MARCH RETAIL SALES CUT LATE EASTER U.S. retailers ' lackluster March sales due late Easter , according analysts expect recovery April .
`` Sales look soft Easter shift , underlying business better numbers indicate , '' said Bear Stearns analyst Monroe Greenstein .
Analysts generally average sales results March April account variation Easter 's occurance .
year , Easter observed April 19 , three weeks later last year .
Analyst Edward Johnson Johnson Redbook Associates said sales March rose unadjusted 2.5 3.0 pct , seasonally adjusted 5.5 pct six pct , compared adjusted 5.7 pct last year .
`` obvious question whether numbers indicate consumer activity slowing , appear liquidity employment rising , '' said analyst Jeff Edelman , analyst Drexel Lambert Burnham .
Overall , analysts said first half sales coming according expectations .
Sales 1987 expected rise 5.5 pct six pct , bit 1986 's rise .
March , sales housewares , furniture big ticket items stronger apparel sales , signaling many analysts apparel sales strong April holiday nears .
`` Sales gains home appliances home fashions reflect continuing strength housing market , '' said Edward Brennan , chairman Sears Roebuck Co & lt ; > reported overall sales gain 4.2 pct .
Brennan said sales women's sportswear also excellent .
`` Sears ' total apparel sales modestly , even modest improvement apparel good accomplishment due fact people buy apparel April , '' said C.J .
Lawrence analysts Harry Mortner .
J.C. Penney Co Inc & lt ; JCP > Dayton Hudson Corp & lt ; DH > among weaker performers comparable stores sales declining 1.5 pct 4.9 pct , respectively .
Penney 's store catalog sales declined 1.3 pct overall Dayton Hudson's overall sales rose 4.8 pct .
Penney chairman William Howell said , `` Sales continued strong catalog operations , geographically , ranged active east weak economically depressed southwest . ''
`` Penney 's shifting away leisure time activity wear apparel lines , yield higher profit margins , currently hurting sales , '' said Greenstein Bear Stearns .
Hudson chairman Kenneth Mackes cited late Easter decline .
Edelman Drexel said `` Hudson tougher comparison exceptionally good 1986 . ''
analysts agreed promotions slightly lower last year .

retailers report first quarter middle May .

SPAIN 'S FOREIGN RESERVES RISE FEBRUARY Spain 's foreign reserves rose 905 mln dlrs February total 17.05 billion dlrs , compared 14.11 billion dlrs February 1986 , Bank Spain figures show .
new accounting system introduced month , Spain 's foreign reserves exclude foreign currency held financial institutions .
previous system , Spain 's foreign reserves would risen 391 mln dlrs February , taking account fall 514 mln dlrs financial institutions ' foreign currency position .
January year , Central Bank 's foreign reserves rose 143 mln dlrs , financial institutions ' foreign currency position fell 118 mln dlrs .

BELGIAN CURRENT ACCOUNT SURPLUS WIDENS 1986 Belgium 's current account surplus , measured cash basis , widened sharply 134.9 billion francs last year 17.5 billion 1985 , Finance Ministry said .
increase due almost entirely sharp rise goods trade surplus 126.1 billion francs 20.4 billion .
services trade surpluses increased 52.4 billion francs 38.9 billion deficit transfers rose slightly 43.6 billion 41.8 billion .
Private sector capital operations showed steeply higher deficit 160.7 billion francs 56.9 billion 1985 .

DISEASE PUTS ZIMBABWE BEEF EXPORTS JEOPARDY Zimbabwe 's beef exports European Community ( EC ) , potentially worth 70 mln Zimbabwean dlrs year , may jeopardised outbreak foot mouth disease southwestern Matabeleland , industry sources said .
country temporarily suspended beef exports EC outbreak awaits decision EC veterinary committee , considering formal ban .
outbreak country 's main ranching province already led neighbouring beef-producing Botswana Zambia bar beef dairy imports Zimbabwe , threatening dairy industry loss least one mln dlrs export revenue .
`` situation still uncertain moment .
Normally outbreak occurs automatic suspension beef exports , '' one industry source said yesterday .
Commenting EC policy , explained , `` Depending seriousness outbreak ( veterinary ) committee decides three options , allowing us continue exporting beef disease-free areas , clamping three-month suspension exports banning us exporting year .
still awaiting decision , '' added , asking identified .
Zimbabwe granted export quota 8,100 tonnes high-grade beef EC markets 1985 country spent millions dollars erecting disease-control fences upgrading abattoirs meet stringent EC rules .
EC ban Zimbabwean exports , country forced sell beef glutted world beef markets low prices , source said .
Projected earnings beef sales could fall 23 mln dlrs result , said .

CONGRESSMAN INTRODUCES REAGAN SUGAR BILL Rep. John Porter , R-Ill. , introduced House Representatives legislation proposed Reagan administration slash U.S. sugar price support , spokesman Porter said .
spokesman said bill introduced without changes administration 's proposal sent Congress last month .
plan calls cut sugar loan rate 12 cents per pound 18 cents .
Sugar growers would compensated price cut targeted direct payments , gradually phased-out 1990 .
payments growers would cost estimated 1.1 billion dlrs .
Representatives sugar growers rejected proposal , saying would ruin domestic sugar industry .

CANADIAN BANK RATE RISES WEEK Canada 's key bank rate rose 7.20 pct 7.15 pct week , Bank Canada said .
Bank rate set 1/4 percentage point average yield weekly issue 91-day treasury bills .
week's yield 6.95 pct compared previous week 's 6.90 pct .
Tenders accepted 2.55 billion dlrs 91-day bills average price 98.296 dlrs 98.310 dlrs last week .
1.40 billion dlrs 182-day bills priced average 96.488 dlrs 96.549 dlrs last week , yield average 7.30 pct , versus 7.17 pct last week .
500 mln dlrs 364-day bills priced average 92.969 dlrs 93.159 dlrs last week , yield average 7.58 pct versus 7.38 pct last week .
Tenders received next week 2.50 billion dlrs 91-day bills , 1.40 billion dlrs 182-day bills 500 mln dlrs 364-day bills .

official denied trade reports government might substituted private deal Islamic Corp original tender .

committee also voted legally-binding quantity quality requirements materials , mostly metals .
measures part Defense Authorization Bill voted House next month .
purpose measures , passed committee yesterday , improve stockpile management discourage sell-offs materials could jeopardize strategic needs , staff member committee told Reuters .

`` Management stockpile last 10 years atrocious . ''

staffer said measures passed committee Secretary Defense would influence decisions keep sell strategic stockpile materials .
administration proposed goal 700 million dlrs worth strategic materials held stockpile .
stockpile contains around 10 billion dlrs materials .
said several agencies currently helped FEMA manage stockpile decide much sell help deficit .
agencies included Office Management Budget Departments Interior Commerce , said .
committee believed shared involvement stockpile management counter-productive , said .
CANADA TRADE RISE SEEN START RECOVERY Canada 's trade picture brightened considerably , underscoring economists ' predictions sector would post long awaited recovery year .
federal government reported today monthly surplus soared 1.25 billion Canadian dlrs February , double January 's 623 mln dlrs surplus sharply higher February 1986 's 189 mln dlr tally .
`` Hopefully 's beginning trend , '' said Richardson Greenshields Canada Ltd economist Susan Clark Toronto .
Economists generally n't expect large gains next months , looking upward trend throughout year .
`` thought trade balance would improve ... year , certainly looks morning 's figure indicative , '' commented economist James Donegan Toronto securities firm Midland Doherty Ltd. Statistics Canada reported surplus driven 23 pct gain automobile product exports record 3.2 billion dls month .
`` Recovery automotive sector helped push value exports 5.9 pct February , '' agency said monthly report .
Total exports expanded 10.44 billion dlrs 9.85 billion dlrs February , imports slipped 9.19 billion dlrs 9.23 billion dlrs .
Economists predicted 1987 trade surplus would end three five billion dlrs higher last year 's dismal 10.1 billion dlr total .
1985 surplus 17.48 billion dlrs .
Money market analysts said positive trade news touched modest rally Canadian dollar , rose 76.85 U.S. cts North American markets early morning closing 76.58 cts Wednesday .
currency hovering around 76.78 cts early afternoon trading .
Economists banking improved trade performance year stimulate otherwise sluggish Canadian economy .
Money market analysts said positive trade news touched modest rally Canadian dollar , rose 76.85 U.S. cts North American markets early morning closing 76.58 cts Wednesday .
currency hovering around 76.78 cts early afternoon trading .
Economists banking improved trade performance year stimulate otherwise sluggish Canadian economy .
say country 's consumers , spending torrid pace recent years , sharply curtail outlays year help curtail flow imports country .
Meanwhile , demand Canadian exports United States , far country 's largest market , expected strong result projected rise American consumer spending relatively low value Canadian currency .
`` maintain 's going drive Canada 's export performance income growth U.S. , '' said Midland's Donegan .
Bank Nova Scotia , deputy chief economist Warren Jestin less optimistic U.S. outlook said could mistake read much February's trade upturn .
Jestin said , `` Given fact U.S. economy showing signs weakening -- particularly car sales -- would indicate part strength ( Canada 's trade figures ) probably transitory . ''

indicated totals include reported commitments named unnamed destinations , sales exporters ' account optional origin sales plus actual exports already made respective marketing seasons .

USDA gave detailed breakdowns 1986/87 1987/88 seasons follows , thousand tonnes unless stated -- ( ) - Firm sales declared destination .
( B ) - Ultimate destination yet declared .
( C ) - Sales made exporters ' account .
( ) - Exporter holds option fill commitment supplies origins U.S. ( E ) - Accumulated exports since season began based data reported exporters .
( F ) - Indicated total season .
( G ) - USDA-projected exports season .
Note -- Totals may add due rounding .

HOUSE PANEL WANTS PENTAGON MANAGE U.S .
STOCKPILE House Armed Services Committee voted transfer management stockpiled materials national defense U.S. Defense Secretary .
committee also voted legally-binding quantity quality requirements materials , mostly metals .
measures part Defense Authorization Bill voted House next month .
purpose measures , passed committee yesterday , improve stockpile management discourage sell-offs materials could jeopardize strategic needs , staff member committee told Reuters .
`` ( stockpiles ) stand gain managed properly , '' said staffer .
`` Management stockpile last 10 years atrocious . ''
Responsibility stockpile management belongs White House agency , Federal Emergency Management Agency .
staffer said measures passed committee Secretary Defense would influence decisions keep sell strategic stockpile materials .
administration proposed goal 700 million dlrs worth strategic materials held stockpile .
stockpile contains around 10 billion dlrs materials .
said several agencies currently helped FEMA manage stockpile decide much sell help deficit .
agencies included Office Management Budget Departments Interior Commerce , said .
committee believed shared involvement stockpile management counter-productive , said .

result split , number outstanding shares increase 28 mln 14 mln , company said .

SOVIET UNION IMPORT GRAIN 86/87-USDA U.S. Agriculture Department increased estimate 1986/87 grain purchases Soviet Union 28 mln tonnes , two mln tonnes last month .
monthly report Soviet grain situation , USDA said imports higher earlier estimated Soviet grain buyers actively purchasing last month .
USDA said increased purchasing `` somewhat surprising '' recent higher Soviet crop estimates .
increase estimated imports corn , USDA said .
28 mln tonnes total , 15 mln tonnes wheat , 12 mln tonnes coarse grains , remaining one mln tonnes miscellaneous grains pulses , USDA said .
USDA noted Soviet winter grain crop suffered severe winter spring field work delayed .
severe winter `` believed resulted average winter-kill , '' USDA said .
grain trade analysts said abnormal winter losses maybe one reason Soviet Union actively buying grain recently .
USDA said Moscow already purchased 25 mln tonnes grain delivery 1986/87 , including 14 mln tonnes wheat 12 mln tonnes coarse grain .
DISNEY FAMILY MAKES BID HOLLY SUGAR & lt ; HLY > Roy Disney family disclosed filing Securities Exchange Commission made bid acquire Holly Sugar Corp package cash securities .
Shamrock Holdings California Inc , Disney family company , said submitted bid April 8 Salomon Brothers Inc , Holly Sugar 's investment banker .
offer 45 dlrs cash , securities face value 70 dlrs , `` contingent payment certificate '' would pay much 70 dlrs 20-year period share Holly Sugar outstanding .
Disney family already holds 101,300 Holly Sugar shares 9.0 pct total outstanding following purchases 12,500 shares March 13-April 17 , Shamrock told SEC .
Shamrock said asked certain information Holly Sugar 's financial condition turned .
said offer therefore subject discussions .
`` opportunity complete due diligence evaluation company , including inspections certain facilities meetings key management personnel , would prepared negotiate aspects proposal , including price , '' said April 8 letter .

USDA REPORTS EXPORT SALES ACTIVITY U.S. Agriculture Department said private U.S. exporters reported sales 200,000 tonnes wheat Jordan , 300,000 tonnes soybean meal Iraq 100,000 tonnes corn Algeria .
wheat Jordan includes 165,000 tonnes hard red winter 35,000 tonnes soft red winter delivery 1987/88 marketing year .
soybean meal sales Iraq includes 180,000 tonnes delivery 1986/87 season 120,000 tonnes 1987/88 season , department said .
100,000 tonnes corn sales Algeria delivery 1986/87 season , said .
marketing year wheat begins June 1 , corn September 1 , soybean meal October 1 .

International American , whose stock halted Nasdaq earlier , said purchase price payable 12 mln dlrs cash balance common shares .
Selling shareholders may earn additional amount maximum eight mln dlrs payable cash based future performance companies acquired three years ending March 31 , 1990 , International said .
acquisition subject certain conditions , satisfactory results due diligence investigations , company said .

speaking reporters sony factory opening .

department said bonuses awarded averaged 38.08 dlrs per tonne wheat delivery May-November , 1987 .
bonus awards made Louis Dreyfus Corp ( 200,000 tonnes ) , Continental Grain Co ( 25,000 tonnes ) paid form commodities CCC stocks .
purchases U.S. wheat completes Export Enhancement Program initiative announced December 31 , 1986 .

government estimated Florida orange production ( excluding Temples ) 122.9 mln boxes versus 124 mln last month .

U.S. OIL DEPENDENCY SEEN RISING RECORD LEVEL United States ' dependency foreign oil sources may reach record levels mid-1990s , according John H. Lichtblau , president Petroleum Industry Research Associates .
Lichtblau , speaking alternative energy conference , said U.S. may depend foreign suppliers much 52 pct oil 1995 , surpasssing previous high level 47 pct 1977 .
`` long term growth dependency foreign oil inevitable , '' Lichtblau said .
much 30 pct U.S. oil imports 1995 could come OPEC nations , said .
Lichtblau said U.S. depended foreign suppliers 33 pct oil 1986 predicted would increase 40 pct 1990 .
`` However , rate growth affected positively negatively government action inaction , '' Lichtblau said .
said one government 's negative actions maintenance windfall profits tax acts disincentive developing existing fields reduces cash flow oil exploration .
Lichtblau called adoption international floor price crude oil help stabilize world oil prices .
`` international floor price adopted industrial countries would clearly much effective measure would much less distortive U.S. imposed alone , '' Lichtblau said .
Development alternate energy sources synthetic fuels well increased development Alaska could lessen U.S. dependency foreign oil , Lichtblau said .
potential alternative supplies could limit willingness OPEC nations raise oil prices , said .
Lichtblau also called federal government offer tax abatements oil drilling , fill Strategic Petroleum Reserve faster rate develop pilot plans alternative energy .

conjunction sale assets , MKI ceased brokering treasury bills , notes bonds , Fundamental said .

separating execution wholesale trades heavy volume smaller lots , large-scale transactions facilitated , company said .

wholesale brokering service begin around April 20 .

U.S. BANK DISCOUNT BORROWINGS 361 MLN DLRS U.S. bank discount window borrowings less extended credits averaged 361 mln dlrs day week Wednesday , April 8 , Federal Reserve said .
Total daily borrowings week fell 99 mln dlrs 591 mln dlrs , extended credits 35 mln dlrs 230 mln dlrs .
week second half two-week statement period ended Wednesday .
Net borrowings averaged 425 mln dlrs first week period .
Commenting two-week statement period ended April 8 , Fed said banks average net free reserves 447 mln dlrs .
Fed spokesman told press conference large one-day net misses Fed 's estimates reserves week ended Wednesday .
week 's borrowings , money center banks accounted 65 pct , small banks almost 35 pct .
Wednesday , net borrowings 1.36 billion dlrs Fed funds averaged high 6.45 pct , money center banks accounted 90 pct borrowing .
Borrowings latest two weeks averaged 393 mln dlrs day , highest since statement period ended January 28 .
Float ranged 250 mln dlrs Thursday one 1.25 billion dlrs Monday Tuesday .
spokesman said Monday 's float included 500 mln dlrs holdover float one Fed branch due mechanical problems .
500 mln dlrs Tuesday 's float reflected non-weather-related transportation float one Eastern Reserve bank .
As-of adjustments ranged minus 500 mln dlrs Monday , cash letter errors two eastern reserve banks corrected , plus 500 mln dlrs Thursday , correction made unposted funds single bank .
first half statement period ended Wednesday , banks held excess reserves first four days week ran deficit Wednesday .
second week , ran deficit Thursday , Friday Monday held excess reserves final two days .

TREASURY 'S BAKER SAYS SYSTEM NEEDS STABILITY Treasury Secretary James Baker said floating exchange rate system effective hoped promoting stability preventing imbalances emerging global economy .
remarks afternoon session International Monetary Fund 's Interim Committee , Baker said suggesting system abandoned .
`` suggest , '' said , `` need something give stability keep headed right direction wind shifts . ''
said indicators serve `` kind compass '' added structural indicators help focus attention policies .
Baker , however , said IMF `` needs move beyond macroeconomic indicators find structural indicators help focus attention policies specific relevance imbalances face today . ''
Treasury Secretary said indicators given prominent role annual economic reviews -- Article IV consultations -- Fund performs .
Baker also told policy making group time IMF adopt earlier recommendations making IMF surveillance relevant national policymakers public .
`` particular , urge increased publicity IMF appraisals developed Article IV consultations , use follow-up reports country actions implement IMF recommendations , greater use special consultation procedures , '' said .
Baker emphasized indicators device `` moving beyond rhetoric action . ''
said provide `` structure system , induce discipline peer pressure process policy coordination . ''
said Fund 's procedures surveillance need reviewed updated reflect use indicators .
`` matter priority executive board , '' said .
Baker also urged Fund develop alternative medium-term economic scenarios countries `` help us focus even clearly important imbalances , identifying options addressing analyzing implications options . ''
said also work done finding paths lead toward possible medium-term objectives .
`` take effective remedial action significant deviations intended course , must definitive ways indentifying right course key variables , '' said .

field located southern Louisiana .
U.S. DOLLAR LOSSES PROPEL BROAD COMMODITY GAINS Commodities gold grains cotton posted solid gains flurry buying today losses U.S. dollar rising interest rates kindled fears inflation economic instability .
Gains pronounced Commodity Exchange New York , gold jumped 12.40 dlrs closed 436.50 dlrs troy ounce , silver 22.5 cents 6.86 dlrs troy ounce .
key factor behind advance anticipation inflation way major industrial nations halt slide value U.S. dollar , said Steve Chronowitz , director commodity research Smith Barney , Harris Upham Co. , New York .
dollar tumbled one day top finance officials seven largest industrial nations reaffirmed commitment support value , despite reports intervention U.S. Federal Reserve Bank , traders said .
Traders said appears industrial nations , known Group Seven , lack ability change long-term direction currency markets .
`` Maybe ideas plans , '' said Chronowitz .
`` , 's evident . ''
`` looks like 's cure let free market take values .
`` One way another , force major trading partners stimulate economies , '' measure correct mounting U.S. trade deficit , Chronowitz said .
`` think markets believe , believed long time , recourse reflate point .
going long tedious process , 's what's happening , '' said .
falling value dollar makes U.S. commodities cheaper foreign buyers , stimulating demand .
time , traders holding stocks bonds saw value investments falling many turning commodities precious metals hedge , said Marty McNeill , metals analyst New York trading house Dominick Dominick .
reaction metal markets reverberated throughout commodities markets , grains , livestock , cotton posted broad gains .
Traders Chicago Board Trade said attention grain markets shifted concern burdensome supplies outlook lower dollar stimulate export demand .
close trading , Agriculture Department raised estimate grain imports Soviet Union two mln tonnes month-earlier report .
Live hogs frozen pork bellies posted sharp gains Chicago Mercantile Exchange , live cattle moderately higher .
Analysts said several factors boosted hog prices .
said hogs n't making weight gains normal time year , farmers busy field work market animals .

MOORE & lt ; MCL > SEES SUBSTANTIAL 1987 PROFIT GAIN Moore Corp Ltd expects 1987 profits continuing operations exceed 1986 results recover 1985 levels company earned 152 mln U.S. dlrs 1.70 dlrs share , president M. Keith Goodrich said .
`` 'll substantial increase earnings continuing operations , '' told reporters annual meeting .
said expected profits would recover last year's lost ground reach 1985 results .
1986 , profits continuing operations slumped 139.5 mln dlrs 1.54 dlrs share .
total excluded losses 30 mln dlrs discontinued operations .
Goodrich said Moore still actively looking acquisitions related core areas business forms manufacturing handling .
`` could large acquisition , '' said asked company could raise much one billion dlrs purpose .
Chairman Judson Sinclair , answering shareholder's question , told annual meeting special resolution passed shareholders create new class preferred shares would allow Moore move quickly decided pursue acquisition .
`` make major acquisition ... means move certain expediency , '' Sinclair said .
Asked resolution designed give Moore protection possible hostile takeover , Sinclair said , `` know threat corporation time . ''

CHILEAN TRADE SURPLUS NARROWS SLIGHTLY FEBRUARY chile 's trade surplus narrowed 102.2 mln dlrs february , 105.4 mln dlrs month last year , 18.2-mln-dlr surplus recorded january 1987 , central bank said .
Exports february totalled 379.4 mln dlrs , 17.2 pct january figure .
Imports fell 9.2 pct previous month 277.2 mln dlrs .
figures month last year 314 mln 208.6 mln dlrs , respectively .
accumulated trade surplus first two months 1987 stands 120.4 mln dlrs 132.8 mln dlrs previous year .
ANALYSTS DOUBT FED FIRMED DESPITE BORROWING RISE Economists said doubt Federal Reserve firming policy aid dollar , despite higher discount window borrowings latest two-week statement period heavy borrowings Wednesday .
Data today show net borrowings Fed averaged 393 mln dlrs two weeks Wednesday , 265 mln dlrs prior statement period .
Wednesday borrowings 1.4 billion dlrs Federal funds averaged high 6.45 pct .
`` One could make case Fed firming , probably n't , '' said William Sullivan Dean Witter Reynolds .
Sullivan said may assume Fed firmed policy modestly support dollar net borrowings two-weeks Wednesday nearly 400 mln dlrs averaging around 250 mln dlrs previous two months .
However , Dean Witter economist noted latest two-week period included quarter end seasonal demand often pushes borrrowings .
`` might argue Fed firming policy , looks like tried play catchup reserve provisions late statement period n't quite make , '' said Ward McCarthy Merrill Lynch Capital Markets .
Fed spokesman told press press conference today Fed large net one-day miss two billion dlrs reserve projections week ended Wednesday .
Still , McCarthy said may cumulative miss estimates week caused add fewer reserves earlier week actually needed .
Fed took market reserve management action last Thursday Friday , first two days week .
added temporary reserves indirectly Monday via two billion dlrs customer repurchase agreements supplied reserves directly via System repurchases Tuesday Wednesday .
Based Fed data today , economists calculated two-day System repurchase agreements Fed arrranged Tuesday totaled around 5.9 billion dlrs .
put Wednesday's overnight System repos approximately 3.4 billion dlrs .
`` quite clear Fed firming policy time , '' said Larry Leuzzi S.G. Warburg Co Inc .
Citing view shared two economists , Leuzzi said Fed really afford seriously lift interest rates help dollar would harm already weak economies United States abroad add financial stress developing countries lenders .
`` believe Fed tightened policy latest statement period explain acted dollar tumbled , '' said McCarthy Merrill Lynch .
said dollar staged precipitous drop new statement period began today disappointment yesterday's Washington meetings international monetary officials failed produce anything would offer substantive dollar aid .
fact , currency dealers said nothing Wednesday 's G-7 communique alter prevailing view yen needs rise redress huge trade imbalance United States Japan .
economists generally agreed Fed aiming steady policy correspond weekly average Fed funds rate six 6-1/8 pct .
rate since early November .
`` 'm sure Fed engineering tighter policy help dollar , suspect , '' said Sullivan Dean Witter .
, however , said Fed probably nudged funds rate goal around 6.25 6.35 pct six 6.10 pct previously .

U.S. MARKETS OFFER GLIMPSE VOLCKER NIGHTMARE Today 's turmoil U.S. Financial markets , bond stock prices tumbling dollar's wake , evidence major shift investor psychology likely spell turbulence ahead , economists said .
two years , markets hailed dollar 's decline cure-all U.S. Trade deficit .
Interest rates fell sharply Wall Street became one-way street , .
confidence cracking financial markets suddenly believe Fed chairman Paul Volcker's often-repeated warnings risks dollar collapse .
`` Volcker 's saying long time dollar freefall would extremely dangerous - 's got , '' said David Jones , economist Aubrey G. Lanston Co Inc .
dollar fell 144 yen today first time 40 years Group Seven finance ministers Washington failed convince foreign exchange market credible strategy redressing global trade imbalances , short depreciation dollar .
Bonds suffered biggest one-day drop months amid worries dollar 's slide rekindle inflation , scare away foreign investors force Fed tighten credit .
inflationary fears boosted gold bullion 12 dlrs 1987 high 432.20/70 dlrs ounce , spike interest rates pulled Dow Jones Industrial Average 33 points 2339 .
Norman Robertson , Mellon Bank chief economist , called markets ' instability frightening .
believes economic fundamentals justify bearishness said `` start ball rolling 's difficult stop . ''
`` 's stark possibility could get destabilizing drop dollar forces interest rates drives us recession .
markets panic . ''
Stephen Marris Institute International Economics Washington , warning long time controlled decline dollar since peaks 3.47 marks 264 yen February 1985 could turn nightmare .
`` 're still less track hard landing ...
agony may fairly drawn , '' Marris told Reuters .
Marris expect crisis peak later year , warned situation fragile would take little touch calls second phase hard landing , whereby loss confidence dollar pushes interest rates leads recession .
stock market 's reaction today sharp drop March 30 shows loss confidence could come .
fact happened yet consistent historical experience , teaches domestic markets affected currency final stages decline , Marris said .
forecast drop 125 yen .
Marris felt major impetus dollar 's latest weakness loss credibility central banks suffered failed prevent dollar falling 150 yen , floor market believes set part G-7 Paris agreement February .
Robertson Mellon , contrast , said loss confidence triggered last week Washington announced plans slap 300 mln dlrs tariffs Japanese electronic imports , raising specter debilitating trade war .
Many economists believe long-run stability return markets root cause trade gap addressed - excessive consumption U.S. , Reflected massive budget deficit .
short term , given failure G-7 central bank intervention , feel Fed choice tighten credit restore faith dollar .
`` thing stop dollar falling substantial increase discount rate corresponding cut abroad , least Japan , '' said Lanston 's Jones .
Marris expects Fed act quickly raise interest rates , even risk increasing debt burden American farmers , Latin American governments others .
Robert Giordano , chief economist Goldman Sachs Co , scoffed notion .
`` 's ridiculous think Federal Reserve raise interest rates dollar weak one currency .
yen strength , dollar weakness , '' said .
Giordano said market ignoring progress made toward reducing U.S. Budget deficit .
`` 're going one biggest reductions budget deficit relative GNP history year , nobody cares , '' said , noting deficit cut 1968-69 greater .
said expect dollar collapse thinks interest rates likely fall back later year .
, market psychology changed abruptly drop bond market ruled .
`` Put helmets , '' Giordano said .

AUSTRALIAN UNIONS NSW GOVERNMENT REACH DEAL Union New South Wales government officials reached compromise dispute workers compensation , averting increased industrial action state , union sources said .
unions , including building mining workers , said dissatisfied deal would continue strikes days .
State officials said government agreed revise proposals cut compensation would allow slightly higher cash benefits injured workers .
original proposal , sparked strikes industrial action state April 7 , workers' compensation would cut one third .
Full details compromise package yet known .
Labour Council , affiliated Australian Council Trade Unions ( ACTU ) , threatened paralyse New South Wales unless government modified pending legislation issue .
State officials said sectors affected past three days government building projects , railway freight movement cargo handling Sydney 's ports .

Oil output halted March 5 earthquake damaged 50 km main pipeline linking jungle oilfields Lago Agrio Ecuadorean port Balao Pacific .
13 km new link , capable carrying 50,000 barrels per day ( bpd ) , built , said .
Ecuador pumped 245,000 250,000 bpd earthquake .
new link connect Lago Agrio Puerto Colon Colombia , starting point Columbia 's pipeline Pacific ocean port Temuco .
government estimates take four months repair Lago Agrio Balao pipeline return output normal levels , spokesman said .

MAY RETALIATE TRADE DISPUTE Japan warned United States may take retaliatory measures United States imposes planned trade sanctions April 17 , senior government official said .
Shinji Fukukawa , Vice Minister International Trade Industry Ministry , said statement Japan would consider measures General Agreement Tariffs Trade actions United States imposes 100 pct tariffs Japanese exports planned next week .
However , Fukukawa said Japan ready continue trade talks United States despite failure convince America call threatened tariffs two days emergency talks ended Washington yesterday .
Last month President Reagan announced sanctions retaliation called Japan 's failure honour July 1986 agreement stop dumping computer microchips markets outside United States open home market American goods .

SMUGGLING BLAMED CLOSURE HAITIAN SUGAR FIRM sugar mill nation 's second largest employer closed doors yesterday , saying run business sugar smuggled Miami neighbouring Dominican Republic .
closure Haitian American Sugar Company ( HASCO ) idle 3,500 employees affect many 30,000 40,000 small sugar cane planters regions around capital , company said .
`` unprecedented ever-growing smuggling , HASCO regrets ...
continue accept delivery sugar cane April 10 , '' mill warned planters earlier week .
Since President Jean-Claude Duvalier fled Haiti fourteen months ago , widescale smuggling basic goods cooking oil , flour , rice , sugar canned milk lowered consumer prices bankrupted several local manufacturers , throwing hundreds thousands Haitians work .
HASCO compound , grim-faced workers lined receive last pay , Spokesman Georges D. Rigaud showed warehouse stocked estimated 445,000 unsold 100-pound ( 45-kg ) bags sugar .
`` closing huge stock unsold sugar .
money left continue operations , '' Rigaud said .
said company owed 7.6 mln dlrs borrowed additional 1.5 mln dlrs order pay workers .
Rigaud blamed mill 's problems order Duvalier two years ago forbidding HASCO refining sugar .
said government began importing refined sugar world market prices reselling huge profit provisional military-civilian government replaced Duvalier last year continued policy .
`` smuggling even state ca n't compete smuggled Dominican refined sugar , '' Rigaud said .
HASCO workers earned 4.20 dlrs daily , considerably usual minimum wage three dlrs .
generally estimated every employed Haitian supports least six people .
Rigaud said HASCO 's closing minimum would affect 280,000 300,000 people .
Laid-off workers bitter closure .
`` 're dead , 's government 's causing us die , '' declared Lucien Felix , 34 , five dependents .

Washington 's deficit Taipei rose record 13.6 billion U.S. Dlrs last year 10.2 billion 1985 .

Taiwan 's 1986 trade surplus Washington third largest , Japan Canada .

DRY SPELL PHILIPPINES DAMAGES AGRICULTURE CROPS prolonged dry spell damaged 111,350 hectares rice corn plantations 10 provinces central southern Philippines , agriculture officials said .
said 71,070 tonnes agricultural produce estimated 250 mln pesos lost lack rainfall .
warned severe drought prevailing conditions continued next month .
Agriculture Secretary Carlos Dominguez said hoped losses would offset expected increase output , normally productive areas affected dry spell .
Affected 14,030 hectares palay ( unmilled rice ) , representing production loss 22,250 tonnes valued 77.8 mln pesos , Department Agriculture reports said .
48,820 tonnes corn 97,320 hectares valued 170.8 mln pesos also lost , said .
Officials said hectarage planted palay hit drought accounted one pct national total thus damage considered negligible .
case corn , said loss filled production non-traditional corn farms diversified cash crop sugar two years ago .
Philippine Coconut Authority said coconut production major producing region Bicol might drop 25 pct 320,000 tonnes dry spell continued .
reports actual damage .

official MTI news agency said government decided consumer price subsidies cut reduce state spending .
today price meat rise average 18 pct beer spirits 10 pct , MTI said .

also announced number measures ease hardship , including higher pensions family allowances .

major tax reform , including introduction Western-style valued added tax , planned January 1988 effort cure problems state spending .
diplomats said latest announcement shows authorities forced act quickly keep year's deficit control .
measures also aimed cooling overheated economy , could help dampen Hungarians ' appetite imported Western goods consume increasingly expensive hard currency , diplomats said .
diplomats also said , however , expect kind social unrest followed sharp price rises East Bloc states , notably Poland .

TEXACO SEES BUSINESS LITTLE HIT BANKRUPTCY MOVE Texaco Inc & lt ; TX > said decision file protection Chapter 11 U.S. Bankruptcy code affect majority businesses .
said subsidiaries , account 96 pct 32.6 billion dlrs revenues 79 pct net property , plant equipment , free action .
parent holding company , Texaco Inc , operating subsidiaries , Texaco Capital Inc Texaco Capital N.V , affected , said .
company said likely suspend 75 cents per share quarterly common stock dividend halt repayments debts 6.8 billion dlrs .
Texaco said filed Chaper 11 suppliers demanding cash payments banks withholding loans result legal dispute Pennzoil Co & lt ; PZL > .
Texaco fighting Texas law requiring post bond 10 billion dlrs appeal 1985 judgment ruled illegally interfered Pennzoil's 1984 acquisition Getty Petroleum Corp & lt ; GTY > .
bond almost matches damages awarded Texaco .
Texaco fail place bond , Pennzoil could begin attach assets secure judgment .
Last Monday , Supreme Court overturned decision cut Texaco 's bond one billion dlrs , sent issue back Texas courts .
Analysts said bankruptcy filing effectively froze Texaco 's obligations continued appeal merits Pennzoil lawsuit .
`` Attempts last week win compromise bond issue larger dispute failed , '' James Kinnear , Texaco's president chief executive officer , told reporters .
Kinnear said Pennzoil 's disclosure court papers Friday wanted extend bond issue hearing end April , pushed Texaco towards Chapter 11 .
Pennzoil asked Texaco post 5.6 billion dlr cash bond reduce dividend 50 pct earnings .
Pennzoil also wanted assurances Texaco would sell assets , Kinnear said .
Texaco offered put one billion dlrs letter credit agreed let value assets fall 11.1 billion dlrs , added .
Joseph Jamail , Houston attorney Pennzoil , said company made latest settlement offer Texaco Saturday taken surprise Texaco filed bankruptcy .
declined reveal amount proposal , citing confidentiality agreement two companies .
`` Texaco told us would get back us instead chose go bankruptcy court , '' Jamail said .
Attorneys Pennzoil said believed company would prevail court appeals , adding Texaco 's assets ample ultimately pay Pennzoil judgment full .

YUGOSLAV ECONOMY WORSENED 1986 , BANK DATA SHOWS National Bank economic data 1986 shows Yugoslavia 's trade deficit grew , inflation rate rose , wages sharply higher , money supply expanded value dinar fell .
trade deficit 1986 2.012 billion dlrs , 25.7 pct higher 1985 .
trend continued first three months year exports dropped 17.8 pct , hard currency terms , 2.124 billion dlrs .
Yugoslavia year started quoting trade figures dinars based current exchange rates , instead dollars based fixed exchange rate 264.53 dinars per dollar .
Yugoslavia 's balance payments surplus convertible currency area fell 245 mln dlrs 1986 344 mln 1985 .
National Bank said drop due deterioration trade .
Exports convertible currency area rose 11.6 pct 1985 , imports rose 17.8 pct .
Retail prices rose average 88.1 pct 1986 industrial producer prices rose 70.6 pct , bank 's data showed .
cost living rose 89.1 pct .
Personal incomes rose 109 pct 1986 .
Prime Minister Branko Mikulic warned February wages high given level productivity .
Mikulic introduced law cutting wages level last quarter 1986 tying future rises productivity .
Bank statistics show overall 1986 rise M-1 money supply 109.1 pct year-end position 3,895.9 billion dinars .
Yugoslavs 9.8 billion dlrs worth foreign currency savings country 20 billion dlrs abroad , mostly owned workers employed western Europe .
dinar fell 73.1 pct basket hard currencies 1986 .
highest depreciation Swiss franc , 85.3 pct , lowest U.S. Dollar , 46.2 pct .

OFFER DOME MAY SHORT-CIRCUIT DEBT TALKS 3.22 billion dlr offer Dome Petroleum Ltd & lt ; DMP.MO > TransCanada Pipelines Ltd & lt ; TRP.TO > may short-circuit Dome 's restructuring plan open door takeover bids , oil analysts said .
Dome trying get approval plan refinance debt 4.5 billion dlrs July 1 , 1987 , interim debt plan allowed Canadian oil gas firm defer substantial payments creditors expire .
Analysts said TransCanada 's bid signals Dome 's debtholders alternative exists Dome 's debt plan .
Dome announced plan 56 major creditors well public noteholders March several months delicate negotiations .
TransCanada 's proposal `` amounts quasi debt restructuring , '' oil analyst Doug Gowland Brown Baldwin Nisker Ltd said Toronto .
Calgary-based Dome 's restructuring plan would allow creditors convert debt common shares formula yet negotiated .
Payments remaining debt would linked cash flow generated assets pledged debt .
`` weakness whole debt-refinancing proposal even approval creditors , assurance Dome fact able repay debt obligations , '' said Wilf Gobert , oil analyst Peters Co Ltd Calgary .
TransCanada 's announcement came surprise since Dome waiting responses creditors proposed refinancing packages , Gobert said .
TransCanada proposal could open bidding Dome since potential buyers probably waiting lenders agree restructuring , added .
`` would think debtholders would want entertain offers ( Dome ) , '' Gobert said .
Dome spokesman David Annesley said New York TransCanada 's announcement could seen attempt fix bidding price Dome effort preclude possible buyers making offer .
`` drawing attention us discussions , means others may little reluctant come forward , '' said .
Dome consider TransCanada 's proposal formal offer pipeline utility 's announcement breached confidential agreement two companies , said .
Dome responded statement suspending discussions TransCanada order pursue talks unidentified parties .
However , Dome said management financial advisers would evaluate proposals , including TransCanada 's .
Gowland said TransCanada 's offer probably fair price company 's 36.1 mln acres oil gas land holdings .
However , said enough financial details known Dome 's debt restructuring compare value TransCanada 's proposed offer .

Partly offsetting outflows , fall note circulation add 340 mln stg , exchequer transactions around 300 mln bankers ' balances target 50 mln .

TRADE ISSUES STRAINING EC 'S PATIENCE JAPAN Member states European Community starting run patience Japan believe repeatedly promised major initiatives open market imports , often made minor moves .
Diplomatic sources said several recent actions EC countries bear witness new disillusionment willingness , least ability , Japanese government reduce massive trade surplus EC .
However , said all-out trade war may far , EC states know would suffer almost much Japan .
Senior EC diplomats gave generally favourable reaction EC executive commission proposal EC could raise tariffs range Japanese products U.S .
Carries threat make similar move April 17 .
EC tariffs , would involve renouncing obligations entered world trade body GATT , would designed stop diversion exports EC market U.S .
diplomats meeting Tokyo announced EC's trade deficit Japan reached record 2.13 billion dlrs March , 1.94 billion February .
1986 , Japanese exports EC totalled 30.67 billion dlrs , 4.5 pct 1985 , EC exports Japan fell one pct 12.43 billion dlrs .
Paris , trade minister Michel Noir said France decided give Japan taste medicine .
Burgeoning imports microwave ovens frozen Coquilles St Jacques restricted strict application French quality standards -- something EC states say often happens exports entering Japan .
Britain threatened withdraw licences Japanese banks insurance companies operate City London , British Cable Wireless company lost competition Japanese telecommucations contract .
However , British officials London said government may gone far implying would take immediate drastic action unless contract reopened .
contrast , West Germany , EC 's successful economy , never threatened Tokyo sanctions , preferring rely firm diplomacy encouragement industries surmount obstacles export Japan .
EC Commission switched tactics recent years , substituting general calls action Japan open market specific demands moves key areas .
present , , instance , pressuring Japan end allegedly discriminatory taxation imported wines spirits , ensure EC companies chance win contracts building new international airport , simplify certification safety checks imported cars .
EC officials say tactics yield benefits , often Japanese announce modifications non-tariff barriers open door imports token amount .
stress , however , action must taken EC whole stop beggar-my-neighbour action .
One problems Britain could face withdraw licences Japanese banks would bankers would welcomed open arms Frankfurt Amsterdam , point .

AWB CHAIRMAN URGES FARMERS CUT PLANTINGS Australia could lose valuable wheat markets lack availability plantings coming 1987/88 season significantly reduced , Australian Wheat Board ( AWB ) chairman Clinton Condon said .
`` predictions 30 pct decrease plantings prove true , Australia may able supply wheat valuable markets , '' said statement .
Condon say made predictions , AWB spokesman said general industry feeling farmers , hard hit low prices rising costs , could cut back plantings sharply .
Wheat sowing normally begins May .
However , Condon said believe plantings would cut much 30 pct although realised many farmers facing enormous financial pressures .
said AWB expects area sown 10.7 mln hectares , 11.3 mln 1986/87 crop 16 mln tonnes .
Final crop estimates 1986/87 planting intentions 1987/88 yet available .
AWB unable , short-term cut plantings , meet needs markets developed much time effort , may great difficulty selling wheat markets future , Condon said .
`` Markets rely steady supply Australian wheat understand decrease production due drought difficulty understanding deliberate decision decrease production , '' Condon said .
`` Australia wants wheat continue major export income earner , governments government authorities need closely examine ways contributing continuing viability wheat industry , '' added .
Australia 's leading wheat markets include China , Egypt , Iran , Iraq , Soviet Union Japan .

Oral proceedings held Hague Friday court said would give verdict within six weeks .

Het Comite claims way levy applied take account currency cross-rates exchange mean compounder one country asked pay higher levy national currency received chain original producer grain .
`` would like Business Administration Court Hague ask Luxembourg Court Justice whether Dutch Grain Commodity Board , levy collection agency , interpreted levy regulations correctly , also whether regulations may contravene European law , '' Pex said .
`` great regret taken route , political help , therefore option even though could take years , '' Pex added .
Het Comite asked CHV act test case grain levy bill company received commodity board included grain wide variety origins therefore considered best general basis legal challenge levy , Pex noted .
Het Comite 's actions run tandem questions levy already posed Luxembourg Court case brought Association European Animal Feed Manufacturers , FEFAC .

INSTITUTES DIVIDED OUTLOOK GERMAN ECONOMY five leading West German economic research institutes failed agree strongly domestic economy expand year revised forecasts contained report published six months ago .
three research groups Kiel , Hamburg Essen predicted institutes ' joint spring report gross national product ( GNP ) would rise two pct 1987 , compared 2.4 pct 1986 .
five institutes jointly forecast three pct 1987 growth October last year .
Taking dissenting view , DIW institute West Berlin Munich 's Ifo institute predicted one pct 1987 growth .
joint report said estimates economic development made DIW Ifo `` markedly less favourable '' three .
DIW Ifo forecast economy would pick slow start year .
`` second half 1987 , however , weak upward movement , '' said .
two institutes said external economic factors currently damaging exports pushing imports would dominate economic environment throughout year .
saw exports falling real 2-1/2 pct 1987 predicted marked improvement course year .
three institutes , however , wrote : `` decline demand production ( seen ) winter months indicate beginning cyclical downswing . ''
said sharp rise mark led corporate uncertainty companies carried investment plans .
expected many investments cancelled put .
`` presumed braking actions ( economy ) diminish markedly year . ''
added : `` domestic prerequisites continuation economic uptrend still favourable . ''
three institutes said diminishing external burdens combined favourable domestic conditions meant upturn demand production could expected spring .
However , projection clouded risks including development mark dollar .
Contrary DIW Ifo , three institutes said exports would continue weak point economy 1987 , `` good reason believe exports soon bottom slight rise emerge course year . ''
predicted overall 0.5 pct fall exports 1987 , 1986 .
three positive institutes saw private consumption rising four pct 1987 , compared 4.2 pct 1986 , DIW Ifo predicted three pct increase .
saw climate equipment investment improving predicted rise four pct 1987 4.6 pct 1986 .
Ifo DIW saw investments rising two pct .
institutes predicted slight decline unemployment .
Kiel , Hamburg Essen institutes said jobless total would average 2.17 mln 1987 compared 2.23 mln 1986 predicted rise number people work 200,000 .
three institutes said new jobs would created mainly private services sector also state context job creation measures .
construction industry likely engage new workers first time since 1980 predicted either rise employment manufactured goods industry slight expansion .
DIW Ifo said rises employment would occur tertiary sector , `` number employed manufacturing industry decline . ''
DIW Ifo said unemployment would decline 2.20 mln 1987 2.23 mln 1986 .
saw current account surplus falling 1987 58 billion marks 78 billion 1986 .
three saw current account surplus 1987 least 60 billion marks predicted trade surplus would fall around 100 billion marks 112 billion 1986 .
institutes agreed consumer prices would start rise 1987 , declined 1986 , five predicted average increase year 0.5 pct .

result merger , Borg-Warner become wholly owned subsidiary AV Holdings .

looking forward working employees Borg-Warner Borg-Warner maintaining strong presence Chicago community . ''

debentures redeemable company 's option first six years 105 pct , seventh year 102.5 pct 100 pct principal amount .
junior subordinated discount debentures maturity 20 years entitled sinking fund commencing 16th year designed retire 60 pct issue maturity .

board Borg-Warner also taken steps redeem poison pill share purchase rights five cents per right , effective immediately .

field , southern sector Gulf Thailand , currently operated U.S. Oil company Texas Pacific Oil Co Inc , unit Canada 's Seagram Co Ltd & lt ; VO.N > .
Thailand 's state oil company & lt ; Petroleum Authority Thailand > ( PTT ) also holds major stake field .

done , said interested taking 30 pct share field , '' Statoil spokesman Willy Olsen told Reuters .

field 's reserves could sold domestically Thailand 's gas distribution network converting gas electricity , sources said .

joint spring report institutes divided 1987 growth forecasts , three predicting two pct expansion two one pct growth .
Gross national product grew 2.4 pct last year .
report said institutes believed `` must done produce dynamic growth additional jobs created . ''
institutes said step improved basic economic conditions taken quickly possible .
`` point view , tax reform planned 1990 brought forward . ''
government plans gross tax reductions 44 billion marks part major tax reform .
net tax relief tax reform amount 25 billion marks .
However , institutes criticised government , timing reform , also question financing left open .
government specified remaining 19 billion marks tax reduction package paid , though said wants cut state subsidies .
institutes said lack clarity Bonn caused uncertainty among companies households exactly would receive tax reform urged quick decision government .
also said government reduce tax preferences , would simplify fiscal system , urged restriction state spending called increase value-added tax .
institutes also criticised Bonn increasing subsidies time reductions pledged .
referred specifically doubling special writedowns small medium sized companies announced package tax adjustments planned 1988 described increase subsidies .
institutes said total subsidies , including tax preferences , reached 80 billion marks 1985 risen since .

institutes said government raised value added tax indirect taxes large portion positive effects resulting lower taxes would lost .
report also noted government progressing slowly plans privatise state companies said deregulation needed .
government aim competition , said .

also tax credits worth 2.5 billion dlrs .

U.K. PRODUCER PRICES SEEN MOVED TECHNICALITIES U.K. Producer price data March roughly expected taking account technical factors affected year-on-year outcome , economic analysts said .
figures showed 0.3 pct provisional , non-seasonally adjusted rise output prices March , unchanged February close average last six months .
year-on-year rise put 3.7 pct , 4.2 pct February .
Chris Tinker , economist brokerage house Phillips Drew , said drop year-on-year rate mainly reflected rise excise duties affected index March last year .
cautioned dangerous read much monthly figure , adding rise 0.2 pct April would take year-on-year rise back 4.2 pct .
Analysts also noted drop manufacturers ' input prices almost entirely due anticipated seasonal factors fall industrial electricity costs .
Duncan Squire Lloyds Merchant Bank said figures slightly disappointing strengthening sterling yet reduced input prices much expected .
Tinker said factor help keep input costs next months , although Tinker added last year 's fall oil prices drop year-on-year comparisons likely lead return rises index rather falls .

statement reacting five institutes ' joint spring report , Bangemann said far call bringing forward 1990 tax reform concerned -- `` government points positive effects growth policy consolidation ( cutting budget deficit ) must allowed endangered . ''
Bangemann also recalled scope tax cuts planned 1988 already increased .
Three institutes predicted two pct economic growth 1987 , exports falling 0.5 pct .
two saw one pct growth said exports would fall 2.5 pct .

said reason believe export demand would start rise course year , partly increase world trade .
ITALIAN GDP ROSE 2.4 PCT 1986 FOURTH QUARTER Italy 's Gross Domestic Product , calculated 1980 prices , rose 2.4 pct fourth quarter 1986 , compared period 1985 , National Statistics Institute ISTAT said .
ISTAT said statement GDP growth fourth quarter 1986 zero compared preceding quarter .
Italy's budget ministry said last month 1986 GDP rose 2.7 pct real terms 1985 .
Imports fourth quarter totalled 26,361 billion lire , 1.4 pct 1985 fourth quarter 6.6 pct third 1986 quarter , ISTAT said .
Istat said exports totaled 23,190 billion lire fourth quarter , 4.1 pct comparable 1985 quarter 6.7 pct third quarter 1986 .
Fixed investments 23,438 billion lire fourth quarter , 0.7 pct preceding quarter 1.1 pct comparable 1985 quarter .
G-7 SEEMS WORRIED MARKETS IGNORE COORDINATION Top officials leading industrial nations appear deeply worried financial markets ignored efforts coordinate policies , believe strengthened talks last week .
Monetary sources said officials exasperated markets , drove dollar rapidly lower severely disrupted bond stock markets , take heed policy commitments Group Seven -- United States , Japan , West Germany , France , Britain , Italy Canada .
Treasury Secretary James Baker went way reassure markets commitment stable dollar statement , French Finance Minister Edouard Balladur underscored saying : `` n't believe Americans want weaker dollar . ''
West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg said dollar 's latest rapid descent `` involves risk -- already tangible threat -- new strong surge inflation , leading renewed rise interest rates . ''
signs , policymakers feared market uproar , seemed accept little could economic picture changed , currencies settled stable pattern result .
seem enthusiasm last week's semi-annual meetings IMF World Bank higher U.S. Interest rates best way curb dollar 's rapid descent .
distaste stems part fears recession .
Outgoing Deputy Treasury Secretary Richard Darman told television interviewers think policy driving dollar would solve U.S. trade deficit .
`` would slow growth Germany Japan would adversely affect trade balance ultimately would drive interest rates would throw us , ( ) recession , slower growth , '' said .
Asked higher U.S. Interest rates would stabilize dollar , Balladur said : `` currency maintained artificially high , artificially high interest rates , healthy . ''
resorting higher interest rates could lead recession , said .
Acknowledging dollar 's latest slide fact life , Balladur said , `` may adjustments course one currencies , fixed rate system . ''
Federal Reserve Board chairman Paul Volcker said might rein credit dollar 's slide deepens .
U.S. Monetary sources also said Washington wanted understood markets seven 's commitments genuine .
`` United States six major industrial countries fully committed implementing undertakings agreements , '' Baker told meetings .
Darman said Baker misinterpreted markets wrongly believed earlier remarks suggested wanted decline dollar .
Baker , Darman said , committed stabilizing currencies current levels .
Last week 's statement seven reaffirmed February 22 agreement Paris Reagan administration agreed reach budget deficit compromise Congress fight protectionism .
West Germany Japan , meanwhile , agreed stimulate domestic demand lead global upturn .
Ministers believed Paris pact bolstered Japan's promise 35 billion dlr supplementary budget .
sources said believed Baker saw major action .
seven seem accept commitment stable currencies applied today 's exchange rates time Paris agreement , dollar stood higher .
Paris accord said , `` currencies ( ) within ranges broadly consistent underlying economic fundamentals , given policy commitments summarized statement . ''
accept dollar 's lower level , especially yen , hard reality nonetheless consistent agreement .
`` ministers governors reaffirmed view around current levels currencies within ranges broadly consistent fundamentals , '' last week's statement read .
Monetary sources said policymakers understood markets focusing instability created gap U.S. Trade deficit surpluses West Germany Japan rather prospective policy changes .

OFFER DOME MAY SHORT-CIRCUIT DEBT TALKS 3.22 billion dlr offer Dome Petroleum Ltd & lt ; DMP.MO > TransCanada Pipelines Ltd & lt ; TRP.TO > may short-circuit Dome 's restructuring plan open door takeover bids , oil analysts said .
Dome trying get approval plan refinance debt 4.5 billion dlrs July 1 , 1987 , interim debt plan allowed Canadian oil gas firm defer substantial payments creditors expire .
Analysts said TransCanada 's bid signals Dome 's debtholders alternative exists Dome 's debt plan .
Dome announced plan 56 major creditors well public noteholders March several months delicate negotiations .
TransCanada 's proposal `` amounts quasi debt restructuring , '' oil analyst Doug Gowland Brown Baldwin Nisker Ltd said Toronto .
Calgary-based Dome 's restructuring plan would allow creditors convert debt common shares formula yet negotiated .
Payments remaining debt would linked cash flow generated assets pledged debt .
`` weakness whole debt-refinancing proposal even approval creditors , assurance Dome fact able repay debt obligations , '' said Wilf Gobert , oil analyst Peters Co Ltd Calgary .
TransCanada 's announcement came surprise since Dome waiting responses creditors proposed refinancing packages , Gobert said .
TransCanada proposal could open bidding Dome since potential buyers probably waiting lenders agree restructuring , added .
`` would think debtholders would want entertain offers ( Dome ) , '' Gobert said .
Dome spokesman David Annesley said New York TransCanada 's announcement could seen attempt fix bidding price Dome effort preclude possible buyers making offer .
`` drawing attention us discussions , means others may little reluctant come forward , '' said .
Dome consider TransCanada 's proposal formal offer pipeline utility 's announcement breached confidential agreement two companies , said .
Dome responded statement suspending discussions TransCanada order pursue talks unidentified parties .
However , Dome said management financial advisers would evaluate proposals , including TransCanada 's .
Gowland said TransCanada 's offer probably fair price company 's 36.1 mln acres oil gas land holdings .
However , said enough financial details known Dome 's debt restructuring compare value TransCanada 's proposed offer .

PORTUGUESE ECONOMY REMAINS BUOYANT DESPITE CRISIS Portugal 's economy , enjoying one buoyant periods decade , may strong enough shrug country 's latest government crisis , analysts said .
April 3 ousting Prime Minister Anibal Cavaco Silva 's government could slow economic reforms investment Portugal continues adapt membership European Community , joined January last year , said .
Cavaco Silva 's minority Social Democratic Party , PSD , toppled parliamentary censure vote left-wing parties .
centre-right administration made economic growth reform priority 17 months office .
1986 , Portugal 's economy grew four pct , current account surplus swelled one billion dlrs inflation fell 10 pct , 20 pct 1985 .
Analysts businessmen said prospects instability worrying felt foundations continued growth badly shaken .
`` economy developed certain self-confidence less dependent political situation , '' said Fritz Haser , economics professor Universidade Livre , Lisbon .
`` market n't see real crisis yet , '' economist Jorge Braga de Macedo told Reuters .
Businessmen identified political instability last 13 years one biggest obstacles lasting economic progress .
PSD administration 16th formed since 1974 revolution .
Portugal 's developing stock markets , however , remain buoyant .
Brokers unit trust managers said recent surge economic confidence PSD rule still largely underpinned continuing optimistic forecasts .
Investment grew nearly 10 pct 1986 Bank Portugal forecast , released day PSD government fell , predicted pace investment overall economic growth would remain similar levels year .
analysts said crisis interrupted current policies could slow economic development .
Soares , expected announce decision end month , either call early elections form new government parties existing left wing-dominated parliament .
Many businessmen said strongly favoured quick elections best solution .
`` good chance majority government could result early elections , '' Confederation Portuguese Industry ( CIP ) president Pedro Ferraz da Costa said .
said optimistic could mean continuation near future liberalisation policies introduced last year .
left-wing parties favour parliamentary solution , PSD said wants early election opinion polls say could win overall majority .
PSD majority would also open way wide-ranging reforms , relaxation labour laws possible denationalisation industry , analysts said .
Cavaco Silva accused left-wing opposition parties blocking key economic reforms .
left-wingers said Portugal 's positive economic results product favourable international conditions cheaper oil raw material imports , PSD policies .

today price meat rise average 18 pct beer spirits 10 pct , MTI said .
measures also aimed cooling overheated economy , could help dampen Hungarians ' appetite imported Western goods consume increasingly expensive hard currency , diplomats said .

2.5 mln British items hallmarked quarter , 11.1 pct year ago period .
four Assay Offices also marked 832,222 foreign gold articles , 2.5 pct last year .
weight terms 7.19 mln grams British gold assayed 15.3 pct increase , 2.95 mln grams foreign gold represented rise 3.1 pct .

total 10,968 kilos silver assayed , 11.1 pct rise .
number platinum items marked fell 12.5 pct 1,785 , weight terms total slipped 8.1 pct 9,849 grams .
spokesman Assay Offices Great Britain said particularly encouraged see percentage increase British manufactured goods .

partially offset new swap arrangements .

Diplomatic sources said several recent actions EC countries bear witness new disillusionment willingness , least ability , Japanese government reduce massive trade surplus EC .
However , said all-out trade war may far , EC states know would suffer almost much Japan .
Senior EC diplomats gave generally favourable reaction EC executive commission proposal EC could raise tariffs range Japanese products U.S .
Carries threat make similar move April 17 .
EC tariffs , would involve renouncing obligations entered world trade body GATT , would designed stop diversion exports EC market U.S .
diplomats meeting Tokyo announced EC's trade deficit Japan reached record 2.13 billion dlrs March , 1.94 billion February .

said EC foreign ministers meet May 25 26 review state trade relations two sides .
EC executive commission asked representatives member states Friday propose renunciation EC pledges world trade body , GATT , unless `` adequate early measures open Japanese market . ''
renunciation would first step imposing stiff increases duties , quantitative limits , Japanese exports .
diplomats said unlikely issue would discussed detail next meeting EC foreign ministers April 27 28 Luxembourg time needed prepare proposals possible retaliatory action .
said commission powers take limited action getting ministerial approval prevent Japanese exports electrical , photographic goods diverted Europe following possible U.S .
Tariff moves .
May , ministers also likely discuss prevent Japan getting extra trading advantage result Spain Portugal joining bloc , obliges gradually reduce tariffs many industrial goods .

said expects 12,000 U.S. employees take advantage retirement incentives announced last year .
