GERMAN INSTITUTES WARN MONEY SUPPLY Four West Germany 's five leading economic research institutes warned excessive monetary growth threatened resurgence inflation .
dissenting view DIW institute West Berlin , echoing recent statements leading Bundesbank officials , said expansion seen last 1-1/2 years necessarily threaten stability .
five institutes issued joint spring report , three -- Kiel , Hamburg Essen -- forecast two pct rise GNP 1987 , West Berlin Munich predicted one pct .
four institutes said expansive policy welcome view slowdown economic activity .
experience shown strong monetary growth eventually leads price rise undoes beneficial effects monetary policy .
Given virtual zero inflation West Germany fears may seem exaggerated , said .
`` often turned past price climate quickly deteriorate , forcing central bank restrictive policy , '' said .
economic costs preventive stability policy less fighting inflation taken hold , said .
four institutes disputed view monetary expansion would slow accord 1987 domestic investors switch liquidity longer term capital market investments following lower interest rates .
`` redispositions may temporarily dampen expansion central bank money stock , automatically lead smaller expansion money supply , '' said .
return growth stability require spectacular central bank moves , could done quietly open market operations repurchase pacts , would avoid interest rate rise dampening inflationary expectations .
DIW institute said monetary policy focused simply growth production potential .
uncertainty exchange rate developments economic weakness factors taken account .
Monetary policy aim interest rate cuts avoid rises boost economy discourage revaluation speculation .
Recent strong monetary expansion threat price stability .
1979/81 inflation following strong 1977/78 money growth reflected causes , rising oil prices falling mark .

GERMAN PRODUCER PRICES FALL 0.1 PCT MARCH West German producer prices fell 0.1 pct March compared February stand 3.9 pct lower March last year , Federal Statistics Office said .
February , producer prices fell 0.3 pct January dropped 4.2 pct levels year earlier .
Statistics Office said producer prices natural gas fallen 3.0 pct March February , heavy heating oil prices 3.2 pct , liquefied gas prices fell 14 pct coffee 7.4 pct cheaper .

department also lowered terminal price hard red spring wheat Minneapolis Duluth 32 cents , said .
addition , USDA cut Pacific Northwest price hard red spring wheat 31 cents , USDA officials asked identified said .
officials said hard red spring wheat prices Chicago , Denver Toledo adjusted amount Pacific Northwest , Duluth Minneapolis .
price changes lead pickup PIK roll activity , Klopfenstein said .
price change decided upon last week effective today , said .
Klopfenstein also said department raised premiums high protein wheat offset drop low protein wheat prices , meaning net price wheat commanding protein premium would remain unchanged .

consider merger equals . ''

TAIWAN ANNOUNCES NEW ROUND IMPORT TARIFF CUTS Taiwan announced plans another round import tariff cuts 862 foreign goods shortly trade talks Washington officials described move help balance trade United States .
Wang Der-Hwa , Deputy Director Finance Ministry's Customs Administration Department , told reporters list products included 60 items asked Washington .
`` move part government efforts encourage imports trading partners , particularly United States , '' said .
said ministry sent proposal today cabinet tariffs products cosmetics , bicycles , apples , radios , garments , soybeans television sets cut five 50 pct .
cabinet expected give approval next Thursday new tariff cuts would implemented possibly starting April 20 , added .
Taiwan introduced sweeping tariff cut 1,700 foreign products last January aimed helping reduce growing trade surplus United States , island's largest trading partner .
Washington however satisfied cuts pressed reductions way cutting huge trade deficit Taipei .
Washington 's deficit Taipei rose record 13.6 billion U.S. Dlrs last year 10.2 billion 1985 .
widened 3.61 billion first quarter 1987 2.78 billion year earlier , Taiwan 's official figures show .
Today 's announcement came departure later today 15-member Taiwan delegation Washington series trade talks U.S. Officials .
delegation 's leader , Vincent Siew , told reporters last night leaving `` heavy heart , '' meaning would face tough talks Washington rising protectionist sentiments U.S. Congress .
Taiwan 's 1986 trade surplus Washington third largest , Japan Canada .
Siew said talks , starting April 14 , would cover U.S. Calls Taiwan open market American products , purchases major U.S. Machinery power plant equipment , import tariff cuts protection intellectual property .
`` afraid time give take talks U.S. , '' said without elaborating .
BULGARIA , ROMANIA GRAIN CROP SEEN LESS FAVORABLE Current prospects year's grain crop Bulgaria Romania appear less favorable 1986 , U.S. Agriculture Department 's officer Belgrade said field report .
report said assessment based travel two countries March 30 April 4 .
said crop conditions better earlier expected following extreme dry conditions last fall prolonged winter temperatures spring .
However , general plant development least three weeks behind normal spring , conditions varied greatly regions , report said .
Fields seeded optimum period last fall , especially receiving supplemental irrigation water ( 65 pct fields observed ) , appeared good condition , little evidence winterkill , others varied considerably , report said .
Fields lacking adequate moisture last fall showed weak uneven stands .
Spotty germination winterkill fields averaged 10 30 pct , said .

1.30 dlrs share , IBM 's first-quarter net income easily topped estimates Wall Street , ranged even dollar 1.20 dlrs .
analysts said pleasantly surprised IBM's performance .
indicated IBM 's chances full recovery hinged several key factors whose impact felt later year .
include success IBM 's new personal computer line , introduced two weeks ago , 9370 minicomputers , begin volume shipments July .
addition , IBM said full benefits early-retirement program cost-cutting moves emerge year progresses .

EC MEAT DIRECTIVE DEADLINE SEEN FLEXIBLE U.S. officials said held little hope European Community , EC , would withdraw controversial meat inspection requirement , due go effect April 30 U.S. meat producers claim cut exports .
officials said expect EC allow U.S. plants continue shipping meat end year provided submit plant improvement program U.S. Agriculture Department .
EC 's so-called Third Country Meat Directive require foreign meat processing plants comply fully EC inspection standards beginning April 30 .
U.S. meat industry prepared petition requesting Reagan administration retaliate EC rule .
issue U.S. meat exports EC valued 132 mln dlrs 1985 .
EC rule would require U.S. plants make changes inspection methods , ranging veterinary staffing use wood .
Last December , EC determined one U.S. cattle , one hog one sheep slaughtering facility could approved without review .
USDA would certify plants corrected deficiencies .
remaining plants history potential shipping EC -- totaling nearly 400 -- would require significant changes plant constructions procedures EC review .
Robert Hibbert , general counsel American Meat Institute , said meat industry expected submit formal trade retaliation petition April 30 .
interagency committee reviewing industry 's draft petition .
official U.S. Trade Representative 's Office said U.S. officials continued press EC withdraw rule , `` chances good time . ''
However , `` expectation '' U.S. government meat industry circles EC continue allow shipments , least end calendar year , U.S. plants submit USDA plan bring operations conformity EC regulation , USTR official said .
U.S. BANKS LIKELY LIFT PRIME RATES SOON Major U.S. banks may lift prime lending rates within days due recent increases borrowing costs speculation Federal Reserve nudging interest rates help dollar , economists said .
first prime rate boost since mid-1984 , banks early April lifted rates quarter point 7-3/4 pct , citing reduced gap prime cost money .
spread narrowed .
`` prime rate increase could happen soon tonight , '' said Robert Brusca Nikko Securities Co International Inc. Brusca said quarter-point prime rate rise eight pct justified spread banks ' cost funds prime rate narrowed less three quarters percentage point .
said spread averaged around 1.4 percentage points since last October fell one point triggered April prime rate rise banks .
`` could easily another prime rate increase soon week , '' said David Jones Aubrey G. Lanston Co. `` 've got fairly good chance prime rate rise near future , '' said Allan Leslie Discount Corp. `` Based spread prime rate funding costs , would ordinarily see prime rate increase , '' said Harold Nathan , economist Wells Fargo Bank .
However , said banks may reluctant lift prime would dampen already fairly weak business loan demand sure Fed maintain recent upward pressure money market interest rates .
Nathan believes Fed let market pressures lift short-term rates recent days help ailing dollar .
said `` widespread belief money market rates stay high , prime rate rise could occur time . ''
Fed officials long expressed concern steep dollar drop could help rekindle U.S. inflation .
dollar fell 40-year low yen Friday , currency traders said Fed central banks supported dollar .
addition buying dollars outright , another way stabilize U.S. currency would Fed push U.S. interest rates higher relative overseas rates .
Based particularly Fed 's reserve management actions Friday today , Nathan Wells Fargo said `` become clear Fed fully resisting upward rate pressure market .
supplying fewer reserves needed . ''
Bank funding costs short long-term interest rates rose sharply Friday today heightened speculation Fed gently firming monetary policy .
Fed supplied far fewer reserves market economists expected .
Friday , Fed added reserves indirectly small amounts via one billion dlrs customer repurchase agreements Federal funds rate banks lend one another high 6-5/16 pct .
funds trading even higher 6-1/2 pct today , Fed arranged slightly larger 1.5 billion dlr round customer repurchase agreements .
`` Fed 's actions Friday today show offering token resistance upward funds rate pressures , '' said Jones Lanston .
`` Fed focusing policy attention mainly need defend dollar , '' Jones said .
believes merely shading policy toward restraint , `` major impact dollar , Fed tighten policy overtly point . ''
Jones expects Fed foster higher market rates becoming restrictive supplying reserves , within four six weeks , raise discount rate 5-1/2 pct .
Jones said U.S. discount rate increase six pct might well accompanied West German Japanese rate cuts aid dollar .
Given likely Fed policy firming , said yield 30-year Treasury bonds ( 8.30 pct ) prime rate may 8-1/2 pct end-June nine pct year 's end .
`` jury still whether Fed tightening policy defend dollar , '' said Leslie Discount Corp .
said tax-date pressures pushing Fed funds lately .
Leslie said Fed actions reserve data pressures abate show whether firming policy .

U.S. AGENCY RULES BRAZIL ORANGE JUICE U.S. International Trade Commission , ITC , voted authorize Commerce Department impose anti-dumping duties imports Brazilian frozen concentrated orange juice .
ITC voted 3-2 favor anti-dumping petition final ruling matter .
Today 's ITC ruling consistent Commerce Department 's final ruling March 9 , activates anti-dumping duty 1.96 pct imports Brazilian frozen concentrated orange juice , Stephen Vastagh , ITC investigator said .
ITC found Brazilian orange juice imports injured U.S. producers .
Commerce Department already ruled imports unfairly priced , lowered 1.96 pct anti-dumping margin preliminary decision last fall set 8.5 pct , Vastagh said .
U.S. government requiring bond posted imports Brazilian frozen concentrated orange juice since Commerce 's preliminary ruling last October 23 , said .
Commerce ruled one major Brazilian producer -- Cutrale -- would excluded anti-dumping duty .
Brazilian imports account 40 pct total U.S. supply , Vastagh said .
December 1985 November 1986 , United States imported equivalent 546 mln gallons Brazilian orange juice worth 622 mln dlrs , said .
Currently , United States requires 35-cent per gallon tariff orange juice imports , Vastagh said .
ITC spokesman said agency would forward final report anti-dumping case Commerce April 22 .
Commerce process anti-dumping order transmit U.S Customs , liquidate bond entries dating Commerce 's preliminary ruling begin assessing duties , Vastagh said .
said 12 Brazilian orange juice exporters , including three major shippers , would affected decision .

ABU DHABI MARKETING SAID BREACHING OPEC PACT senior Abu Dhabi oil official said remarks published today emirate , largest producer United Arab Emirates ( UAE ) , succeeding marketing crude oil without breaching OPEC accords .
Khalaf al-Oteiba , Marketing Director Abu Dhabi National Oil Co ( ADNOC ) , told company 's Petroleum Community magazine ADNOC also keen keep good customer relations .
`` company maintain dialogue care customers accordance market conditions ... take necessary steps guarantee marketing production , '' said .
`` present oil marketing policy ADNOC based adherence OPEC decisions December 1986 control production establish new pricing system attempt stabilize market , '' added .
OPEC agreed last December limit production 15.8 mln bpd return fixed prices averaging 18 dlrs barrel .
Oteiba said stabilization oil market future depended much discipline OPEC showed .
Oteiba said last year , world oil prices dropped , ADNOC 's difficult ever `` practical flexible pricing policy implemented relate changed market environment . ''
said crude oil sales last year jumped average 609,000 bpd 73 pct exported .
Refined product sales totalled eight mln metric tonnes , 67 pct exported .
1985 , ADNOC marketed total 476,000 bpd crude oil 7.2 mln tonnes refined products .

CEPE manager Carlos Romoleroux told reporters Ecuador would begin pumping unspecified amount crude northeastern jungle oilfields end next week preparation send oil new pipeline link-up neighbouring Colombia .
Oil production Ecuador halted March five earthquake damaged country 's main pipeline Lago Agrio , heart Ecuadorean jungle oilfields , pacific port Balao .
take least end July repair pipeline return output normal levels .
country pumping 245,000 bpd 250,000 bpd tremor .
resume limited output meantime , Ecuador constructing 26 mile pipeline linkup , capable carrying 55,000 bpd , Lago Agrio Puerto Colon , starting point Colombia 's pipeline Pacific port Tumaco .
original target date resume limited crude output May eight , scheduled date inauguration Lago Agrio Puerto Colon pipeline , energy ministry spokesman said .

SOUTH KOREA CHANGE POLICIES AVERT TRADE WAR South Korea decided major changes trade , investment finance policies aimed reducing growth balance payments surplus avoiding trade war United States , Deputy Prime Minister Kim Mahn-je said .
Kim told reporters excessively fast rise exports could make South Korea reliant exports , increase nflation produce trade friction .
policy shift , means abandoning Seoul 's goal rapidly reducing foreign debt , worked series ministerial meetings .
Kim , also Economic Planning Minister , said current account surplus , previously expected exceed eight billion dlrs year , would held five billion dlrs increasing imports , accelerating market liberalisation rationalising exports .
said Seoul would try limit current account surplus around five billion dlrs year next years , although trade volume would continue grow .
`` gradually reduce ratio surplus GNP ( gross national product ) current five pct level three pct 1991 , '' added .
Koo Bon-yong , aide Kim , said South Korea 's foreign debt expected fall 40 billion dlrs end 1987 , initial forecast 41.8 billion , 44.5 billion dlrs end-1986 .
`` ( policy changes ) debt expected remain 40 billion dlrs , although could still lower originally projected 41.8 billion dlrs , '' said .
policy change announced two days scheduled arrival U.S. Commerce Secretary Malcolm Baldrige talks Trade Minister Rha Woong-bae .
South Korea U.S. Pressure reduce bilateral trade surplus , rose 7.4 billion dlrs last year 4.3 billion dlrs 1985 .
Kim said policy changes also prompted swing South Korea 's current account surplus 2.06 billion dlrs first quarter 1987 deficit 438 mln dlrs 1986 period .
First quarter 1987 exports rose 36 pct 9.4 billion dlrs .
government would make foreign currency loans worth 2.5 billion dlrs firms willing import capital goods , raw materials equipment , preferably U.S. , said .
`` foreign currency-based loans , carry interest 1.5 points LIBOR ( London Interbank Offered Rate ) , considerable incentives given increase imports , '' Koo said .
Koo said loans would repayable foreign currency .
`` means could become interest-free loans Korean currency continues rise value , '' said .
said South Korean would revalued dollar gradually , added `` believe rapid one-shot changes value . ''
, fixed 839.70 dollar today , risen six pct dollar since beginning 1986 .

world farm market suffers surpluses rising production exporting countries , added .

60,000 TONNES CORN SMUGGLED PHILIPPINES-PAPER least 60,000 tonnes corn worth 240 mln pesos smuggled Philippines past months , Manila Bulletin newspaper said , quoting official National Food Authority ( NFA ) .
official , named , said large corn shortage corruption among customs Coast Guard personnel jeopardised government 's ban corn imports , aimed saving foreign currency .
newspaper quoted NFA Marketing Director Jig Tan saying monthly corn consumption stood 331,000 tonnes national stock inventory 191,732 tonnes .
Tan said continuing drought affecting 49,150 hectares corn led loss 43,725 tonnes corn worth 174.9 mln pesos contributed shortage .
newspaper quoted Linda Geraldez , NFA statistician , saying despite drought shortage , total inventory end January/June crop season expected least 201,000 tonnes .

index based 10 indicators include export values , letters credit received , warehouse stocks , M-1 M-3 money supply figures composite stock exchange index .
JAPAN 'S LDP CALL FLEXIBLE MONETARY POLICIES Japan 's ruling Liberal Democratic Party ( LDP ) call adequate flexible management nation 's monetary polices plan expand domestic demand , senior LDP official told Reuters .
Junichiro Koizumi , head LDP committee working plan , said phrase taken implying immediate cut Japan 's 2.5 pct discount rate .
`` LDP generally believes need discount rate cut moment , '' said .
Koizumi said LDP rule rate cut necessary future .
Bank Japan Governor Satoshi Sumita told press conference Wednesday central bank intention easing credit conditions .
INDIA 'S ANNUAL INFLATION RATE DROPS MARGINALLY Finance Ministry said India's wholesale-price linked inflation rate dropped marginally 5.3 pct fiscal 1986/87 ended March 5.8 pct 1985/86 7.1 pct 1984/85 .
average wholesale-price related inflation stood 5.2 pct March year 5.1 pct year ago , Ministry said statement .
said wholesale prices cement , textiles jute fell 1986/87 , compared previous year , milk , cereals ( mainly wheat rice ) , fruits vegetables , edible oils , tobacco fertilisers costlier 1986/87 .

CHINA TRADE DEFICIT FALLS SHARPLY , RESERVES RISE China 's trade deficit first quarter fell 1.05 billion dlrs 3.04 billion 1986 period , customs figures show .
Zhang Zhongji , spokesman State Statistical Bureau , quoted figures showing exports rose 27 pct 7.28 billion dlrs imports fell 5.1 pct 8.33 billion .
said imports gifts , foreign aid items materials joint ventures excluded , deficit 350 mln dlrs , surplus invisibles 700 mln .
result , foreign exchange reserves increased somewhat level end-1986 , said , gave figure .
Official figures show reserves 10.514 billion dlrs end-1986 , 11.9 billion end-1985 .
Zhang said one reason rise exports improved incentives export firms , allowed retain foreign exchange goods sell .
said first quarter exports Hong Kong Macao rose 35.5 pct 2.48 billion dlrs imports rose 55.3 pct 1.46 billion .
Exports Japan fell 2.3 pct 1.28 billion imports 24.4 pct 2.14 billion .
Exports U.S. Rose 23 pct 640 mln dlrs imports fell 26.7 pct 840 mln .
Exports EEC rose 35.1 pct 770 mln dlrs imports fell 3.8 pct 1.5 billion , said .

China imported 69,952 tonnes Thai sheet rubber last year 60,296 tonnes 1985 .
JAPAN FARM REFORM KEY TRIMMING TRADE SURPLUS Basic reform Japan 's protected farm sector key shifting economy away export domestic-led growth , vital step trim trade surplus , securities analysts said .
farm sector , protected import tariffs quotas , propped subsidies price supports , sheltered tax system , ample room change , said .
`` economic terms , reform would plus , '' said Christopher Chew brokerage firm James Capel Co .
ultimate cost existing system food prices twice Europe two three times U.S. , analysts said .
Spending food accounts one quarter average household 's budget roughly 10 pct gross national product ( GNP ) , according study Chew .
Reducing prices could increase household spending power five pct , study said .
money could spent products would direct impact boosting domestic growth , added .
`` 's lot slack , '' U.S. Government official Tokyo said .
`` money could spent something else . ''
Direct central government subsidies farm sector amount five billion dlrs per year .
Independent estimates put total subsidies sources high 37 billion analysts said much money wasted .
Changing tax laws encourage city residents farm weekends put land sale residential development would also give boost domestic spending , economists said .
`` Housing construction key strategic variable expansion domestic demand , '' wrote Chihiro Nakajima , professor Kyoto Gakuen University .
Japanese business groups calling staged farm reform shift burden trade friction economic restructuring away manufacturing sector onto farm sector .
Employers groups also want change .
`` really want expand domestic demand , way raise wages recklessly , reduce commodity prices , '' Bumpei Otsuki , President Japan Federation Employers' Associations told recent press conference .
External pressures rising U.S. Europe seek removal tariffs quotas help reduce trade deficits Japan .
vested Japanese interests opposed change remain well entrenched , dimming prospects quick reform , analysts said .
Although full-time farm population falling signs LDP paying attention urban constituencies , ruling party remains heavily dependent farm votes rural areas .
One rural vote worth several city votes due pattern constituency borders .
LDP already political trouble tax reform plan want raise another sticky issue soon , analysts said .
Consumer groups politically weak tend accept traditional view higher prices small fee pay national food security , said .
Powerful agricultural cooperatives fiercely opposed import liberalisation , flexible reforms aimed stepping productivity , said .
Reform , comes , response specific pressure rather all-embracing program , said Chew .
JAPAN SEES HIGHER MONEY SUPPLY GROWTH QUARTER Bank Japan said forecast Japan 's broadly-defined M-2 money supply average plus certificates deposit ( CDs ) rise nine pct current April-June quarter 8.5 pct year earlier .
Unadjusted M-2 plus CDs rose preliminary 8.8 pct January/March 1987 compared nine pct rise year earlier , said .
bank said forecast rise due increase floating deposits due recent low interest rates shift private banks Bank Japan 400-1,000 billion yen recently privatised Japanese Railways .
OECD CONSUMER PRICES RISE FEBRUARY Consumer prices countries Organisation Economic Cooperation Development ( OECD ) rose 0.3 pct February inflation rose 2.4 pct year-on-year , OECD said communique .
OECD attributed rise consumer prices effects February 1986 drop energy prices working way index .
February increase less Janauary 's 0.4 pct increase slightly average later months 1986 .
Inflation 24 western industrialised nations January revised 1.9 pct year-on-year .
Retail energy prices rose 0.3 pct , less January's 1.1 pct increase .
Energy prices consumers still nine pct lower year earlier , said .
Consumer prices excluding food energy rose 0.3 pct February , line previous months , although acceleration noticeable U.S. Britain .
Among leading seven industrial countries , consumer price inflation highest Italy 4.2 pct , followed Canada 4.0 pct , Britain 3.9 pct , France 3.4 pct , U.S. 2.1 pct West Germany Japan negative rates 0.5 pct 1.4 pct respectively .

farm trade concessions would unveiled later month , said .

cost transport higher value animal , said .

REAGAN ANNOUNCE DECISION JAPAN SANCTIONS President Reagan today announce decision tough new tariffs Japanese exports retaliate calls Japan 's failure end unfair practices semiconductor trade .
100 pct tariffs imposed 300 mln dlrs Japanese goods recommended curbs special panel experts headed U.S. Trade Representative 's Office .
Reagan announced last March 27 would impose tariffs certain goods taken list ranged computors television sets power tools photographic film .
panel week winnowed list 20 products sent recommendations yesterday Santa Barbara , Reagan vacationing .
March annoucement , Reagan said `` committed full enforcement trade agreements designed provide American industry free fair trade opportunities . ''
added tariffs would lifted Japan honored pact signed last year end dumping semiconductors world markets opened home market U.S. products .
U.S. officials said Japan done nothing since March announcement alter Reagan 's plan invoke sanctions .
White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater said yesterday : `` want trade war , feel kind action requires meaningful action . ''
Reagan 's move follows steadily rising U.S. trade deicits , last year 's hitting record $ 169.8 billion .
one-third deficit trade Japan .
Congress weighing trade bill force president retaliate certain cases unfair trade practices .
opposed legislation , saying would prevent negotiated solutions trade disputes , case , existing law adqeuate end unfair trade practices .
Trade experts say tough action Japanese much penalize Japanese show Congress need new trade legislation .
Japanese complained honoring semiconductor pact , would take time results showed .
U.S. officials , however , said monitoring Japanese semiconductor shipments East Asian countries Western Europe showed letup dumping Japanese home markets remained shut American exports .
Japan said Reagan imposed tariffs , would file complaint General Agreement Tariff Trade ( GATT ) .
said hoped GATT would find U.S. retaliation violated regulations global trading group would approve compensation Japanese retaliation .
U.S. officials said think Japan would retaliate much lose trade war United States .

financial details Amoco offer available Dome spokesman would neither confirm deny Amoco emerged winner , newspaper said .
However , Dome spokesman indicated sale Dome could finalized announced weekend , Globe Mail said .
Representatives Amoco immediately available comment .
Last Sunday , TransCanada announced offer , Dome said also talks two companies , refused identify .
Since , market speculation centered Amoco Exxon Corp 's & lt ; XON > 70 pct-owned Imperial Oil Ltd subsidiary Canada .
British Petroleum PLC & lt ; BP > Royal Dutch/Shell Group & lt ; RD > also mentioned possible suitors Dome .
past two days , Dome management pressured federal government select offer TransCanada , Canadian company bidding .
Prime Minister Brian Mulroney 's government appears want avoid Dome sale foreign company since government gave Dome hundreds millions dollars tax breaks encourage oil gas exploration Arctic , analysts officials said .
purchase TransCanada would least likely run afoul Canadian antitrust laws , however , TransCanada asking tax concessions federal government trying hold deficit 30 billion Canadian dlrs , analysts said .
takeover Amoco Imperial would also give foreign oil company dominant position Canada 's oil industry .
Imperial Oil already Canada 's largest energy company , 1986 revenues 7.1 billion Canadian dlrs .
Chicago-based Amoco 1986 revenues 20.23 billion U.S. dlrs .

FRENCH GOVERNMENT SETS TERMS BIMP SALE French Finance ministry said today public flotation offer opening coming Tuesday 39 pct capital & lt ; Banque Industrielle et Mobiliere Privee > ( BIMP ) set 140 francs per share .
offer closes next Friday .
ministry said statement 51 pct bank 's capital sold solid core large investors , including insurance companies Michelin subsidiary SPIKA , 145 pct public offer price .
Ten pct shares reserved employees , get five pct discount increased 20 pct keep shares two years .
Employees also get one free share one bought , shares held least one year .
Small investors would receive one free share every 10 bought , upper limit five free shares per investor , condition shares held least 18 months .
state-owned capital BIMP comprises 2.51 mln shares .
bank sold public part sweeping programme privatise 65 state-owned groups five years .
separate statement , ministry said last week's privatisation offer 1.07 mln shares & lt ; Banque du Batiment et des Travaux Publics > ( BTP ) 65 times oversubscribed .
BUDGET CHIEF MILLER WARNS FED INTEREST RATES White House Budget chief James Miller said concerned Federal Reserve might `` overreact '' decline value U.S. dollar raising interest rates , move said could cause recession next year .
`` greatest danger overreaction , '' Miller told newspaper reporters yesterday .
`` 'm concerned Fed's overreaction .
'm concerned see recent data showing substantial fall money supply . ''
Edwin Dale , Miller 's spokesman , said remarks , published New York Times today , accurate .
Miller said concerned Fed might overreact signals rising inflation tightening credit -- move said could `` political consequences . ''
White House budget chief appeared referring effect economic slowdown could presidential congressional elections next year .
`` fear get recession deep soup , question , '' said .
Miller said economic slowdown could lead lower tax revenues widening budget deficit .
Miller 's remarks reflected concern U.S. central bank might feel compelled tighten credit means bolstering dollar .
Treasury Secretary James Baker Federal Reserve Board Chairman Paul Volcker recently warned declines value U.S. dollar could jeopardize global growth prospects .
U.S. officials urged Japan West Germany stimulate economic growth countries -- move could boost U.S. exports relieve trade protectionist pressures United States .
BANK FRANCE SEES PICKUP INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITY Bank France said latest monthly report French economy expected pickup industrial production registered March gather steam next months .
Without giving figures , report said last month 's rise , partly linked efforts catch production lost earlier year industrial action , due mainly firming domestic demand .
`` New progress expected main sectors except capital goods production remain present level , '' report added .
upbeat report comes wake grim March trade balance figures showed deficit industrial trade first time since June 1982 .
automobile industry remained unchanged previously boosted levels , consumer goods production grew expected accelerate except area domestic appliances .
Semi-finished goods showed clear increase sectors .
Construction civil engineering , boosted rise public works , also improved , retail trade sales sectors continued slow .
ITALIAN WHOLESALE PRICES 0.2 PCT FEBRUARY Italy 's wholesale price index rose 0.2 pct month-on-month February 1987 increasing 1.1 pct January , national statistics institute ISTAT said .
index , base 1980 equals 100 , registered 173.1 February compared 172.8 January .
February figure represents decline 0.2 pct compared February 1986 year-on-year decline January 1987 1.7 pct .
YEUTTER SAYS JAPANESE CURB CERTAIN U.S. Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter said certain President Reagan would go ahead today impose curbs Japanese exports planned .
Asked television interview chance Reagan cancel scheduled 100 pct tariffs Japanese electronic exports , said `` slim none . ''
Reagan announced March 27 would impose tariffs retaliate Japan 's failure honor 1986 agreement end dumping computer semiconductors world markets less cost open home markets U.S. products .
Yeutter , NBC program `` Today , '' said United States want terminate agreement would drop tariffs Japan began fulfilling agreement .

said frame would reduce vehicle weight cost maintaining structural integrity crashworthiness .
frame fewer parts conventional steel frames , Ford said .
company said lighter weight would allow smaller powertrains suspensions , reducing weight improving fuel economy .

department required law wait 48 hours initial trade report issue second report `` customs value '' basis , eliminates freight insurance charges cost imports .
Private-sector economists emphasized Commerce Department revising deficit 1.45 billion dlrs simply presenting figures different basis .
report Washington Post caused stir foreign exchanges today gave impression , dealers said , underlying trade deficit February revised downward .
Commerce department would like law changed permit report sets figures simultaneously .
`` feeling second one better report there's legislation requires us delay two days , '' said Robert Ortner , Commerce undersecretary economic affairs .
`` going long time one pays attention second figure . ''
15.1 billion dlr February trade deficit compared revised January deficit 12.3 billion dlrs .
law requiring 48-hour delay publishing monthly trade figure excluding freight insurance passed 1979 .

second figure , would always lower deducting freight insurance , presents deficit favorable light Reagan administration .

Robert Crandall , trade specialist Brookings Institution , think tank , said `` shot across bow often result shot stern . ''
said left United States open retaliation .
U.S. officials said 100 pct tariffs Reagan ordered 300 mln dlrs worth Japanese goods also show Congress tough pro-trade stand taken existing laws , new protectionist legislation needed .
past year tough trade action taken European Community corn sorghum , Taiwan beer wine , South Korea counterfeiting copyrights , patents trademarkets Japan tobacco .

Reagan said imposed sanctions certain computers , television sets hand tools Japan honor agreement end dumping semiconductors world markets less cost open markets U.S. products .
tariffs placed items available sources would little effect American consumer , Fitzwater said .
Reagan come heavy pressure take tougher action - especially Japan - end global unfair trade practices reverse growing U.S. trade deficit .
alternative , Congress would .
U.S. trade gap last year record 169.8 billion dlrs , continues rise , Japan accounting one-third America 's overall deficit .
two-way deficits - Canada , West Germany , Taiwan South Korea - Reagan officials said president ready fight .
Reagan said announcing sanctions today `` regret actions necessary , '' health vitality U.S. semiconductor industry essential American competitiveness world markets .
`` allow jeopardized unfair trading practices , '' Reagan added statement California vacation home Santa Barbara .
said tariffs would remain force Japan abided agreement .

aide added , however , `` another plane , example administration uses trade law fight unfair practices , necessary make major overall trade laws . ''
analyst , Crandall , said tariff action best interests United States , negotiations pursued resolve issue .

said , `` n't think makes lot sense . ''

FED DATA PROVIDE NEW EVIDENCE TIGHTER POLICY U.S. banking data released today distorted draw sweeping conclusions monetary policy , support market 's assumption Federal Reserve started tighten grip credit , economists said .
`` 's clear Fed firmed somewhat .
Discount window borrowings , net free reserves , Fed funds rate average pattern reserve additions consistent modest tightening , '' said Dana Johnson First Chicago Corp. Johnson , several economists , estimate Fed funds rate trade 6-1/4 6-3/8 pct .
Discount window borrowings week Wednesday 935 mln dlrs day , producing daily average two-week statement period 689 mln dlrs , highest since week December 31 , 1986 , 393 mln dlrs previously .
Moreover , banks forced borrow huge 5.2 billion dlrs Fed Wednesday - highest daily total year - even though unexpectedly low Treasury balances Fed day left banks two billion dlrs reserves Fed anticipated .
However , economists said almost certain Fed aiming much lower discount window borrowings witnessed week .
pointed two factors may forced banks scramble reserves end week .
First , economists expect M-1 money supply week ended April 29 rise staggering 15 20 billion dlrs , partly reflecting parking checking accounts proceeds stock market sales mutual fund redemptions pay annual income taxes .
banks ' checking-account liabilities rise , reserves required hold deposit Fed .
Required reserves indeed rise sharply 2.5 billion dlrs day two weeks ended Wednesday , economists said Fed may believed magnitude projected M-1 surge late week started add reserves late .
Second , apparent shortage Treasury bills apparently left Wall Street dealers little collateral enagage repurchase agreements Fed , economists said .
Thus , although 10.3 billion dlrs repos outstanding Wednesday night , Fed may wanted add even reserves prevented .
`` 's inconceivable Fed n't add much wanted shortage collateral , '' said Ward McCarthy Merrill Lynch Economics Inc. McCarthy estimated Fed targetting discount-window borrowings 400 mln dlrs day , equivalent Fed funds rate around 6-3/8 pct .
citing reasons Fed probably tightened credit degree suggested data , economists said fact Fed delayed arranging overnight injections reserves last day statement period good sign restrictive policy .
Jeffrey Leeds Chemical Bank convinced Fed tightening policy .
reviewing today's figures , said , `` 's fair say Fed may moving toward slightly less accommodative reserve posture . ''
Leeds expects Fed funds trade 6-1/4 6-3/8 pct said Fed unlikely raise discount rate unless dollar 's fall gathers pace .
Johnson First Chicago agreed , citing political opposition Washington dollar-defense package time Congress sees dollar depreciation key reducing U.S. trade surplus Japan .

Mario Fernandez , executive director Costa Rican coffee institute , said delegates Mexico , Dominican Republic , Peru , Ecuador , India , Papua New Guinea five central american nations participate two-day strategy session beginning May 4 .
main topic reform many producing countries perceive ICO 's unfair distribution export quotas , Fernandez said .
said Costa Rica would press quotas `` based real production export potential country past years '' distribute quotas based `` historic '' production levels rather recent harvests crop estimates .

ECUADOR USE COLOMBIA OIL LINK FIVE YEARS Ecuador use new pipeline link Colombia export crude oil next five years , Colombian mines energy minister Guillermo Perry said .
link inaugurated May 8 .
built allow Ecuador resume exports crude oil halted March 5 earthquake damage Lago Agrio Balao pipeline , pipeline repaired , Ecuador exceed OPEC quota order offset lost income pay debts contracted Venezuela Nigeria since quake , Ecuador mines energy minister Javier Espinosa said .
two ministers speaking news conference signing agreement joint oil exploration exploitation jungle border zone two nations .
Drilling begin September .
`` agreement transport Ecuadorean crude oil emergency period next five years , possibility extension .
20,000 50,000 barrels per day ( bpd ) pumped along , '' Perry said .
Espinosa said Ecuador planned pump 35 mln barrels link next five years , cost 75 cents per barrel first year .
43-km link , maximum capacity 50,000 bpd , run Lago Agrio , centre Ecuador 's jungle oilfields , existing Colombian pipeline runs Pacific port Tumaco .
Espinosa said 32-km stretch link built Ecuadorean side cost 10.5 mln dlrs .
Perry gave figures Colombia 's 11 km segment said `` insignificant compared going earn . ''
OPEC member Ecuador pumping around 250,000 bpd quake .
Lost exports 185,000 bpd costing 90 mln dlrs per month , Espinosa said .

gave 1986 area figures .
magazine said China aims keep 80 pct national farmland grain , 10 pct cash crops 10 pct crops , although ratio vary place place .
said primitive cultivation methods , labour-intensity low productivity make grain least profitable farm commodity .

tariff cuts , five 30 percentage points , take effect July 1 .
brings 157 number goods import taxes cut year , ministry official said .
157 among 290 items Washington asked Seoul lower tariffs , added .

U.S. STUDY SAYS TARIFFS QUOTAS COULD BACKFIRE use tariffs quotas reduce flow foreign goods United States little cut nation 's swelling trade deficit , government study said .
fact , Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) report said , protectionist policies could make U.S. Products less competitive world marketplace raising cost imported products re-exported different forms .
`` policies much likely hurt , rather help , productive capabilities U.S. Economy , '' said .
218-page report , written FTC economists John Hilke Philip Nelson , blamed rising trade shortfall , climbed record 166.3 billion dlrs last year , shifting currency exchange rates growing U.S consumer demand .
factors commonly blamed deficit , foreign trade practices , deteriorating U.S. Industrial competitiveness , high labour costs government restrictions mergers , added little problem , said .
`` Although industry 's competitiveness affects level imports exports industry , general find significant industry-specific changes affecting competitiveness would explain increase overall trade deficit , '' study said .
`` extent government action needed deal trade deficits , policies focus economy-wide phenomena exchange rates relative economic growth , '' FTC study said .
Supporting conclusion broad-based economic shifts cause increase trade deficit , report said found nearly U.S. Industries lost domestic market share foreign competitors 1980s .
also said found `` fairly direct relationship '' increased trade deficit influence shifting currency exchange rates , U.S. Economic growth domestic demand goods services , outpaced foreign consumer demand .
study examined seven factors commonly blamed trade deficit : foreign government subsidies trade barriers protect foreign industries , lack investment U.S. Industry , declining research development U.S. Industry , high labour costs , union work rules , oil prices rises 1970s U.S .
Antitrust regulations .
case , study found little evidence factor impact trade deficit .

productive life , recovered average grade Bulolo 0.3 rpt 0.3 grams tonne 207 mln cubic metres gravel , said .

PHILIPPINE COCONUT CHIEF LOBBY EC TAX Philippine Coconut Authority ( PCA ) chairman Jose Romero said would visit Brussels later month lobby proposed 100 pct European Community ( EC ) levy vegetable oil imports .
`` intend visit Brussels talk whoever putting devilish scheme impoverish third world countries like Philippines , '' Romero said interview .
said know much support levy within EC said believed originally opposed tax pressure change position .
Romero said group EC members led West Germany , Netherlands , Denmark Norway opposed tax .
danger would persuaded change sides , happened opposition could crumble .
Romero said another threat exports lay EC warning copra meal cake used livestock feeds contained dangerous levels aflatoxin , carcinogenic chemical .
said EC standard 0.02 parts aflatoxin per million parts meal , EC countries asked apply October 1988 , rigid .
said Philippine copra cake contained much higher levels aflatoxin .
Aflatoxin comes moulds develop copra properly dried ground .
Romero said would tell big buyers copra meal London Philippines best meet EC standards .
also trying eliminate aflatoxin totally , likely take several years research .
Copra meal exports 817,641 tonnes 35 pct total coconut exports 1986 .
meal worth 73.5 mln dlrs .
Romero said would also visit Oxford University's department agricultural economics discuss ways avoiding copra process altogether .
`` ways producing coconut products outside copra , '' Romero said .
`` process fresh coconut without drying meat sun .
wet process process coconuts food non-food products , go chemical root . ''
said tendency agricultural countries become protectionist expected export prices coconut products drop .
`` long term getting less less production , 'm comfortable , '' said .
countries like Indonesia Malaysia stepping production palm oil , coconut oil substitute , palm oil output risen nearly 70 pct since 1971 , Romero said .
`` add U.S .
Soybean Association spending billions dollars discredit palm oil coconut oil saying polysaturated fats bad heart , '' said .
Romero said expected coconut product export prices stay rest year .
would probably touch high 20 cents/pound current level 18.59 cents , sharp rise year-ago levels 10.50 cents .
Romero said Philippines end five-year coconut production cycle showed production tended fall two successive years good harvests .
said 1985 1986 good harvests year , add production fall , drought affected output .
`` Traders stocking overbought prices start declining .
sure way keep prices stable processing , adding value , '' said .
Coconut farmers encouraged intercrop planting cash crops coconut trees , said .
`` typical farm may 100 150 trees sitting 10,000 square metres land .
's lot space , '' Romero said .
said government 's proposed land reform program would exclude 75 pct coconut farmers less proposed seven-hectares land .
`` idea land reform increase income levels , production employment wo n't happen , '' said .
PCA figures show one-third country's population dependent coconut industry .
Coconuts planted 3.2 mln hectares one-fourth total agricultural land .
PEMEX OFFICIAL SAYS OPEC OUTPUT CRITICAL PRICE Crude oil prices could remain around 18 dlrs barrel end year , OPEC 's decision output next meeting would critical factor , official Mexico 's state oil company , Petroleos Mexicanos ( Pemex ) , told group Japanese businessmen .
Adrian Lajous , Pemex ' executive vice president international trade , said current OPEC output already appeared near 16.6 mln barrel per day level set third quarter .
`` Production surging ahead originally planned , demand growing slowly envisaged months ago , '' said .
said OPEC look carefully level production third quarter would effectively sustain 18 dlrs price , increase originally envisaged might soften price levels .
13-member cartel scheduled meet June 25 Vienna review December accord prices output .
`` hope OPEC follow conservative attitude terms volume decisions , '' Lajous said .
repetition happened last year , OPEC boosted output sent oil prices tumbling 10 dlrs , always possibility , said .
`` hope never go trauma 1986 .
expect oil exporters learned lessons discipline maintained , '' said .
Lajous said still excess supply long remains tendency instability oil markets , prices remain around 18 19 dlrs 1987 output remains control .
said Saudi King Fahd 's remarks last month , increased production important long incomes would affected output , `` relevant welcome powerful producer . ''

lead-zinc mine .

FRENCH SAY WHEAT STOCKS FORECAST SURPRISE U.S. Department Agriculture's forecast French end-of-season soft wheat stocks almost double 1987/88 premature would surprising , according French cereal organisation officials .
Cereals Intervention Board , ONIC , Wheat Producers' Association National Union Agricultural Cereal Cooperatives yet forecast 1987/88 exports end-of-season stocks .
However , officials said USDA 's figure end 1987/88 stocks 5.03 mln tonnes 1986/87 's 2.87 mln surprising given record high yield forecast April .
French Feed Cereals Research Institute , ITCF , forecast mid-April average yield 6.58 tonnes per hectare soft wheat 1987/88 compared 5.6 tonnes 1986/87 record high yield 6.5/6.6 tonnes 1984 .
would result French soft wheat harvest around 31 mln tonnes 25.5 mln 1986/87 , given Ministry Agriculture estimate area planted 4.66 mln hectares 4.61 mln 1986/87 .
ONIC 's first preliminary forecast 1987/88 campaign released beginning September , ONIC official said .
Soft wheat exports 1987/88 extremely difficult estimate stage , within European Community non-EC countries , ONIC official said .
said , however , among countries France could increase wheat exports Egypt Maghreb countries ( Morocco , Algeria Tunisia ) , said .
USDA 's forecast 11.65 mln tonne maize crop 1987/88 11.48 mln 1986/87 , premature , line estimates French Maize Producers Association , AGPM , AGPM official said .
Maize plantings would 1987/88 yields expected higher , AGPM official said .
estimated 1987/88 maize plantings 1.73 mln hectares , seven pct 1.87 mln hectares planted 1986/87 .

exploratory well , spudded depth 2,140 metres , yielded 2,000 barrels oil 180,000 cubic metres gas per day , said .
`` well , one four structures drilled area 80 km north-west Bombay , indicates good prospects oil gas .
've decided drill least three wells starting production commercial scale . ''
Production Bombay High , part Bombay offshore field , stabilised around 500,000 barrels per day last two years .
ONGC produced 27.85 mln tonnes crude 1986/87 ending March , 27.51 previous year .
Bombay High accounted 20.61 mln tonnes , marginally 20.10 year .
India 's total oil output around 30 mln tonnes .

plan developed conjunction ECGD Bank England .

DUTCH OFFICIAL RATE CUT SEEN STILL LIKELY cut half percentage point Dutch official interest rates still prospect , although economists said timing would depend Bundesbank moves .
Speculation rife Dutch Central Bank , encouraged strong guilder/mark relationship wide premiums Dutch money capital market rates German , might lower rates without Bundesbank moving first .
Last month , Central Bank lowered special advances rate 5.1 pct 5.25 pct Bundesbank dropped repurchase tender rate 3.55 pct 3.8 pct .
rate remained force , holding five pct official secured loans rate governs commercial bank borrowings .
Given strong guilder , fall West German repo rate would trigger lower special advances tariff , forcing official Dutch rate cut , analysts said .
February , Bundesbank cut discount rate three pct 3.5 pct , Central Bank lowered money market rates removed surcharge secured loans rate lending three month credit quota .
Since , however , Central Bank Finance Ministry made clear favour lower official rates .
April , Central Bank President Wim Duisenberg said would follow Bundesbank cut , last week Finance Ministry expressed satisfaction raised 2.25 billion guilders six pct coupon state loan priced 100.10 pct effective yield 5.98 pct , lowest since 1965 .
Technically , analysts said , difference secured loans rate applies lending credit quota , tariff special advances add extra liquidity money market .
Bank economists dealers said West German move lower rate securities repurchase pacts would result Central Bank easing special advance rate , provided guilder/mark relationship permitted .
Central Bank aims keep guilder stable around parity value within European Monetary System 112.673 guilders per 100 marks .
Today , foreign exchange buying pushed mark 10 guilder cents 112.705 guilders per 100 fix , level would permit change interest rate differential West Germany Netherlands , dealers said .
economist ABN Bank said expected West German Dutch interest rates ease short term .
However , said new wage agreements West Germany raised inflation expectations would put upward pressure interest rates longer term .
Netherlands , inflation outlook 1987 nil , even negative , latest official economic forecasts point falling rate economic growth .
`` depend outcome collective wage agreement negotiations whether could cost push inflation , '' ABN economist said .
said Dutch money supply growth , ran 3.4 pct January , could also contribute inflation .
Amro Bank , leading analyst said inflation could run two pct next year .
bank expects Dutch capital market rates , currently averaging around 6.1 pct , stop easing second half year stabilize around 5.6 pct .
Analysts said official rate cut could trigger buying spree bond market would bring yields , probably temporarily , money rates could fall five pct .
Currently , periods traded 5.12 5.25 pct money market .

LITTLE REACTION COMEX PRICE LIMIT REMOVAL elimination price limits precious metals contracts trading Commodity Exchange New York appears little effect market , analysts said .
`` nothing apparent change , '' said William O'Neill , director futures research Elders Futures Inc. `` market approached old price limits trading relative quiet , narrow ranges , '' added .
Gold futures , previously limit 25 dlrs market moves back months , 7.00 dlrs weaker nearby contracts amid thin conditions , traders said .
May 5 , COMEX away price limits two contracts following spot volatile market silver futures end April caused severe disruptions .
last week April , silver futures traded price limit back months , causing traders rush spot contract offset moves , analysts said .
result , Elders ' O'Neill said , much confusion , many unmatched trades , large losses .
COMEX fined Elders Futures three large firms total 100,000 dlrs failure resolve unmatched trades timely manner .
Silver futures trading 30-40 cts weaker nearby contracts amid quiet trading today .
O'Neill said elimination price limits COMEX metals futures would add caution trading since contracts could move distance .
`` amore realistic approach metals market 24 hours market prices move without limit , '' O'Neill said .
Paul Cain , vice president Shearson Lehman Brothers , said elimination price limits cut back panic buying selling contribute orderly markets .

One year ago , Gulf Mexico utilization rate 32.5 pct .
Offshore Data Services said drilling contractors reported recent increases 1,000 dlrs day large jackup rigs , command rates 11,000 12,000 dlrs day .

Worldwide rig utilization rose 1.2 pct 57.7 pct , reflecting net increase eight working rigs .
Offshore Data Services said total 419 rigs use worldwide 307 idled last week .

U.S. TRADE BILL DANGEROUS CANADA , LOBBY trade bill United States House Representatives `` dangerous bill Canadian industry , '' Canadian Forest Industry Council chairman Adam Zimmerman told reporters .
changing definition subsidy U.S. countervailing duty law , House Representatives Bill 3 removes protection companies take advantage widely used government programs , Zimmerman told media briefing .
`` Clearly , industry Canadian governments grant rights fish , mine , cut timber , produce power could vulnerable finding subsidy language , '' said .
Canadian forest lobby 's Zimmerman also said House Representative Bill would adopt new way measuring subsidies would greatly increase size countervailing duties might imposed Canadian resource exports U.S .
bill , difference Canadian prices U.S. world market prices would constitute subsidy , said .
method would make Canadian resource industries vulnerable similar penalties like 15 pct export tax imposed last January shipments Canadian softwood lumber U.S. , Zimmerman added .
Canadian negotiators agreed levy new tax U.S. forest industry lobby would drop request countervail duty imports Canadian softwood lumber .
`` represent first victim move price countries ' natural resources according U.S. system , '' Zimmerman said .
`` 're example , resource industries better watch , '' added .
Zimmerman said Canadian Forest Industry Council plans discuss concerns U.S. trade bill lobby groups Canadian resource industries .

EC MINISTERS CONSIDER CUTBACKS STEEL SUPPORT new steel quota system would strictly limit European Community ( EC ) support industry could forced producers fail find solution quickly , officials said .
EC industry ministers meeting considered two key proposals aimed cutting back surplus capacity 30 mln tonnes 1990 .
first would limit current quota system , protected EC output seven years , flat products heavy sections , thereby forcing types steel products free market competition .
second proposal would link continuation quota system progress toward plant closures , although less month ago EC steelmakers ' lobby group Eurofer said abandoned efforts close plants voluntarily .
ministers stopped short imposing solution immediately , instead urging steel producers try reach agreement voluntary cutbacks .
EC Commission said come detailed proposals July future EC steel industry EC industry ministers meet September reach final decision .

CANADA LUMBER EXPORTS MAY BECOME UNPROFITABLE Canada 's softwood lumber become unprofitable forest product producers prices decline 175 U.S. dlrs per thousand board feet two four inch lumber current levels 195 U.S. dlrs , Canadian Forest Industry Council chairman Adam Zimmerman told reporters .
Zimmerman reiterated profitability hurt move Canadian negotiators impose last January 15 pct export tax softwood lumber shipped U.S. exchange U.S. lumbermen 's lobby dropping request countervail duty .
`` think falling market , think moderate slow price , '' Zimmerman said media briefing .
Zimmerman said adverse impact lower U.S. lumber product prices would felt lumber mills eastern Canada first , migrating westward .
`` country swallowed time bomb go times get tough , '' Zimmerman said .
also said federal government maintain existing 15 pct export tax allow provinces offset tax increased provincial fees cutting lumber .

COMPUTER ASSOC .
& lt ; CA > BOLSTERS HAND IBM Computer Associates International Inc's 800 mln dlr merger Uccel Corp & lt ; UCE > eliminate strongest rival , company still faces stiff competition International Business Machines Corp & lt ; IBM > , Wall Street analysts said .
`` IBM still ruling force mainframe systems software , '' said Scott Smith , analyst Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette .
`` combination two companies clearly present much stronger front , '' said .
Besides IBM , `` Computer Associates far away powerful company field , '' added E.F. Hutton analyst Terence Quinn .
field segment market known system utilities , software packages boost productivity company 's data processing facilities increasing speed , power efficiency large mainframe computers .
merger Uccel Computer Associates combines two biggest systems utilities suppliers IBM .
Analysts said remaining players mostly small firms find competition much harder past .
Computer Associates , merger Uccel caps six-year acquisition campaign vaulted Garden City , N.Y.-based company top software industry .
deal completed sometime August , company 's revenues exceed 450 mln dlrs , pushing past Microsoft Corp & lt ; MFST > world 's largest independent software vendor .
Computer Associates founder chairman Charles B. Wang took company public 1981 , since bought 15 companies boosted annual sales 18.5 mln 309.3 mln dlrs year ended March 31 .
Liemandt took charge Wyly , sold non-computer businesses decided would focus solely mainframe computer software .
1984 , company renamed Uccel Corp. Liemandt , said leave company merger completed , also turned acquisitions growth .
last day 1986 , Uccel completed buyouts six companies total 60 mln dlrs .
1986 , earned 17.0 mln dlrs , 1.01 dlrs share , sales 141.5 mln dlrs .
agreement took industry analysts surprise , largely companies bitter rivals .
Also , Dallas-based Uccel engineered strong comeback dark days 1982 , , Wyly Corp , lost 7.7 mln dlrs , 56 cts share .
time , Wyly owned potpourri 13 different businesses , three involved computer software .
1983 , Walter Haefner , Swiss financier major Wyly investor , lured Gregory J. Liemandt away job chairman General Electric Co 's & lt ; GE > computer services unit .
Computer Associates ' Wang Uccel 's Liemandt said news conference merger would give computer users single source wide range software products .
addition system utilities , Computer Associates also sell products microcomputers , Uccel made inroads applications software market , analysts said successful accounting banking systems .
Wang said Computer Associates would continue support enhance companies ' product lines , noted company eventually weed duplicate offerings .
said 20 pct companies ' products overlap .
Analysts said merger would dilute holdings current Computer Associates shareholders 10 pct .
joined Wang forecasting deal dilute Computer Associates ' earnings current fiscal year .
Quinn E.F. Hutton said Wang proven track record completing acquisitions without earnings dilution .
Therefore , said would change 1988 earnings estimate 1.05 dlrs share .
Wang said would look closely combined operations two companies cut duplication sales , marketing research development .
Analysts said Computer Associates paid premium Uccel .
Based Friday 's closing price , company swap 47.50 dlrs worth stock Uccel share , nearly 33 times Uccel 's 1987 estimated earnings 1.45 dlrs share .
Stephen T. McClellan Merrill Lynch Research said software companies currently valued 20 times per-share earnings .
analyst said Uccel worth premium earnings potential customer base .
Wang said Haefner , Swiss investor , would hold 25 pct Computer Associates stock merger .
currently owns 58 pct Uccel .
executive said merger would alter target maintaining sales earnings growth 30 pct 35 pct .
addition , said expects problems deal cleared antitrust division U.S. Justice Department .
Uccel 's Liemandt declined say merger , rule working together Wang .

LITTLE REACTION REMOVAL COMEX DAILY LIMITS elimination limits daily price fluctuations metals futures contracts traded Commodity Exchange , COMEX , appears little effect market , analysts said .
`` nothing apparent change , '' said William O'Neill , director futures research Elders Futures Inc. `` market approached old price limits trading relative quiet , narrow ranges , '' said .
May 5 , COMEX eliminated price limits two contracts following spot delivery gold , silver , copper aluminum futures review clearing operations , severely tested volatile market silver futures end April .
COMEX announced Friday lifting daily limits , effective today .
Gold futures , previously limit 25 dlrs per ounce back months , 7.00 dlrs weaker nearby contracts amid thin volume conditions , traders said .
Silver futures , previously limited 50 cents back months , trading 30-40 cts weaker nearby contracts amid quiet trading today .
last week April , silver futures often traded daily allowable limit amid concerns inflation , dollar , factors .
Traders rushed spot , unlimited , contract offset moves , analysts said .
result , O'Neill said , much confusion , many unmatched trades , large losses traders .
COMEX fined four large firms total 100,000 dlrs failure resolve unmatched trades timely manner .
Paul Cain , vice president Shearson Lehman Brothers , said elimination price limits cut back panic buying selling contribute orderly markets .
O'Neill added elimination daily limits would add caution trading .
`` realistic approach metals market 24 hours market prices move without limit , '' O'Neill said .

TIN TRADERS ' RESPONSE MUTED KL FUTURES MARKET European free market tin traders made somewhat muted response plans Kuala Lumpur dollar-based tin futures market due launched October .
Traders said new market would probably useful trading medium Japan South East Asian tin interests although European traders generally appear reasonably satisfied current `` free market '' system operating since London Metal Exchange , LME , tin trading ceased October 1985 .
Dealers also want see acceptable foreign metal new market sort demand develops forward deliveries .
also view among European traders , proposed Kuala Lumpur tin futures market would provide another useful reference point , market inaugurated Malaysian government -- past viewed major player times trade -- would make participants uncomfortable .
traders expressed preference resumption trading London Metal Exchange , added behind scenes discussion subject definite move unlikely outstanding High Court litigation actions resolved .
Spot tin prices European free market currently around 4,200 stg per tonne high grade metal warehouse Rotterdam .
past 18 months price moved ten year low 3,400 stg March 1986 rebounded high 4,680 stg December 1986 .
compares 8,140 stg last paid LME trading ceased October 1985 record high tin price 10,350 stg traded Cash Standard Grade metal June year .
LME warehouse stocks near two-year low 28,065 tonnes , fallen steadily record high 72,485 tonnes reached February 1986 .
Traders said free market turned bullish late last year based producer forecasts supply/demand deficit 28,000/29,000 tonnes .
Analysts predicting prices 5,000 stg per tonne 1987 .
However , trend reversed following strong upswing sterling versus dollar values fell back briefly 4,100 stg last month approaching 4,700 stg December .
decline accelerated producers sold little metal higher levels became competitive sellers .
also lack significant demand major steel mills made large purchases prior new year .
Traders say 15 ITC creditor banks ' original tin holdings nearly 45,000 tonnes almost halved , bulk material still available held Malaysian Japanese firms reluctant depress market unwanted metal .
80,000 tonnes held banks brokers International Tin Council 's , ITC , buffer stock manager halted support operations LME behalf 22 members nations International Tin Agreement .
overhang metal reduced broker Shearson Lehman Brothers , earlier year reported sold ITC-related holdings halved overall tin position .
Analysts see immediate sign rally European tin prices movements still expected largely related currency fluctuations , unless significant consumer demand emerges third quarter .
Association Tin Producing Countries , ATPC , made efforts since collapse ITA achieve higher world prices attempting bring major producers export control umbrella , date Brazil China , two major producers , remain unaffected ATPC argument apparently continuing offer material discounts consumers main European trading centres , dealers said .

Synar , Democrat Oklahoma , made remarks comments study General Accounting Office ( GAO ) U.S. participation 1985 test emergency oil sharing program International Energy Agency .
IEA , alliance 21 oil consuming countries , formed 1973-74 Arab oil embargo find ways deal future oil cutoff .
Synar said , `` president prepared take military action protect Kuwaiti oil tankers unwilling take less dangerous , equally-important action prepare nation next energy crisis . ''

lead-zinc mine , Cominco spokesman said .
meeting scheduled three striking locals , rejected tentative three-year contract Saturday , Cominco spokesman Richard Fish said .
Fish said pact rejected contained cost living increase tied Canadian consumer price index , wage increase .
81 pct membership voting , 54.5 pct voted 45.5 pct voted yes , union said .
three locals represent 2,600 production maintenance workers , remaining two locals cover 600 office technical workers .
office technical workers last negotiated May 21 .
Production Trail Kimberley shut since strike began May 9 Cominco declare force majeure , means company may unable honor contracts products smelter mine .
five locals separate contracts , expired April 30 , main issues similar .
Trail smelter , 400 miles east Vancouver , produced 240,000 long tons zinc 110,000 long tons lead last year .
Sullivan mine Kimberley , 450 miles east Vancouver , produced 2.2 mln long tons ore last year , processing Trail smelter .
smelter also produced cadmium , bismuth indium .
Trail smelter revenue 356 mln Canadian dlrs 1986 .

lead-zinc mine , Cominco spokesman said .
meeting scheduled three striking locals , rejected tentative three-year contract Saturday , Cominco spokesman Richard Fish said .
Fish said pact rejected contained cost living increase tied Canadian consumer price index , wage increase .
81 pct membership voting , 54.5 pct voted 45.5 pct voted yes , union said .
three locals represent 2,600 production maintenance workers , remaining two locals cover 600 office technical workers .
office technical workers last negotiated May 21 .
Production Trail Kimberley shut since strike began May 9 Cominco declare force majeure , means company may unable honor contracts products smelter mine .
five locals separate contracts , expired April 30 , main issues similar .
Trail smelter , 400 miles east Vancouver , produced 240,000 long tons zinc 110,000 long tons lead last year .
Sullivan mine Kimberley , 450 miles east Vancouver , produced 2.2 mln long tons ore last year , processing Trail smelter .
smelter also produced cadmium , bismuth indium .

said market denim fragmented Burlington contends Burlington ability switch light weight heavy weight denim production demand price dictate .

U.S. TRADE DATA SEEN KEY DOLLAR TREND dollar 's recent signs stability raised hopes 27-month decline may nearly , currency analysts refuse commit June 12 release U.S. trade data April .
`` trade data deciding factor see dollar bottomed , '' said Jim McGroarty Discount Corp .
Since February 1985 , dollar nearly halved value yen mark part officially orchestrated campaign make U.S. goods competitive world markets redress gaping world trade imbalances .
April 27 , dollar fell 40-year low 137.25 yen enjoyed modest recovery last weeks , topping 145 yen today first time nearly two months .
Many economists believe dollar fallen far enough ease trade deficit 's drag U.S. economy .
U.S. trade gap narrowed 13.6 billion dlrs March 15.1 billion February expected show continued improvement April volume , real , terms .
Keiichi Udagawa Bank Tokyo New York said progress reported , dollar would head back towards 150 yen .
`` growing consensus dollar bottomed medium term , '' added Tom Campbell First National Bank Chicago .
factors supporting bullish view growing expectations Federal Reserve Chairman Paul Volcker would reappointed third four-year term August , Japan's larger-than-expected economic stimulus package last week favorably technical chart signals , analysts said .
dollar also aided Japan 's moves dampen speculative selling Tokyo reports active central bank intervention support dollar .
Federal Reserve Bank New York said last week U.S. monetary authorities bought four billion dlrs February-April period -- largest amount since dollar crisis late 1970 's .
Discount Corp 's McGroarty described Fed 's intervention volume `` impressive '' .
James O'Neill Marine Midland Bank positive , however : `` dollar yet bottomed .
trade data released , dollar could fall towards 1.77 marks 140 yen . ''
Similarly , Natsuo Okada Sumitomo Bank New York warned , `` n't think dollar bottomed yet . ''
Although dollar could rise high 146.50 yen , Okada said market impatience painstakingly slow decline U.S. trade deficit may lead renewed pressure .
Currency analysts also warned unfavorable reaction seven-nation economic Summit June 8 10 Venice , likely focus implementation previous commitments rather yield fresh initiatives .
President Reagan said today , `` economic policy decisions made last year Tokyo year 's meetings Group Seven finance ministers Paris Washington ignored forgotten . ''
`` commitments made meetings need translated action , '' added speech , celebrating 40th anniversary Marshall aid plan Europe .
Tokyo unveiled fiscal stimulus package , analysts expected Bonn dollar/mark rate bear brunt U.S. calls action .
Marine Midland 's O'Neill said , `` pressure build Germany take stimulative action like Japan . ''
Japanese bank dealers warned although dollar could hold 145 yen months could also come attack seems latest economic package much impact Japan 's economy trade surplus .
Reflecting longer-term uncertainty , trust banks Japanese insurers keeping short dollar positons hedged exchange losses foreign portfolios , others started covering short positions , Japanese bank dealers said .

VENEZUELA TIGHTENS FOREIGN EXCHANGE RESTRICTIONS Venezuela 's central bank ordered Venezuelan banks exchange houses cease foreign exchange operations brokers based outside country , according copy central bank telex made available Reuters .
measure , confirmed brokerage firm , effectively cut foreign participation Venezuela's volatile currency market .
telex , issued May 19 , signed Carlos Hernandez Delfino , manager bank 's department international operations .
telex said restriction business foreign brokers line earlier measure prohibiting foreign exchange houses selling dollars foreign currencies anyone living outside Venezuela .
recent weeks Venezuelan government denied rumours intends impose foreign exchange controls prop weakening bolivar .
brokers said central bank 's move seen de facto currency control .
`` definitely control sense 's longer complete freedom operate , '' one broker said .
`` Gradually 're imposing restrictions direction towards complete control , '' broker said .
broker , requested anonymity , said virtually Venezuelan customers stopped business since central bank issued telex followed telephone calls .
said restriction imposed volume firm 's transactions Venezuela 10 mln dlrs day .
`` frenetic market , really quite active , '' said .
broker said saw logical explanation prohibition firm acted act intermediary Venezuelan brokers , exchange houses banks .
`` n't buying dollars Venezuelans , that's ridiculous , '' said .
`` 've rampage foreigners . ''
broker noted two months ago Venezuela 's central bank quietly announced banks foreign exchange business outside Venezuela would respect new 200 pct reserve requirement .
February , central bank also prohibited trading bolivar futures , broker said .
`` used forward market , '' said .
`` small currency miraculous . ''
said bolivar , averaged 20.29 U.S. Dollar 1986 , would continue slip current range 28.35 28.50 central bank rapidly running foreign reserves support currency free market .

estimated economic growth year whole would probably one two pct .

said relaxation controls review Petroleum Council , advisory panel Ministry International Trade Industry ( MITI ) .

's by-product freer competition , choice accept . ''

sources said Council likely tell MITI end 50 year-old protection industry .
cut capacity 3.8 mln barrels per day , 75 pct current capacity .

said deregulation vital promote competition efficiency , saw inevitable .

's turn see survive cut-throat competition , '' said source one major Japanese oil company .

CENTRAL BANK HEAD SAYS PHILIPPINE GROWTH TARGET Philippines ' first quarter growth figures released yesterday indicated government likely achieve 1987 targets , Central Bank governor Jose Fernandez said interview .
National Economic Development Authority ( NEDA ) announced yesterday gross domestic product ( GDP ) grew 5.78 pct gross national product ( GNP ) 5.53 pct first quarter year earlier .
`` n't see anything horizon cut ( growth ) short , '' Fernandez said .
NEDA said GNP grown 3.56 pct GDP 3.25 pct fourth quarter 1986 year earlier .
Last year 's GNP growth , put earlier 0.13 pct , revised 1.51 pct .
`` Certainly see shortage external resources GNP growth continues level would assume domestic resources fiscal side would generated would stumbling block , '' Fernandez said .
`` think even figures came , simply looking key indicators , consumption fuel oil power , showed economy different track last year , '' said .
Fernandez said consumption tended heavier first second quarters dry weather , could drop third quarter .
said significant sign recovery lay manufacturing sector , grew 9.64 pct , declines 1985 slow turnaround second half 1986 .
`` seasonal thing , secular , '' said .
said government met monetary targets set first quarter consultation International Monetary Fund ( IMF ) .
expected draw fourth tranche 198 mln SDR stand-by arrangement soon .

said IMF repayments projected total 1.56 billion dlrs 1987-92 period drawings 236 mln dlrs .
Repayments inevitable many countries would find net repayments IMF rising next years .
`` means since net drain ODA ( official development assistance ) accounts commercial banking system requested hold line , '' said .
internal constraint exists IMF debt rescheduled , Fernandez said .
Philippines rescheduled 10.3 billion dlrs 28 billion dlr foreign commercial debt March .
Fernandez said Central Bank bills , introduced March 1984 mop excess liquidity , peaked 43.1 billion pesos April 1986 .
unwinding maturity dates , started October last year , almost completed .
said auctions treasury bills , whose outstanding level touched 95.44 billion pesos May 20 , going well .
`` Treasury bills remain basic monetary tool , '' said .
Commenting country 's foreign debt Fernandez said , `` think Philippine debt stock looms large receipts exports taken kind leap forward might suitable . ''
foreign debt projected Central Bank reach 29.04 billion dlrs end 1987 .

cautioned growth far high targets yet achieved .
