POEHL LOOKS SET EIGHT YEARS BUNDESBANK currency dealers Karl Otto Poehl scourge speculators , bankers man played key role shaping world 's financial destiny last seven years , Germans guardian mark .
President powerful independent West German central bank , Bundesbank , Poehl likely contract renewed another eight years expires end year , government officials say .
( Index economic spotlights , see page ECRA ) official announcement yet made , raising eyebrows West Germany 's business community .
ebullient Poehl spent seven years Bonn top ministerial posts Social Democrats , opposition , moved Bundesbank .
speculation Chancellor Helmut Kohl would try replace Poehl man closer Christian Democrats .
officials noted Poehl worked closely successfully Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg since Kohl 's government took office 1982 .
Poehl , senior central banker apart Paul Volcker United States , enjoys strong international reputation would take newcomer years build .
Given circumstances , Kohl probably overlook Poehl 's past adviser former Social Democrat Chancellor Willy Brandt , top aide Helmut Schmidt Finance Minister , bankers said .
Schmidt , Chancellor , appointed Poehl present job 1980 .
recent months , mark 's strong rise dollar , Poehl made exchange rates central concern Bundesbank 's council , highly conservative institution doggedly pursued monetary policies prevent inflation catching hold .
Older Germans remember two bouts galloping inflation century .
consumer prices falling much 1986 , inflation negligible far year , Poehl thinks safe relax monetary reins little concentrate dangers German economy bloated exchange rate .
`` opinion efforts stabilise dollar/mark rate reached high priority , also Bundesbank , massive revaluation mark would endanger economy West Germany , '' told business journalists Frankfurt recently .
Ute Geipel , head research Citibank AG , says Poehl 's reappointment would guarantee flexible monetary policy .
`` Poehl 's policy always policy focus rigidly domestic factors , also external economy , '' said .
economist German bank , declined identified , said `` Poehl confirmed post , certainly plus pragmatic course rigidly oriented towards money supply . ''
One Poehl 's great struggles recently persuade United States stop `` talking '' dollar .
Poehl , significance February Louvre Accord United States agreed join efforts stabilise currencies .
Louvre Accord greeted scepticism currency dealers said would soon put test .
fact dollar relatively stable since pact .
`` markets know - perhaps n't know - central banks , '' Poehl says intervention currency markets quickly turn rates round , making speculator 's position worthless .
Poehl born 1929 worked financial journalist 1960s starting ministerial career .
relaxed sun-tanned figure enjoys cracking jokes glass beer , hardly stereotype central banker .
also keen sportsman likes watch football play golf .
Poehl says currency market intervention substitute correct economic policies exchange rates imbalanced .
`` achieve enormous effect small amount strike right moment , '' said .
Bundesbank dealers professional skilled .
`` 've burnt fingers many people , '' said .
unlike speculators , Poehl notes , Bundesbank dealers usually make profit .

U.K. RESERVES SHOW RECORD UNDERLYING RISE MAY Britain 's gold currency reserves rose record underlying 4.76 billion dlrs May , following April's 2.9 billion dlrs increase , Treasury said .
underlying trend indicates level recent Bank England intervention currency markets curb sterling's strength .
market expectations rise one billion three billion dlrs .
Treasury declined comment figures .
Actual reserves rose 4.87 billion dlrs May , compared April 's 2.8 billion increase , total value 34.68 billion dlrs , compared 29.81 billion end April .
Borrowings exchange cover scheme 238 mln dlrs , April 's 66 mln .
Repayments scheme 85 mln dlrs , 90 mln previously , capital repayments eight mln , three mln last month .
Repayments government debt amounted 33 mln dlrs .
underlying reserves increase net borrowings repayments .
larger previous record 3.04 billion dlrs rise seen October 1977 .
May increase represents seventh monthly rise , reserves 9.947 billion dlrs period , 9.816 billion since start 1987 .

S.AFRICA EXPECTED UNVEIL EXPANSIONARY BUDGET South Africa expected unveil tomorrow expansionary budget second consecutive year bid boost nation 's flagging economic growth rate , economic analysts said .
Faced competing demands increased military police spending pressing need funds black housing education , Finance Minister Barend Du Plessis expected raise significantly government 's overall expenditure targets presents budget parliament , analysts said .
Analysts expect Du Plessis provide rise state spending least equal 16 pct inflation rate financial year started April 1 , ignoring pleas private sector stimulate growth cutting taxes .
`` Fiscal policy become gradually expansionary , simply raising government spending increasing budget deficit inflationary form stimulation , '' said Rob Lee , chief economist South African Mutual Life Assurance Co. South Africa year targeting inflation-adjusted growth GDP three pct increase last year less one pct .
Growth GDP past decade averaged 1.5 pct , unemployment rate among blacks spiralled 30 pct .
Economists estimate government 's spending target rise 47 billion rand , revenue budgeted around 40 billion rand .
would leave budget deficit borrowing seven billion rand , four pct GDP .
government , consistently overshot spending targets decade , also faces credibility crisis expenditure figures outlined budget , analysts said .
`` budget invariably optimistic expenditure , '' said Standard Bank Ltd budget preview .
Many analysts private sector paying less attention figures presented budget using estimates expenditure draw conclusions money capital markets .
South African Mutual 's Lee believes government spending exceed budget target increase around 49 billion rand year , leaving deficit 5 5.5 pct GDP , compared three pct limit suggested IMF .
`` IMF limit obviously going abandoned , '' predicted one analyst , noting South Africa moved steadily away austerity measures recommended IMF past two years .
policy shift followed dramatic deterioration political situation onset economic crisis triggered refusal major foreign banks roll loans country September 1985 .
background Western economic sanctions , falling per capita incomes , rising joblessness high inflation , government officials say economic growth prime objective .
private-sector economists caution government's ability promote growth boosting state spending constrained need maintain large surplus current account country 's balance payments .
surplus , year estimated around 2.5 billion dlrs , swallowed repayments nation 's estimated 23 billion dlr foreign debt terms arrangement reached earlier year major international creditor banks .
Within constraints , economists believe Du Plessis little room manoeuvre .
Analysts argue recent rises civil service salaries budgeted spending increases state-owned Post Office South African Transport Services suggest major tax concessions individuals corporations unlikely .
Du Plessis earlier year announced small concessions taxpayers mini-budget May 6 whites-only election .
poll delayed presentation national budget .
`` exciting budget , '' commented Harry Schwarz , spokesman finance liberal Progressive Federal Party .
`` expect major tax cuts sweets given election . ''

proposed offer ETL , controlled New Zealand entrepreneur Allan Hawkins , came built 14.99 pct stake Monier 95 mln dlr share raid recent days .

shares closed 3.90 dlrs today , 25 cents yesterday , ETL withdrew reaching top foreign shareholding level permitted without Foreign Investment Review Board ( FIRB ) approval .
bid subject FIRB approval .

ITALIAN BARLEY CROP REPORTED GOOD CONDITION Italy 's barley crop generally good condition harvesting expected begin shortly , agricultural marketing information research board Irvam said .
First consignments expected available around mid-June .
Excellent weather , characterised alternating periods sunshine rain , encouraged growth except Sardinia , expected lose large part barley crop extreme dryness .
Irvam said yields expected higher last year 's low levels favourable weather continues next weeks .
Given average yield 3.5 tonnes per hectare , national production would around two pct higher previous season 1.6 mln tonnes , said .
yields reach record 3.78 tonnes per hectare achieved 1984 , production would around 1.75 mln tonnes , increase 11 pct compared 1986 .

CHICKEN MAIN SALMONELLA CAUSE , OFFICIAL SAYS representative poultry industry said statistics showed chicken less frequently cause salmonella poisoning beef , dairy products salads mixed foods .
Kenneth May , President Holly Farms Poultry Industries director National Broiler Council , told House Agriculture subcommittee incidence salmonella chicken increased recent years chicken neither major source bacterial poisoning cause increase outbreaks disease .
May said Center Disease Control figures showed 1978 1982 , chicken involved four pct U.S. salmonellosis outbreaks , beef accounted ten pct outbreaks dairy products six pct .
May said remaining outbreaks caused salads mixed food , turkey , seafood , pork , eggs foods .
May said chicken industry favored moving away bird-by-bird inspection procedures risk assessment system better able identify microbial bacterial contamination poultry .
However , Ellen Haas , executive director Public Voice Food Health Policy , said bird-by-bird inspection retained labels attached ready-to-cook chicken remind consumers preparation procedures necessary avoid illness .
Haas also called review present chicken industry inspection methods said worsen poultry hazards .

similar measure decisively defeated Senate floor last week .
bill , passed voice vote , would allow so-called Findley payments made immediately rather late year .
Payments 1987-90 feedgrains crops would changed .
bill would move 2.8 billion dlrs spending fiscal 1987 fiscal 1988 , measure expected meet stiff resistance full House .

LAWSON CALLS INTERVENTION PROOF STABILITY GOAL scale foreign exchange intervention Bank England carried recently clear proof Britain 's determination stabilise exchange rates agreed Group Seven industrialised countries Paris February , Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson said .
Saying `` content '' sterling 's current value , Lawson told reporters wanted `` maintain exchange rate stability signed . ''
declined say favoured rise fall present sterling levels .
May currency reserves , today , showed record 4.8 billion stg rise , pointing massive currency intervention .
April , reserves rose hefty 2.9 billion stg .
Pointing reserves data , Lawson said , `` playing full part '' meeting commitments toward exchange rate stability agreed Paris .
`` wish see ( stability ) continuing , '' added .
Asked techniques available preserve stability , Lawson said central bank intervention interest rate changes could used tackle `` market pressures time time . ''
`` Interest rate stability objective sense ... Rates moved times , '' added .
Lawson said expected intervention `` sterilised '' draining excess sterling liquidity market new issues government securities foreign currency sales , market allowed .
would limit inflationary impact intervention , said .
`` Sterilisation dictated market tactics ... necessarily month intervention occurs , '' Lawson said .
`` confident sterilise scale . ''

LUKMAN SEES STABLE OIL PRICE NEXT COUPLE YEARS current crude oil price 18 20 dlrs barrel remain stable next couple years , rising one two dlrs barrel per annum keep inflation , OPEC President Rilwanu Lukman said .
Lukman , speaking talks Swedish trade officials , said stable price depended upon output restraint OPEC non-OPEC oil producers , Swedish government officials said .
said Lukman , also Nigerian oil minister , made remarks whilst talking connection Third World debt industrialised nations .
Crude oil output controls necessarily mean higher energy bills world 's industrial nations , Lukman said .
Although low oil prices , seen around beginning year , may appear beneficial industrial countries depend imported energy , would lead wastage overdependence fuel long term , said .
turn would bring swing back extremely high prices , added .
Sweden , heavily dependent imported oil , suffered major crisis mid-1970s , oil prices spiralled .
BUNDESBANK CREDIT POLICY CHANGES UNLIKELY Bundesbank unlikely change credit policies central bank council meets Thursday last session Venice summit , banking economists money market dealers said .
Bundesbank steered money market rates lower last month cutting rate security repurchase pacts , unlikely cap move cut leading interest rates near future , said .
council meet Saarbruecken , meeting followed news conference around 1030 GMT .
Bundesbank officials noted news conference usually called council meets outside Frankfurt , necessarily herald policy moves .
Bundesbank Vice-President Helmut Schlesinger said today reason cut interest rates money supply growth shown signs slowing May dollar stable mark .
Schlesinger told Reuters Tokyo , Bundesbank opened representative office , West German economy picking contracting seasonally adjusted 1/2 one pct first quarter .
Money market dealers said call money likely hold 3.50/70 pct range month , Bundesbank switched last month tenders interest rate minimum bid rate 3.50 pct , allocating funds 3.55 pct .
`` set signal indicated could maybe lower market rates even , discount Lombard , '' Winfried Hutmann , chief economist Schroeder , Munchmeyer , Hengst Investment GmbH said .
Werner Chrobok , managing partner Bethmann Bank , said German rates among lowest industrial countries around historical lows West Germany .
cut rates would little impact economy banks case reporting slack credit demand , companies swimming liquidity , Chrobok said .
Bundesbank would therefore reluctant make move interest rates , would better held reserve .
`` Bundesbank frightened using powder , '' said .
cut discount Lombard rates , bring line new structure money market rates since last month , would little practical significance , dealers said .
Bundesbank could therefore act wanted diplomatic gesture next week 's Venice summit .
Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl often made clear past opposes gestures mere `` eyewash . ''
Economists said really Bonn government cut taxes , rather Bundesbank ease monetary policy , meet pressure West Germany Venice summit .
Bonn struggling finance already announced tax cuts falling tax revenue widening federal budget deficit , hard see Bonn could cut taxes .
`` Bonn government weak position Venice ca n't risk increasing deficit , '' said Schroeder , Muenchmeyer , Hengst 's Hutmann .
Bethmann 's Chrobok said anything happen Venice , must fiscal rather monetary policy .
`` n't expect convincing measures , '' said .
Money market dealers noted call money continued normalize today , falling 3.60/70 pct 3.75/85 yesterday much five pct Friday pushed month-end distortions .
Call money could come upwards pressure later month major round tax payments banks behalf customers , starting week beginning June 15 .
Two public holidays week could also distort market .
Dealers said expected Bundesbank allocate funds tomorrow latest repurchase pact unchanged 3.55 pct , setting unchanged minimum bid rate 3.50 pct , fully replace 5.5 billion marks outgoing pact .
dealers said possible Bundesbank would allocate funds 3.6 pct rather 3.55 .
would represent tightening policy , however .
Bundesbank scales bids allocates minimum accepted rate , banks may try get full allocation bidding heavily 3.6 pct , dealers said .
another issue , Poehl said Bundesbank likely lift restrictions private use European Currency Unit ( ECU ) one meetings soon .
Saarbruecken would suitable place announcement gesture European unity , capital Saarland bordering France , twice French occupation century .
dealers said ECU announcement unlikely come week , number technical legal matters still resolved , instance German ECU accounts would treated minimum reserve purposes .

said every two half weeks , American dies salmonellosis complications arising incidence poisoning poultry increased steadily past several years .

Kaufman said , `` Unlike Paul Volcker , entered office Federal Reserve chairman strong credibility domestically internationally , Mr Greenspan demonstrate competence policy independence gain full confidence financial markets . ''
Greenspan knowledgeable behavior U.S. economy , professional skills international area much limited , Kaufman noted .
`` Consequently , although well known abroad , views issues Less Developed Country Debt may initially carry less weight Mr Volcker . ''

Dan Stevens , manager public government affairs Texaco Inc & lt ; TX > , operator pipeline subsidiary Texaco Pipeline Co , said company hopes repairs begin five days expects take several days complete .
`` point lining know need , get job done , '' Stevens said , adding timing repairs depend damage pipeline difficult assess flooding Red River .
pipeline shipping roughly 225,000 barrels crude oil per day , 55 pct capacity 30 days preceding shutdown Saturday , Stevens said .
pipeline shut Cushing , Okla , Witchita Falls , Kan , Saturday due undetermined leak Red River crossing , near Oklahoma/Texas border , severe rains , spokesman Texaco said .
Stevens said reasonable suggest pipeline could operate full capacity reopens order make shortfull cautioned talk customers determine requirements .
Oil analysts traders said sure shutdown continue raise U.S. oil prices .

result modest improvement tanker rates .

said tanker requirements decreased September 1986 OPEC production quotas dropped levels oil stocks rose .

`` one ever stated supported policy protecting shipping waters , '' Pentagon spokesman Bob Sims said Reagan Administration drew plans increase protective U.S. military presence gulf .
Sims denied published reports U.S. Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger sought air cover protect neutral shipping western gulf attacks Iran Iraq .
`` said repeatedly , American flag vessels protection exception , limited case-by-case basis , ships carrying Foreign Military Sales equipment friendly , non-belligerent states region , '' Sims said .
U.S. warships gulf two weeks ago protected Kuwaiti ship sailed Bahrain U.S. arms Bahrain Kuwait .
Sims said Washington received assurances arms would used elsewhere .
said Kuwait , turning 11 oil tankers U.S. firms fly American flag protected U.S. warships , considered belligerent despite Iranian charges Kuwait supporting Iraq gulf war .
Kuwaiti tankers come repeated Iranian attack .
Sims refused say United States beef seven-ship Middle East Task Force gulf protect 11 Kuaiti tankers .

said Hollinger currently talking 10 newspapers U.S. company currently owns 23 dailies .

INVESTMENT CRUCIAL U.S .
TEXTILE RECOVERY private investment , protection , U.S. textile industry could become competitive modern foreign producers , analysts two congressional agencies said today .
Office Technology Assessment , nonpartisan arm Congress told House Ways Means Trade Subcommittee hearing still concern future parts U.S. textile apparel industry , reason optimism years ago .
`` textile producers making significant investments , could , '' OTA analyst Henry Kelly said .
Congressional Budget Office ( CBO ) , nonpartisan budget analysis arm Congress , said federal loans loan guarantees would preferable options Congress rather increased trade protection could lead foreign retaliation .
CBO analyst Edward Gramlich said past trade protections , first imposed 1950 's small benefit profits investments domestic firms .
Trade Subcommittee chairman , Rep. Sam Gibbons , said agencies analyses seemed agree opinion congressional approval protectionist textile quota legislation aimed mainly Western Europe , Japan Asian textile producing countries .
President Reagan last year vetoed textile protection bill reintroduced session Congress expected voted House year .
However , approval year doubt passage major trade bill without specific protections textiles showed weakening support legislation .
U.S. producers fallen behind foreign producers use modern textile apparel production equipment net imports growing faster domestic markets , Kelly said .
added private investment textile clothing industry 1983 0.5 pct less one-seventh average manufacturing investment 3.9 pct .
Despite existing import quotas tariffs , imports textiles grew 26 pct 1986 imports apparel grew 14 pct U.S. production rose 1.9 pct .
`` traditional industry seems destined replaced new technology , imports , combination .
industry may able compete domestic markets enjoyed twenty years ago , results research indicate portions domestic market recovered , exports expanded , '' Kelly said .

RAINS AID MANITOBA CROPS WEEK Widespread , soaking rains aided crop development across province , northwest crop producing region receiving precipitation , according Manitoba Agriculture weekly crop report .
rains replenished formerly low soil moisture reserves , reserves areas rated good , report said .
Plantings virtually complete across province germination well advanced .
However , fields still showed spotty stands .
Cereal crops southwest 90 pct germinated , fields already subsequent tillering stage , said .
Oilseeds northwest region 80 pct emerged many areas , regions 50 70 pct emerged .

U.S. HOUSE PASSES GULF BILL DESPITE OPPOSITION U.S. House Representatives approved bill requires Reagan administration provide Congress report Gulf policy place restrictions actions .
bill passed 305-102 -- winning necessary two-thirds voting -- despite last-minute revolt alliance liberal Democrats conservative Republicans sought defeat signal growing number legislators oppose President Reagan 's policies region .
legislation passed wake May 17th Iraqi missile attack U.S. frigate Stark Gulf , killed 37 Americans , Reagan 's decision protect 11 Kuwaiti oil tankers putting U.S. flags -- effectively making American ships .
legislation -- supported Congress ' Democratic Republican leadership well administration -- required Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger provide report Congress , within seven days enactment , plans protect U.S. warships flag ships Persian Gulf .
, however , place restrictions administration proceeds reflag Kuwaiti ships thus immediate effect U.S. policy .
Senate expected approve legislation week .
bill would sent Reagan signature .
Supporters bill said passage bill first step toward greater congressional involvement formulating policy .
Democratic critics said bill ask administration address tough policy questions report .

U.S. MEAT INDUSTRY LAUNCHES CAMPAIGN JAPAN U.S. meat industry launched aggressive promotion campaign Japan increase consumer awareness U.S. beef persuade Japanese government relax current beef import quotas .
U.S. beef sales Japan , currently around 480 mln dlrs annually , could increase two billion dlrs high six billion dlrs year 2000 Japanese quotas removed Japanese consumer made aware attributes U.S. beef , officials U.S. Meat Export Federation said press conference today .
Partially funded 6.5 mln dlr award made Agriculture Department 's Targeted Export Assistance ( TEA ) program , five-year meat promotion campaign Japan launched U.S. Meat Export Federation April .
`` promising Japanese beef market could one bright spots U.S. agricultural exports , '' said Philip Seng , Asian Director Federation .
`` supply ( Japan ) buy high quality beef .
like beef want buy , '' said .
Seng pointed Japan 's beef quota system , limits total Japanese beef imports 177,000 tonnes per year U.S. imports 58,400 tonnes , major constraint expanding U.S. beef shipments Japan .
quotas implemented 1977 time heavy Japanese foreign beef imports .
current quota agreement expires next March beef quota negotiations set get underway fall .
Reagan administration called end quotas April , 1988 , Japanese officials said would liberalize imports regardless U.S. pressure .
Officials Meat Export Federation told Reuters expect complete lifting quota , hope least gradual increase quota .
High beef prices Japan caused protected market also kept beef consumption modest levels , meat industry officials said .
Japanese shoppers pay average 27.14 dlrs U.S. tenderloin steak restaurant average 47.42 dlrs Japanese-produced restaurant steak , meat association said .
retail level , U.S. striploin sells 9.77 dlrs per pound , Japanese beef sells 28.51 dlrs per lb .
Japanese consumers currently eat less 10 lbs beef per year , compared 78 lbs average American , officials said .
Total beef consumption Japan 700,000 800,000 tonnes per year , Seng said removal quotas decrease beef prices , consumption could increase 3.2 mln tonnes .

particular , uncertainty Greenspan 's attitude dollar could undermine sentiment toward U.S. currency , analysts said .
Greenspan said today dollar appeared nearing bottom , market bear mind remarks Chicago last week dollar 's recent move upward technical reaction would trade significantly lower , analysts said .

declining dollar scenario higher currency futures prior throughout Venice meetings would mitigated concrete action opposed `` jawboning '' G-7 summit , said .

JAPAN 1986/87 COMPOUND FEED OUTPUT 2.3 PCT Japanese compound feed output rose 2.3 pct 25.80 mln tonnes 1986/87 ended March 31 25.23 mln year earlier , Agriculture Ministry said .
marginal rise reflected slight growth demand poultry raising moderate increase demand beef cattle raising , Ministry officials said .
Compound feed sales totalled 26.01 mln tonnes 1986/87 25.40 mln year ago , end-March stocks 217,554 tonnes 224,101 .
Corn use feed output 1986/87 rose 11.71 mln tonnes 11.02 mln year earlier due low import prices .
officials said corn imports rose world surplus yen 's strength dollar reduced Chicago prices .
corn compounding ratio rose 45.2 pct 1986/87 43.4 pct year earlier .
Sorghum use rose marginally 4.80 mln tonnes 1986/87 4.79 mln , compounding ratio fell 18.5 pct 18.9 pct greater corn use .
Higher import prices due poor harvests last year major producing nations Argentina made feed makers reluctant use sorghum .
Soybean meal use fell 2.58 mln tonnes 2.63 mln compounding ratio declined 10.0 pct 10.3 pct .
drop soybean meal consumption resulted increased use cheaper rapeseed meal , officials said .
Rapeseed consumption 1986/87 563,889 tonnes 528,152 year earlier .
compounding ratio rose 2.2 pct 2.1 pct .

cuts take one month rate 6.75 pct , two month rate 6.80 pct key three month rate 6.85 pct , central bank said telex .
National Bank spokesman said modest cut made decline domestic money market rates yesterday , expected followed cut 7.60 pct discount rate .
short-term treasury certificate rates , especially three-month rate , National Bank 's main monetary policy instrument last two years .
discount rate market 's penalty rate rather guiding rate since 1985 , advances currently little used liquidity ample , bank economists said .
bank last cut one- three-month certificate rates June 5 , also 0.10 points .

FRENCH OFFICIAL RESERVES 420.50 BILLION FRANCS MAY VS 420.24 BILLION APRIL - OFFICIAL FRENCH OFFICIAL RESERVES 420.50 BILLION FRANCS MAY VS 420.24 BILLION APRIL - OFFICIAL
FRENCH OFFICIAL RESERVES RISE MAY French official reserves rose 258 mln francs May 420.50 billion francs 420.24 billion end April , Finance Ministry said .
slight rise partly reflected repayment last month France 's outstanding 11.95 billion francs debt owed European Monetary Cooperation Fund ( FECOM ) .
also reflected negative 314 mln franc position France 's Exchange Stabilisation Fund intervention purchases 10.6 billion francs May .
Foreign currency holdings fell 7.28 billion francs 124.58 billion ECU holdings fell 5.55 billion francs 58.52 billion due repayment part France 's debt owed FECOM Stabilisation Fund operations , ministry said .
Claims IMF rose 1.14 billion francs 18.97 billion , including 385 mln franc increase France 's reserve position IMF 751 mln franc rise holdings Special Drawing Rights .
Gold holdings unchanged 218.46 billion francs .

government pledged privatise 66 state-owned industrial , banking insurance companies 1991 .
companies sold private sector near future television network TF-1 later month banking group Cie Financiere de Suez & lt ; FSPP.PA > autumn .
ministry said TF-1 's forthcoming sell-off meant third government 's programme would completed less nine months .
Balladur Sunday rejected press opposition charges share prices privatised companies pitched low .
said average premium shares trading Bourse 15 30 pct offer price .
compared premiums 60 80 pct similar share flotations Britain .

Industry sources said latest forecasts 1987 crop indicated output 360,000 tonnes , well record 501,800 tonne tel quel production 1986 ( May-December ) crop year .
previous record set 1982 Fiji produced 486,790 tonnes .
past month Fiji sugar farmers delayed harvesting 1987 crop pending response Governor-general demands following May 14 coup .
Ganilau said statement Fiji Sugar Corp would make payment five dlrs per tonne final payment 1986 crop understanding preparations growers commencement harvesting would completed mills June 23 .
Crushing would commence Labasa Penang mills June 23 Lautoka Rarawai mills June 30 , said .
interim payment , made June 30 , full amount grower 's share 1986 sugar proceeds received to-date .
balance paid October .
Growers also called full 1987 forecast price 23.50 dlrs per tonne cane paid cash delivery mill , rejected state controlled Fiji Sugar Corp , Ganilau said .
However , addition scheduled delivery payment 14.10 dlrs , additional sum 2.35 dlrs , 10 pct forecast price , would paid December 15 , cane harvested November 30 , said .
Ganilau said , `` least one month advance expected date payment second payment cane .
balance second payment made six weeks end crushing . ''
Another demand Fiji 's 22,000 small farmers estimated 14 mln dlr loan Fiji Development Bank ( FDB ) 1983 cane crop rehabilitation programme written .
FDB rejected request .
Ganilau said , however , `` bank prepared carefully consider requests rescheduling loan repayments cases hardship case-by-case basis . ''
response demand soldiers removed cane growing areas , Ganilau said army would restrict presence cane areas .
said directed authorities issue permits harvesting gangs , cane growers sugar industry trade unions hold necessary meetings preparation commencement harvest .
Senior representatives sugar cane growers indicated desire commence crush soon possible , added .

U.K. UNEMPLOYMENT FALLS THREE MLN MAY U.K. Unemployment fell record provisional , seasonally-adjusted 64,300 May total 2.95 mln 10.6 pct workforce , Employment Department said .
April , seasonally-adjusted unemployment fell upwardly revised 21,600 3.02 mln 10.9 pct , said .
unadjusted jobless total May , including school leavers , alos fell record 121,000 2.99 mln 10.8 pct April 's 3.11 mln , 11.2 pct .
May eleventh successive decline peak last summer 11.6 pct , Employment Department said .
`` Unemployment fallen three mln first time three years .
May fall 64,000 largest drop since records first kept ( 1948 ) , '' Employment Minister Norman Fowler said .
regions seen average falls long term unemployment past year , added .
last time adjusted total unemployed three mln July 1984 , unadjusted total last level June 1983 .
U.K. EARNINGS UNDERLYING 7.75 PCT APRIL U.K. Average earnings rose seasonally adjusted 6.5 pct year end-April , increasing 6.7 pct annually March , Employment Department said .
April index , base 1980 , set provisional , seasonally-adjusted 197.3 , 194.8 March .
underlying rise 7.75 pct , 0.25 pct March back level seen late last year .
underlying rise adjusted factors back-pay timing variations .
Unit wage costs U.K. Manufacturing industry rose one pct year April , upward revised rise 0.7 pct period March , Department Employment added .
three months end-April , costs 0.9 pct higher , year-on-year , compared rise 1.2 pct three months March .
Manufacturing productivity April 6.1 pct higher year ago downward revised 6.8 pct increase March .
last three months period manufacturing productivity 6.7 pct , increased 6.5 pct first quarter .

unable confirm tonnages involved .

RPT - EUROPEAN TRADE MAY PROPOSE NEW ICO FORMULA European coffee traders roasters may propose new formula calculating International Coffee Organization ( ICO ) coffee quotas end meeting week , traders officials told Reuters .
Although traders unwilling reveal details possible new formula , said would give Brazil , world 's biggest coffee producer , unchanged ICO quotas next two years could basis renegotiation .
`` main sticking point quotas Brazil's attitude , compromise could solution , `` one said .
However , European coffee trade federation meeting , began today continue end week , revealed gaps European position re-introducing quotas .
Traders said , whole , trade side re-introduction ICO quotas , roasters generally favour single proviso formula basis re-allocating quota shares among producing countries .
roasters said positions generally fairly close , problems Government officials .
Germany Italy cited extremes polarized Government attitudes , countries fence .
Sources said Germany extreme quota re-introduction , Italians favour .
`` Nevertheless , expect find enough common ground end week least present common European Community ( EC ) view next meeting consumer members International Coffee Agreement ( ICA ) July , '' one trader said .
`` hope present compromise proposal consumer side , producer side accept , '' one official said .
`` learned live without quotas suspended February last year , would prefer stability bring market long simply return old outdated status quo far quota allocation concerned , '' added .
Overall , however , trader roaster opinion likelihood successful re-negotiation mildly pessimistic , varying 50-50 chance 60-40 .
`` main difficulty persuade U.S. consumer side Brazil producer side agree quota re-introduction , `` said .
`` U.S .
Position , anything , hardened , new Brazilian Coffee Institute president adopted least negotiable position predecessors , '' one trader said .
`` However , many producers starting swing favour consumer position quotas re-allocated new formula , Brazil becoming increasingly isolated , gives least hope compromise ICO quota meeting September , '' official said .

INDONESIA REJECTS WORLD BANK FARM REFORM PROPOSALS Indonesia rejected World Bank recommendations sweeping reforms farm economy , country 's foreign aid donors met consider giving 2.5 billion dlrs grants soft loans .
Agriculture Minister Achmad Affandi , written remarks distributed today Indonesia 's 14 foreign donor nations met Hague , said , `` general argument presented Bank free trade , open economy view weak . ''
Bank called overhauls Indonesia manages largest farm area South-east Asia , said agricultural growth stagnating subsisides rice farming .
Bank report said Indonesia 's rice production peaked subsidies waste money .
Affandi replied rice main staple provides income 17 pct workforce .
subsidies needed support fertilizer industry , including importers , exporters , producers distributors , said , well assisting small part majority Indonesian farmers .
Affandi agreed bank recommendation farmers free choose crops , said government would continue maintain production targets `` strategic commodities '' rice sugar .
Bank report especially critical Indonesia's drive plant sugar , saying domestic sugar prices double world average inefficiencies , country would save money importing commodity .
However , Affandi said volatile world sugar prices , need save foreign exchange already up-and-running sugar industry good arguments continuing sugar drive .
also said import barriers trade monopolies agricultural sector needed help domestic industry develop `` over-production price intervention developed nations . ''

BUDGET PACT CUTS U.S. FARM FUNDS 1.25 BILLION DLRS U.S. House Senate budget negotiators agreed part overall budget accord reached yesterday , cut 1.25 billion dlrs fiscal 1988 spending agricultural programs , Congressional sources told Reuters .
agreed cut farm programs compromise 1.4 billion sought Senate one billion House .
negotiators also agreed cut 1.6 billion farm budget fiscal 1989 2.45 billion 1990 , total 5.3 billion saving three years , sources said .
agreement presents House Senate Agriculture committees difficult choices make changes agriculture programs achieve budget savings targets without jeopardizing popular support payments , senior Congressional aides told Reuters .
farm state lawmakers already manuevering find budget savings .
Rep. Dan Glickman , D-Kan. , Chairman House grains subcommittee , introduced bill would freeze wheat corn loan rates 1988 crop current 2.28 dlrs 1.92 dlrs respectively , saying would save 500 mln dlrs .
House Agriculture Committee chairman Kika De la Garza said committee consider Glickman proposal .
Congressional sources said proposal unlikely approved opposition Republican lawmakers strong stance Agriculture Secretary Richard Lyng , said freezing loan rates would send wrong signal major grain export competitors would achieve budget savings Glickman claims .
Another area Glickman said budget savings might made increase acreage reduction program , ARP , levels wheat corn .
However , issue also Lyng taken strong stand within Reagan administration , arguing 1988 crop wheat acreage reduction left 27.5 pct 30 pct sought Office Management Budget , OMB .
commodity lobbyists expect Lyng prevail .
Congressional sources said way achieve significant budget cuts ARP increases would boost 1988 corn ARP .
one informed Congressional source said singling-out corn ARP increase would would seen unfair one commodity .
Congressional sources said areas Congress likely eventually look budget savings tightening payment limitation rules , possible adoption 0/92 program 1988 crops major grains .
changes would achieve portion 1.25 billion enough , said .
Ultimately , Congressional sources said agriculture committees may forced apply across-the-board cut Commodity Credit Corp. payments farmers , including price support loans deficiency payments , similar Gramm-Rudman-Hollings budget cut applied fiscal 1986 .
idea suggested American Farm Bureau Federation , AFBF , fairest approach commodities .

OPEC DIFFERENTIALS SEEN POSING MAJOR PROBLEMS OPEC states unhappy prices assigned crude oil pose great problems group reviews six-month-old price output pact Vienna next week , oil analysts say .
said Nigeria , holds OPEC conference presidency , Qatar probably biggest grievances price differentials making crudes uncompetitive .
also speculation Japanese traders OPEC might want mark prices high-sulphur heavy crudes , correspond greater demand higher fuel oil prices .
experts agree major overhaul price differentials unlikely , avoid giving market signals dent OPEC 's new unity .
`` OPEC members make good case changing differentials , '' said one analyst major oil company .
`` end day , attitude going `` leave well alone ' little nothing likely altered . ''
Iran , Libya Saudi Arabia among also saw sales problems earlier year , traders say .
diminished customer resistance fixed prices , cases , marketing incentives helped sales .
producers sell uncompetitively priced crudes means discounts , processing deals selling alongside better priced grades `` package . ''
Many OPEC crudes seen reasonably priced , least part year .
many experts say OPEC change prices quarterly monthly match seasonal demand fuel oil-rich heavy crudes gasoline-rich lighter grades .
last meeting December , OPEC agreed reintroduce fixed prices February 1 around 18 dlr per barrel reference point .
Official prices effectively dropped 1985 members offered discounts attract customers .
OPEC also decided limit first-half 1987 output 15.8 mln bpd proposed ceilings 16.6 mln third quarter 18.3 mln fourth .
Analysts expect extend raise slightly current ceiling coming months .
Spot market netback values crudes mirror official prices , OPEC probably keep 18 dlr target make minimal changes differentials , analysts say .
18 dlr figure based basket six OPEC one non-OPEC crudes .
OPEC assigned prices key export crudes , 2.65 dlr gap heaviest lightest .
Extra heavy crudes among left .
Industry estimates vary proportion OPEC oil exports actually sold official prices .
Several experts say one-quarter one-third total fact sells official prices , rest included processing barter deals sold form refined products .
Problems new structure appeared earlier year , producers ' output fell due customer reluctance pay new prices .
Nigeria especially found gasoline-rich Bonny Light crude -- OPEC 's highest priced grade 18.92 dlrs barrel -- uncompetitive spot market Britain 's Brent .
February March , Nigeria 's production shrank 1.238 mln bpd OPEC quota .
Spot prices since revived , due partly seasonal demand gasoline , output risen .
experts feel Bonny Light still overvalued say price cut 50 cts one dlr barrel .
Mehdi Varzi , chief oil analyst London 's Kleinwort Grieveson Securities , doubts Nigeria actively push differentials question Vienna .
`` would look good OPEC unity Nigeria , holds presidency , raised issue , '' said .

said talks progress United Western regard repayment terms loan .
INDONESIA REJECTS WORLD BANK FARM REFORM IDEAS Indonesia rejected World Bank recommendations sweeping reforms farm economy , country 's foreign aid donors met consider giving 2.5 billion dlrs grants soft loans .
Agriculture Minister Achmad Affandi , written remarks distributed today Indonesia 's 14 foreign donor nations met Hague , said , `` general argument presented Bank free trade , open economy view weak . ''
Bank called overhauls Indonesia manages largest farm area South-east Asia , said agricultural growth stagnating subsidies rice farming .
Bank report said Indonesia 's rice production peaked subsidies waste money .
Affandi replied rice main staple provides income 17 pct workforce .
subsidies needed support fertilizer industry , including importers , exporters , producers distributors , said , well assisting small part majority Indonesian farmers .
Affandi agreed bank recommendation farmers free choose crops , said government would continue maintain production targets `` strategic commodities '' rice sugar .
Bank report especially critical Indonesia's drive plant sugar , saying domestic sugar prices double world average inefficiencies , country would save money importing commodity .
However , Affandi said volatile world sugar prices , need save foreign exchange already up-and-running sugar industry good arguments continuing sugar drive .
also said import barriers trade monopolies agricultural sector needed help domestic industry develop `` over-production price intervention developed nations . ''

U.S .
PERSONAL INCOME ROSE 0.2 PCT MAY U.S. personal income rose 0.2 pct , 7.9 billion dlrs , May seasonally adjusted annual rate 3,630.0 billion dlrs , Commerce Department said .
increase followed revised 0.4 pct rise April .
department previously estimated April income rose 0.3 pct .
department also revised March personal income rise 0.3 pct previously reported 0.2 pct .
Personal consumption expenditures rose 0.1 pct , 1.5 billion dlrs , 2,893.3 billion dlrs May rising 0.6 pct 18.6 billion dlrs April , department said .
department said April May increases personal income restrained lower subsidy payments farmers initial payments newly established retirement fund federal government employees April .
Wages salaries increased 8.8 billion dlrs May 7.0 billion dlr rise April , manufacturing payrolls 1.6 billion dlrs May falling 1.3 billion dlrs April .
Farmers ' incomes fell 11 billion dlrs May decreasing 6.7 billion dlrs April due lower farm subsidy payments , department said .

U.K. DATA DEPRESS RATE CUT OUTLOOK - ANALYSTS Today 's U.K. Economic data pushed chances another base lending rate cut current nine pct distance , analysts said .
record fall unemployment good manufacturing production data showed economy still strong need fillip lower rates .
News underlying earnings rising 7.75 pct annually , taken together higher expected bank lending money supply growth , revived inflation worries monetarist arguments easier credit , said .
`` timetable lower interest rates pushed back .
strength economy broad money growth making difficult see one near term , '' said Chase Manhattan Securities economist Robin Marshall .

also counters optimistic forecasts last week post-general election cut imminent , supported optimistic economic news May 's record reserves rise mirrored Bank England efforts cap sterling's strength .
gilt market lost nearly half point enthusiasm May 's 64,300 fall seasonally adjusted unemployment rate , 2.95 mln 10.6 pct workforce , rapidly replaced dismay continued high level underlying average earnings April , dealers said .
upset compounded news sterling bank lending rose 2.7 billion stg May , forecast , Bank England looks likely sell gilts offset impact domestic money supply current intervention .
`` gilt market reaction correct , '' said Bill Martin , chief U.K .
Economist brokers Phillips Drew .
`` 's important ...
shows economy good state indeed , '' Skeoch said .
`` 's reason get worries inflationary pressures 're subdued . ''

`` n't think average earnings numbers major problem , '' agreed Chase Manhattan 's Marshall .
said gilts market likely remain worried funding implications recent intervention .
said inflow foreign money sterling assets earlier year , attracted growth prospects hopes ruling Conservatives would win last week 's election , looks likely prevent base rate cut authorities try prevent funds swelling domestic money system .

long continues 're okay , '' added .

Today 1/4 .

said rumors spin-off around `` couple days . ''

added possibility remained deal would fall .

chemical unit last year revenues 1.9 billion dlrs .

EC COMMISSION DEFENDS OILS FATS TAX spokesman European Community Commission defended controversial plan levy oils fats , saying consumers would help alleviate surplus problem paying proposed tax .
Norbert Tanghe , head division Commission's Directorate General Agriculture , told 8th Antwerp Oils Fats Contact Days `` Commission firmly believes sacrifices would undergone Community producers oils fats sector ... Would justify asking consumers make appropriate contribution solving serious problem within sector paying levy . ''
proposed tax necessary level budgetary costs resulting olive oil oilseeds production become unacceptable , Tanghe said .
Recent estimates put costs 4.0 billion European Currency Units 1990 would rise another 2.0 billion Ecus , said .
1990 Community 's `` standstill '' agreements Spain Portugal end EC would feel full impact enlargement .
Commission proposed several cost production cutting measures include introduction maximum guaranteed quantity system , added .
Commission 's system stabilising consumer prices oils fats sector , reference price 700 Ecus per tonne refined soy oil would introduced , Tanghe said .
Consumer prices could raised lowered regulatory amount market prices level .
said revenue generated charging regulatory amount would used finance Common Agricultural Policy 's oils fats regime .
`` Commission believes hostile reactions ( proposed tax ) part based incomplete insufficiently thorough analysis proposal , '' said .
Tanghe said proposed system conforms General Agreement Tariffs Trade , GATT , rules .
would discriminatory would applied domestic imported products , past experience showed would cause decline consumption oils fats .
EC-produced oilseeds would benefit present aid arrangements , said .
competitiveness different oils , whether EC produced imported , would remain unchanged quantities imported third countries would affected tax , Tanghe said .
proposed system would alter EC nations' requirements far imports concerned since overall effect would stabilise Community production levels without affecting demand , said .
one proposal 's objectives maintain current import levels , said .
Imports soybeans would unaffected imported primarily satisfy EC 's cakes meals requirements , covered stabilising system .
Furthermore , half oil produced imported beans re-exported third countries , Tanghe added .

18-JUN-1987 18-JUN-1987
GROWTH PALM OIL USE SET SLOW , OUTPUT RISE rate increase world palm oil use likely slow next season despite expected 800,000 tonne production rise 8.13 mln tonnes , Siegfried Mielke , editor Hamburg-based newsletter Oil World said .
told 8th Antwerp Oils Fats Contact Days next Oct/Sept 1987/88 season , palm oil use rise 8.25 mln tonnes 7.71 mln , five-year average increase 550,000 tonnes .
Opening stocks start next October expected 1.4 mln tonnes , 300,000 tonnes year-earlier levels , bringing total supplies 9.5 mln tonnes , said .
anticipated total supplies 500,000 tonnes season 's available amount , Mielke said .
increase mature palm tree areas Malaysia slow year , offset area expansion Indonesia , said .

ECUADOR TRADE SURPLUS FIRST FOUR MONTHS Ecuador posted trade surplus 10.6 mln dlrs first four months 1987 compared surplus 271.7 mln period 1986 , central bank Ecuador said latest monthly report .
Ecuador suspended sales crude oil , principal export product , March earthquake destroyed part oil-producing infrastructure .
Exports first four months 1987 around 639 mln dlrs imports 628.3 mln , compared 771 mln 500 mln respectively period last year .
Exports crude products first four months around 256.1 mln dlrs , compared 403.3 mln period 1986 .
central bank said January May Ecuador sold 16.1 mln barrels crude 2.3 mln barrels products , compared 32 mln 2.7 mln respectively period last year .
Ecuador 's international reserves end May around 120.9 mln dlrs , compared 118.6 mln end April 141.3 mln end May 1986 , central bank said .
gold reserves 165.7 mln dlrs end May compared 124.3 mln end April .

EUROPEAN COMMUNITY CRITICISES U.S TRADE MEASURES European Community ( EC ) accused United States violating political commitment free trade practices including tax imported gasoline customs user fee .
EC ambassador Tran Van-Thinh made formal charge surveillance body General Agreement Tariffs Trade ( GATT ) , GATT spokesman David Woods told reporters .
Woods also said EC joined United States criticising Brazil extending list products import licenses temporarily suspended , improve balance payments .
United States charged Japan violating GATT rules restricting imports agricultural products import licensing system .
United States asked consultations Tokyo issue .
Tran charged trade measures contravened political commitment halt reverse trade barriers , pledged ministers Punta del Este last September .
ministers established four year Uruguay round negotiate freer trade 13 areas , set GATT surveillance body monitor commitment , known GATT jargon `` standstill rollback . ''
Tran criticised Washington `` superfund '' tax oil imports , customs user fee , removal special machine tool ( known category FSC34 ) government procurement list reasons national security .
Warren Lavorel , U.S. Trade official , defended policies , saying violate GATT trade rules .
surveillance body send record today 's talks Trade Negotiating Committee , oversees round , decide action charges .
oil tax customs user fee already subject formal GATT dispute panels set outside Uruguay Round rule legality practices .
ruling GATT Council yesterday adopted dispute panel's report ruled U.S. Superfund tax oil imports breached trade rules .
called Washington modify legislation .
Mexico Canada , along European Community , brought dispute GATT last year .

ZAMBIAN COPPER INDUSTRY HOPES STEADY OUTPUT Zambia 's copper mining industry hoping achieve maintain production 500,000 tonnes year next years despite low world prices , deteriorating ores shortages mine inputs , industry officials said .
Zambia 's decision abandon last May 1 tough International Monetary Fund ( IMF ) economic recovery program introduced element uncertainty plans restructure ailing industry boost profitability , said .
Copper production government-controlled Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines ( ZCCM ) 1987 financial year ended March 31 improved slightly 471,000 tonnes record 1986 low 463,354 tonnes .
`` convinced end 1988 financial year , copper production could well 500,000 tonnes due greater availability spares equipment , '' ZCCM official said .
ZCCM officials said production cobalt , another strategic income earner , also tailored meet demand .
Finished production 1986 4,565 tonnes , 911 tonnes higher previous year best production achieved date .
Protracted low world metal prices badly hit copper industry Zambia , world 's fifth biggest producer .
Mining monopolised ZCCM accounts 90 pct country 's foreign exchange earnings .
Production also seriously affected recent years equipment breakdowns , deteriorating ore shortages spare parts , fuel lubricants .
463,354 tonnes output last year compared peak 1975 output 700,000 tonnes .
five-year production investment plan launched 1984 ZCCM funded European Community , African Development Bank World Bank .
plan foresees shutdown seven mining metallurgical units grounds unprofitable .
ZCCM , second largest employer government , said intends lay 20,000 60,000 workforce part plan .
250 mln dlrs far channelled industry bid improve efficiency profitability five-year restructuring plan .
Company officials said although reserves depleted , Zambia could continue produce copper beyond end century , though lower levels production .
Industry sources said ZCCM 's projected pre-tax profit financial year ended March 31 would around 500 mln kwacha .
current mineral export tax level levied , net loss likely registered .
ZCCM recorded net loss 718 mln kwacha 1986 compared net profit 19 mln kwacha year .
foreign exchange auction system introduced 1985 , ZCCM 's profits foreign exchange earnings rose value kwacha fell 21 dollar two dollar .
May 1 , President Kenneth Kaunda abolished auctioning system , inspired International Monetary Fund , announced Zambia would pursue go-it-alone economic strategy based national resources .
ZCCM officials still cautious effects break IMF industry 's plans .
`` still consulting see new measures affect us early say shall fare new situation , '' Peter Hansen , director operations third ZCCM hierarchy , told Reuters .
analysts believe new officially-fixed exchange rate eight kwacha dollar hit ZCCM 's export profits .
`` specialists talked tell break-even point ZCCM rate 10 kwacha per dollar , '' Frederick Chiluba , leader Zambian Congress Trade Unions said .
High production costs continue bedevil Zambian industry .
Zambia mines copper relatively expensive rate 69 cents per pound , compared 55 cents United States 40 cents Chile .
industry also faces transport problems due Zambia landlocked .
government confirmed year stopped sBending copper south South Africa .
80 pct shipments , 35,000 tonnes month , sent rail Tanzanian port Dar-es-Salaam , 5,000 tonnes go via Zimbabwe Mozambique port Beira .
Transport often hit shortages wagons , spares fuel .

Rio dockers get support colleagues Santos , Brazil 's main port , spokesman said would return work unless demands met .
Earlier week , 65,000 dockworkers cancelled scheduled national strike pressure port officials give wage increase benefits .
Rio port spokesman said halt would cause daily losses 100,000 U.S. dlrs .

year 's budget initially projected deficit 3.35 billion shillings mid-year government impose new taxes keep deficit roughly target .
figure final deficit avaialble .

Cotton December delivery 1.35 cents higher 70.95 cents lb midsession peaking morning 71.25 cents .

storm produced winds 75 mph .

isolated small portion West Texas area , probably less five pct , '' Mohler said .

hit July August ( fruiting would underway ) would worse , '' Mohler said .

BANK AMERICA SEES SLOW U.S. CONSUMER SPENDING trade-led boom U.S. unlikely year next growth net exports merely offset dramatic slowdown consumer spending sectors economy , Bank America said latest economic report .
Although net exports add 0.7 pct GNP year , reducing 1.2 pct 1986 , consumer spending contribute 1.4 pct less GNP last year .
result , GNP year likely expand modest 2.5 pct , rate last year , according Daniel Van Dyke , Bank America economist wrote report .
`` Growth consumer spending United States drop dramatically year jump inflation cause falloff growth disposable income , '' Van Dyke said .
Growth U.S. consumer spending likely slow 1.8 pct year 4.1 pct 1986 , predicted .
report released Commerce Department reported today personal income rose 0.2 pct May , increasing 0.4 pct April , personal consumption expenditures risen 0.1 pct , compared 0.6 pct increase month .
rising cost energy imports likely boost consumer prices average 3.7 pct year , 1.9 pct 1986 , Bank America forecast .
rise inflation reduce real disposable income growth 1.3 pct 1987 2.9 pct 1986 .
result , Van Dyke calculated purchasing power average family four increase modest 540 dlrs year compared surge 1,210 dlrs 1986 .
slowdown income growth likely cause housing starts drop 4.2 pct year six pct 1988 annual rate 1.63 mln units .
`` first time several years , recession 1988 1989 remote possibility , '' Van Dyke said .
Currently , U.S. growth fragile depends heavily improvement trade .
`` However , protectionist attitudes rise country , source growth risk , '' added .

month May , Brooklyn Union paid two dlrs per mln British Thermal Unit spot gas , contract gas costs four five dlrs per mln BTU , industry sources said .
Transco announced yesterday would longer provide open access transport spot natural gas customers fear accumulating take-or-pay liabilities .
Take-or-pay contracts oblige pipelines pay producers gas even delivery taken customers .
Brooklyn Union continue receiving small amount supplies minor fields grandfather clause , Brooklyn Union official said .
Foster Corwith , gas analyst Dean Witter Reynolds , said rising cost Booklyn Union passed rate payers .
net effect company known several months time lag deferred earnings , end-users , especially residential commercial customers , end paying gas , said .
closure takes place summer months gas demand seasonal low , impact cash flow would small , Curt Launer , natural gas analyst Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette , said .
situation persists winter heating season , high cost gas could cut company 's profits , said .
Gas utilities along eastern seaboard relying Transco spot gas , North Carolina Natural Gas Co & lt ; NCNG > , Piedmont Natural Gas Co & lt ; PNY > , face high cost factor Brooklyn Union , Steve Richards , supply manager end users supply system , Houston based natural gas brokering firm , said .
`` companies unwitting victims take-or-pay dispute Transco producers , '' said .

absence guidelines inventory charges Federal Energy Regulatory Commission , matter negotiated pipelines customers , Richards said .

SENATOR DEFENDS U.S .
MANDATORY FARM CONTROL BILL Sen. Tom Harkin , D-Iowa , defended controversial mandatory supply control farm bill said U.S. farmers allowed vote referendum whether approve proposal .
Harkin proposal would set loan rates 5.17 dlrs per bushel wheat , 3.77 dlrs corn 9.32 dlrs soybeans , put effect strict controls planted acreage reductions .
Present loan rates 2.28 dlrs wheat , 1.92 corn , effectively 4.56 soybeans .
Also plan , U.S. would seek world market sharing cartel European Community exporting nations , share-out export markets , Harkin said first several Senate Agriculture subcommittee hearings examining farm programs .
Harkin made following claims testimony `` Family Farm Act . ''
-- mandatory control bill would increase farm income reduce government spending agriculture .
-- Harkin said policy high price supports would ruin U.S. agricultural exports critics claim , would increase overall revenue exports .
would done seeking agreement among major exporting countries including European Community market sharing agreed high prices .
Sen. Christopher Bond , R-Mo. , countered hearing grain export cartel workable .
-- Harkin acknowledged higher commodity price supports would passed onto consumers , said high food prices stem `` gouging '' food processing companies high farm product prices .
Harkin cited termed `` excessive '' net returns equity five years 33.4 pct Kellogg , 31.9 pct Monfort , 22.8 pct Nabisco , 22.8 pct ConAgra , 21.2 pct H.J .
Heinz , 19.1 pct Ralston Purina , 17.2 pct Pillsbury 16.7 pct Quaker Oats .
-- Harkin said `` legitimate '' concern bill would impact higher prices livestock producers .
said transition higher prices , would allow livestock producers purchase Commodity Credit Corp. grain stocks three years .
Thereafter , livestock farmers would benefit `` predictable stable '' grain price , said .
-- Harkin said policy approach farm participation would `` mandatory '' current farm program .
said farmers must participate farm programs order receive credit planting protect farm income .

U.S.-CANADA TIES SEEN WORSE WITHOUT TRADE PACT U.S.-Canadian ties could worsen two nations unable reach free trade pact , according study published two nonpartisan public policy research groups .
Cato Institute Washington Fraser Institute Vancouver said removing remaining tariffs cross border trade would benefit countries .
Cato chairman William Niskanen added `` two nations' generally harmonious trade relations probably sustainable without new agreement . ''
United States Canada , whose cross-border trade totaled 125 billion dlrs last year , holding talks since last June pact end trade barriers remaining two countries .
U.S. put deadline talks October 1 , sides said agreement likely despite tough bargaining remained .
Niskanen said pact reached , bilateral trade ties could deteriorate Congressional pressure President Reagan implement trade laws aggressively , could hit Canadian trade practices .
noted Canada seeking foreign investment auto industry , could put strains considerable bilateral free trade U.S. Canadian autos parts .
Niskanen also said Canadian government vulnerable resurgence economic nationalism could restrict U.S. exports Canada .
free trade pact , backed President Reagan Prime Minister Brian Mulroney , would open new markets Canada enable industries achieve economies scale , would also help widen exports worldwide , said .
would also increase gross national products countries .
Niskanen said goal pact end tariffs within 10 years , lower subsidies exports , set rules trade services investments , end curbs government procurement agree ways resolve trade disputes .

FED DATA SUGGEST CHANGE MONETARY POLICY New U.S. Banking data suggest Federal Reserve guiding monetary policy along steady path signalling imminent change course , economists said .
also said money supply growth remains weak , week 's unexpected eight billion dlr M-1 decline suggests may , could influence Fed loosen credit reins move toward accommodative monetary policy .
Reuter survey 17 money market economists produced forecast 600 mln dlr M-1 decline week ended June 8 , estimates ranging gain one billion dlrs decline four billion .
Instead , M-1 fell eight billion dlrs 745.7 billion dlrs seasonally adjusted annual rate .
Coming heels 4.3 billion decrease M-1 week ended June 1 , means nation 's money supply fallen 12 billion dlrs past two weeks , economists said .
`` M-1 hit air pocket weakness , '' said Bill Sullivan Dean Witter Reynolds Inc .
M-1 may lost significance indicator economic growth , Sullivan said Fed officials might concerned latest drop M-1 means another month sluggish growth broader monetary aggregates , M-2 M-3 , seen better gauges economic growth .
Latest monthly M-2 M-3 data showed May , measures growing rates bottom Fed's 5-1/2 8-1/2 pct target ranges .
money growth accelerate , Fed officials , concerned indicates economic growth flagging , could turn toward easier monetary policy , economists said .
`` mean Fed abandons current open market position ?
, '' Sullivan said .
`` mean end tightening time ?
Definitely yes . ''
Economists said average adjusted discount window borrowings 385 mln dlrs latest two-week bank statement period lower expected .
believed Fed targetted two-week borrowings average around 500 mln dlrs .
said large one-day net miss Fed 's reserve projections , higher borrowings target would probably reached .
drop May U.S. Housing starts continued weakness auto sales show key sectors U.S. Economy lagging , recent modest 0.3 pct gain May producer prices helped dispel inflation fears , Slifer said .
`` continues , entertain notion Fed easing point , '' said .
economists said Fed would probably pay little attention weak money supply growth .
`` number years since M-1 given good signs 's going economy , '' one said .
`` n't think M-1 shows economy falling apart Fed ease . ''
Economists agreed stable dollar continue prerequisite move Fed toward easier monetary policy .
said Fed reluctant lower short-term rates fear would spur expectations weaker dollar higher inflation would push long-term yields choke econmomic growth .
Sullivan said dollar steady since late April .
`` Fed determine represents fundamental change dollar .
, gives room ease , '' said .

SHULTZ WARNS ASEAN LOOMING TRADE PROBLEM U.S. Secretary State George Shultz warned members Association Southeast Asian Nations ( ASEAN ) could longer rely increased exports U.S. growth .
`` Given importance exports , particularly export manufactures , countries , going work hard diversify markets , '' said .
`` may able maintain current market share U.S. , clearly able look U.S. take major increases exports , '' added .
Shultz told foreign ministers Brunei , Indonesia , Malaysia , Philippines , Singapore Thailand U.S. Would cut huge foreign trade deficit rapidly many believed .
said ASEAN 's looming trade problems would necessarily stem protectionist legislation contemplated Congress , `` simply adjustments U.S. Economy make order service large growing external debt . ''
Shultz said U.S. Deficit resulted falling exports higher imports fuelled world growth .

JAPAN PANEL URGES WORLD ECONOMIC ADJUSTMENTS Japan could avoid sharp rise value yen dollar Japan , U.S. nations succeeded restructuring economies , advisory panel government 's Economic Planning Agency ( EPA ) said .
advisory body said report yen would soar dollar structural adjustments global basis delayed .
EPA official told Reuters dollar could fall slightly 100 yen 1993 Japan U.S. Failed restructure economies .
dollar 's fall without structural adjustments would cut Japan 's current account surplus two pct gross national product ( GNP ) 1993 , report said .
said change would slow real GNP growth average two pct annually seven-year period 1993 .
two nations restructured economies , dollar would remain stable real terms , reducing Japan's current-account surplus 2.1 pct GNP 1993 .
scenario put Japan 's GNP growth 3.5 pct year .
forecast real growth three pct world economy four pct Japan 2,000 adjustments made .

said cuts resulted government decision let temporary business municipal tax reductions exported tin lapse June 3 .
taxes , levied tin mines , rose 4.4 pct month 1.1 pct ad valorem past year .
lower levels introduced last year temporary move aid tin industry prices collapsed late 1985 .

result , said , Thailand could fail fill 3,000 tonnes 19,000 tonne tin export quota allocated Association Tin Producing Countries ( ATPC ) year ending February 1988 .

supplies shortage prove temporary , however , Thai cabinet expected review Mineral Resources Department proposal reinstate low taxes late month , Yoot said .
department said Thailand exported 7,715 tonnes tin January/May compared 8,462 tonnes year ago .

SAUDI OIL RESERVES RISE DESPITE HIGHER OUTPUT Proven oil gas deposits Saudi Arabia increased 1986 despite higher oil output , according kingdom 's main producing company , Aramco .
Recoverable oil reserves Aramco fields rose 167 billion barrels end year 166.5 billion 1985 , gas reserves jumped 7.7 pct 135.8 trillion cu ft 126.1 trillion , company 's annual report said .
Aramco , responsible Saudi production except 200,000 barrels per day ( bpd ) Neutral Zone Saudi Arabia Kuwait , increased production 4.69 mln barrels per day 1986 3.04 mln barrels year earlier .
1986 virtual free-for-all production , OPEC members abandoned restraint effort recapture share market .
process , prices collapsed 28 dlrs barrel nine dlrs , organisation decided cut production last September onwards .
Saudi output 1985 lowest since 1960s .
Production natural gas liquids 1986 declined slightly 304,178 bpd 316,310 , said report , carried official Saudi Press Agency .
increase reserves came despite sharp cut number wells Aramco drilled 33 1986 103 1985 .
Aramco 's refinery , Ras Tannurah , processed 142.44 mln barrels ( 390,246 bpd ) crude last year .
plant upgraded capacity 530,000 bpd year , enabling supply 50 pct local demand oil products , report said .
country 's five , smaller refineries -- owned another state-owned oil organisation , Petromin -- produced around 750,000 bpd last year .
Sulphur production rose 1.23 mln tonnes 1986 998,707 tonnes 1985 .
year company began operating sulphur granule plant capacity 4,000 tonnes per day , report said .
Aramco said awarded 1,303 contracts last year worth 1.4 billion riyals -- 370 mln dlrs .

Secretary Finance Economic Planning Kwesi Botchwey made announcement last night accepting 7,891 tonnes rice worth four mln dlrs Japanese food aid programme .
lifting ban , imposed earlier year , follows government concern `` lower average rainfall southern Ghana implications major harvest . ''
Botchwey said rain lacking major cereal growing areas throughout south year .
Ministry Agriculture predicted fall least 25 pct major staple crops including maize , rice cassava .
GNA quoted Botchwey saying consequences current reduced rainfall nowhere near drought experiences 1982/83 government taken steps alleviate anticipated food production shortfalls .
failure seasonal rains already seriously affected drinking water supplies , farming fishing parts Central Volta regions Ghana rivers dried .

U.K .
LENDERS OFFER FIXED RATE MORTGAGES U.K .
Lenders offering homebuyers fixed interest rate mortgages borrower makes monthly payment matter happens interest rates .
mortgage rates lowest levels years , loans snapped eager home buyers trying lock cheap money .
decision offer fixed rate loans , industry officials said , reflects increasingly competitive nature home mortgage business .
fixed rate mortgages uncommon U.K. , mainstay business U.S. years ago .
early 1980s interest rates soared .
U.S .
Lenders , mostly savings loan associations , earning rates low three pct 30 year fixed rate mortgages held portfolios pay depositors rates high 15 pct induce retain accounts .
result hundreds institutions collapsed forced merge .
survivors decided offer mortgages whose rates would move line cost funds .
`` much example U.S .
Thrifts mind , '' said spokesman Abbey National Building Society , explaining institution , time , offering variable rate mortgages .
rash advertising solicit new business helped homebuyers become even choosier loans lenders concede forced undercut still .
Sharp cuts variable rate mortgages announced earlier week nation 's two largest building societies National Westminster Bank Plc reflect growing competition new business , officials three institutions said .
fixed rate mortgages offer carry interest rates even variable rate loans .

100 mln stg TSB set aside loans exhausted within days , according spokeswoman .

interest rates fall mortgage made lender earning average return assets .
interest rates rise homebuyer benefit cheap money .

money market rates risen contrary expectations company shelved plans time .

Foreign exchange reserves totalled 70.3 billion crowns , compared 68.4 billion April 88.0 billion year ago .
Gold reserves unchanged April 's 284.8 mln crowns , also unchanged year-ago figure .
Central Bank special drawing right holdings 3.16 billion crowns , compared 3.06 billion April 2.51 billion May 1986 .

U.S. COURT UPHOLDS APEX DECISION FAVORING NYMEX U.S. Court Appeals Second Circuit upheld lower court decision dismissing suit Apex Oil Co New York Mercantile Exchange several oil companies .
Court , however , ruled Apex Oil could pursue anititrust commodities market manipulation allegations Belcher Oil Co , unit Coastal Corp & lt ; CGP > .
Apex Oil , primarily trading company , charged several companies , including Belcher , NYMEX conspired force deliver heating oil sold mercantile exchange , knowing Apex could make full delivery .
NYMEX ordered Apex deliver four mln barrels heating oil sold via February 1982 heating oil contract .
Apex eventually fulfilled obligation claimed damages .
Richard Wiener , attorney Apex Cadwalader Wickersham Taft , said company yet decided whether pursue case Belcher Oil .
NYMEX , meanwhile , counterclaim pending Apex Oil , seeking unspecified amount attorney 's fees 15 mln dlrs punitive damages , according NYMEX spokeswoman .

COLD , WET WEATHER SLOWS BEET GROWTH W. EUROPE Cold wet weather northern , western central parts Europe continued slow beet growth plant density reported good countries , sugar statistician F.O .
Licht said .
Temperatures low season rain hampered field work occasionally led water-logged fields .
eastern southeastern Europe , warmer weather boosted sugar beet growth .
Weather Soviet Union also allowed good beet development , Licht said .
Sweden beet growth delayed , although plant population reported regular good .
Cool rainy weather slowed beet growth Denmark crop prospects rated slightly normal .
United Kingdom Ireland , rather cool heavy rainfall places delayed beet growth .
France , Belgium , Netherlands , West Germany , mostly cool frequent often heavy rainfall continued slow beet growth often made field work impossible .
Austria , warm rainfall , favourable beet growth , Licht said .
Czechoslovakia Poland , mostly warm , favouring beet development .
heavy rain may caused damage .
European beet growing regions Soviet Union , warm showers areas weather generally good emergence growth beets .
south eastern Europe , warm weather rainfall boosted beet development .
Labour trouble threatens beet crop Spain .
Disputes factories trade unions threatening delay start processing southern areas , beets maturing early year .

AFRICAN STATES AGREE REGIONAL TARIFF CUTS Fifteen countries Eastern Southern Africa agreed cut tariffs regional trade 10 pct every two years 1996 .
statement Preferential Trade Area ( PTA ) , seeks create common market stretching Ethiopia north Lesotho south , said governments would make first tariff cut next year .
1996 would assess impact tariff reductions work new timetable complete elimination barriers trade year 2000 .
PTA , set 1982 , groups Burnudi , Comoros , Djibouti , Ethiopia , Kenya , Lesotho , Malawi , Mauritius , Rwanda , Somalia , Swaziland , Tanzania , Uganda , Zambia Zimbabwe .
PTA sources said agreement averted split members wanting progress towards free trade weaker states concerned effects customs revenue .
reductions cover common list 300 widely traded commodities goods PTA sources said organisation planned expand list include 425 items .

Wheat , durum , oats barley crops one-pct headed , rye 40 pct milk stage winter wheat 21 pct milk stage .

U.S. OIL PRICES STRONG AHEAD OPEC MEETING U.S. crude oil prices highest level year ahead next week 's OPEC meeting , even though industry analysts expect policy changes session .
said prices , steadily climbed since organization 's accord December , risen technical factors within market concerns supplies Iran-Iraq war , could disrupt deliveries Gulf .
U.S. benchmark crude West Texas Intermediate trading around 20.55 dlrs July contract New York Mercantile Exchange 's energy futures spot market .
highest level since January 1986 .
OPEC conference president Rilwanu Lukman , Nigeria's oil minister , said Friday expects meeting Vienna brief calm OPEC 's current price production agreement may need slight review .
Although industry experts expect reaffirmation December agreement , oil prices continue climb due desire hedge positions case surprises .
Analysts expect higher prices continue soon OPEC meeting .
point , barring increased tension Gulf changes OPEC 's policies , prices begin easing .
`` OPEC probably anything n't already agreed December oil prices firm , '' said John Hill , vice president Merrill Lynch Futures .
OPEC agreed December maintain official oil prices 18 dlrs barrel raise group 's production ceiling 16.6 mln barrels per day third quarter 18.3 mln barrels fourth quarter .
agreement helped send prices sharply higher , rising 15 dlrs barrel early December .
Several OPEC members price hawks , including Iran , Algeria Libya , seek higher official price reduction output .
`` U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude continues trade 20 dlrs barrel , greater chance OPEC raise official 18 dlrs price , '' said Nauman Barakat , analyst Smith Barney , Harris Upham Co .
analysts expect moderate producers , Saudi Arabia , block changes policy .
`` meeting non-event change official prices OPEC , particular Saudis , committed stabilizing market , '' said Rosario Ilacqua , analyst L.F. Rothschild .
However , analysts said OPEC may need hold meeting September re-evaluate market conditions .
Overproduction OPEC become real problem fourth quarter quota raised 18.3 mln barrels day Iraq 's pipeline Turkey brings another 500,000 barrels market day , said John Lichtblau , president Petroleum Industry Ressearch Foundation .
expect Saudi Arabia oppose price increase meeting many look increase year-end 20 dlrs offset decline dollar .
Oil prices denominated throughout world dollars , currency declines , producers receive less money oil .
`` real production restraint OPEC Saudi Arabia , '' said Sanford Margoshes , analyst Shearson Lehman Brothers .
`` second half year expect Saudis produce 4.1 mln barrel day quota therefore act vehicle stablize market pave way two dlrs barrel price increase December 1987 meeting , '' said .
One uncertain factor course Iran-Iraq war .
`` wild card increased tensions Persian Gulf , '' said Frank Knuettel , analyst Prudential-Bache Securites .
Oil tankers taking oil Iraq Kuwait regular targets Iranian planes .
Reagan administration planning put Kuwait tankers protection U.S. flag , naval escorts .
`` Extra ( oil ) inventories needed time crisis like , general nervousness incident could disrupt oil supplies drives prices , '' Knuettel said .
