M-1-A , M-1 plus daily interest chequable non-personal deposits , fell 874 mln dlrs 79.97 billion dlrs M-2 , M-1-A plus notice personal fixed-term deposits , fell 952 mln dlrs 184.45 billion dlrs .
M-3 , non-personal fixed term deposits foreign currency deposits residents booked chartered banks Canada , fell 549 mln dlrs 225.30 billion dlrs .
Chartered bank general loans outstanding fell 584 mln dlrs 127.58 billion dlrs .
Canadian liquid plus short term assets rose 20 mln dlrs 37.96 billion dlrs total Canadian dollar major assets chartered banks fell 753 mln dlrs 229.05 billion dlrs .
Chartered bank net foreign currency assets fell 92 mln dlrs minus 1.92 billion dlrs .
Notes circulation totalled 17.11 billion dlrs , 59 mln dlrs week .
Government cash balances rose 26 mln dlrs 2.65 billion dlrs week ended June 17 .
Government securities outstanding fell 424 mln dlrs 227.38 billion dlrs week ended June 17 , treasury bills rose 700 mln dlrs 78.00 billion dlrs Canada Savings Bonds fell 121 mln dlrs 42.45 billion dlrs .

Jewellery consumption set rise 70,000 ounces , Clark predicted speech , text released London today .
Clark said forecast allowed modest increase investment buying may well cautious .
said South Africa likely source additional supplies need increase output 500,000 ounces meet increased demand .
capital investment required produce additional output would around one billion U.S. Dlrs political climate may make difficult raise money , said .
Soviet Union , whose exports declined since 1970s , might increase sales West 50,000 ounces , Clark said .
`` probability growth demand set massive investment required expansion - expansion viable South Africa Russia - leads conclude price platinum substantially underpinned medium long-term , '' Clark said .

EUROPEAN COFFEE TRADE PROPOSES NEW QUOTA FORMULA European coffee roasters traders agreed propose new formula calculating International Coffee Organization , ICO , quotas , Dutch Coffee Trade Association chairman chairman Frits van Horick said .
Van Horick , council member European Coffee Federation , speaking end ECF annual meeting .
new formula based six-year moving averages would give Brazil , world 's biggest coffee producer , unchanged quota remaining two years current coffee agreement , van Horick said .
accepted consumer producer members ICO , formula could also basis negotiating new agreement , van Horick said .
Coffee quotas suspended February last year prices shot fears drought-induced crop disaster Brazil .
Although prices considerably lower , consumers producers unable agree re-introduction .
`` Brazil strongly change formula feared lower quota .
proposal leaves little object , '' van Horick said .
`` existing quota system far rigid reflect supply demand reality , '' said .
`` formula builds flexibility system benefit almost everyone . ''
Although full implications new formula still worked , initial estimates suggest countries Colombia , Kenya , Indonesia Costa Rica would get slightly higher quotas , others Ivory Coast , El Salvador Nicaragua would lose quota share , van Horick said .
proposal provides future quota distribution must reflect current demand actual supply , also prevent under-shipment quota countries would automatically prejudice following year 's quota .
`` ICO consumers accept proposal stands least fair chance accepted producers September meeting , generally favour new quota formula , `` van Horick said .
time much depend Brazil 's attitude .
`` Brazil increasingly isolated producer side .
frost damage coffee crop next two months producers favour proposal , might get agreement , '' van Horick added .

next tender , Aug/Sept/Oct shipment , set June 24 , spokesman said .

LATIN , CARIBBEAN NATIONS OPPOSE TRADE BILLS group Latin American Caribbean nations formally opposed trade legislation pending Congress , saying would curb exports , slow development hinder ability repay foreign debt .
Mario Rodriguez Montero , president Organization American States special committee trade , said aware large U.S. trade deficit , added `` region one affected trade bills . ''
said causes deficit strong dollar budget deficit , `` regrettable solve trade bill would serve private U.S .
interests . ''
Rodriguez made comment news conference two days meetings U.S. officials trade bills Congress designed reduce U.S. trade deficit , last year hit record 166.3 billion dlrs .
Congressional observers say bills aimed mainly Japan , Taiwan , South Korea nations large , annual trade surpluses United States .
Mexico , Brazil Venezuela Latin nations large trade surpluses last year United States , even Mexico , largest , surplus 5.2 billion dlrs , Japan 's 58.6 billion dlrs .
European Community also opposed bills .
Rodriguez said Latin Caribbean nations backed Reagan Administration 's opposition many sections legislation , including curb imports require retaliation foreign unfair trade practices .
told reporters committee would likely mount campaign fight legislation comes debate Senate floor , expected next week .
Rodriguez said `` region needs trade continue development .
hope need affected negatively trade legislation . ''
Rodriguez said : `` need keep market opens - especially U.S. market - obtain necessary foreign exchange service debt also continue national development progress . ''
President Reagan said would veto legislation termed `` protectionist , '' aides mounting effort water objectionable provisions legislation .
Asked whether Reagan ready cast veto , Rodriguez said yet `` administration veto frame mind . ''

Jon Rosenbaum , assistant U.S. trade representative back trade talks Colombia , said producing countries accept sort standardized criteria must agreed reintroduce coffee quotas .
`` one country evidently still , '' Rosenbaum said obvious reference Brazil , negative recently reintroduction quotas .
Rosenbaum said stance Brazil outlook agreement reintroduce coffee quotas September International Coffee Organization meeting hard predict .
said visit Bogota held technical discussions Colombian officials .
meet Jorge Cardenas , head Colombian coffee producers federation , Europe , Cardenas left `` positive letter , '' Rosenbaum said .
Cardenas letter responded U.S. letter last month praised Colombia trying find compromise formula reintroduction quotas , outlined several concerns technical details Colombian plan .
Rosenbaum could reached later day comment new formula calculating ICO quotas agreed European coffee roasters traders .
Dutch coffee trade association chairman Frits van Horick said Amsterdam new formula based six year moving averages would give Brazil unchanged export quota remaining years current coffee agreement .
U.S. said agree coffee quotas unless `` objective criteria '' reflect recent changes coffee market used set export limits .

NEW LEADER COMING U.S. SEC CHALLENGING ERA President Reagan 's nominee top policeman nation 's securities markets inherit agency challenged insider trading scandal , wild stock price gyrations host uncertainties stemming globalization financial markets .
David Ruder , 58-year-old Republican law professor Northwestern University Evanston , Ill. , named Thursday 23rd chairman five-member U.S. Securities Exchange Commission .
confirmed Senate , expected , succeed John Shad , left agency earlier week record six years chairman become ambassador Netherlands .
SEC limelight past year investigators probed colossal insider trading scandal ever uncovered Wall Street .
investigation , still active , mushroomed recent months growing number well known traders prominent investment banking firms charged wrongdoing .
pace probe picked markedly November Ivan Boesky , one Wall Street 's successful stock speculators , agreed cooperate government investigators pay record 100 mln dlrs penalties illegal profits charged insider trading .
agency also wrestling vexing new phenomenon huge rapid swings stock prices , spurred computer-driven trading strategies span markets securities , options futures .
price gyrations combined rising trading volumes bring unprecedented volatility U.S. securities markets .
time , SEC pressed lawmakers put stop abusive tactics corporate takeover contests unrelenting wave takeovers steadily reshapes U.S. corporate landscape .
agency pushed U.S. foreign exchanges intent expansion lay regulatory groundwork international securities marketplace trading occurs across borders throughout world , around clock .
worldwide trading networks offer vast new investment opportunities could strain SEC 's ability enforce U.S. securities laws guard investors fraud .
leadership Shad , SEC eased financial disclosure requirements publicly traded companies , eliminated many minor investor protection rules , attempted spur competition among exchanges streamlined agency's review hostile corporate takeovers .
Shad , vice chairman E. F. Hutton investment banking firm , brought Wall Street perspective agency upon named chairman 1981 .
line views top administration officials , favored marketplace determination takeover battles new federal regulations .
SEC Shad also stressed prosecution insider trading violations corporate wrongdoing cases topped agency 's enforcement agenda administration President Jimmy Carter , Democrat .
Securities lawyers industry officials acquainted Ruder say new chairman-designate unlikely significantly alter commission 's current priorities .
SEC currently 2,000 employees , lawyers , annual budget 115 mln dlrs though figure likely significantly higher next year agency moves beef enforcement staff .
agency one government actually taken money spent past years fees charges public companies , investment banks securities firms regulates .
SEC structured independent regulatory agency , meaning five commissioners appointed president fixed five-year terms protected firing policy differences alone .
law , three commissioners may political party , agency prepares budget request year instead leaving White House .
Established Congress 1934 , SEC traces origins great stock market crash 1929 , attributed large part widespread trading credit attempted market manipulations large investment firms .
agency requires public companies investment vehicles mutual funds issue periodic reports financial condition disclose changes condition time issue new securities .
requires brokers , dealers investment banks register comply investor protection rules , polices exchanges regulates trading practices .
first chairman Joseph Kennedy , industrial magnate also father John Kennedy , later become nation 's 35th president .
former chairmen include William Douglas , served 1937 appointment U.S. Supreme Court 1939 , William Casey , served President Nixon's first term Reagan 's director Central Intelligence Agency death earlier year .
U.S. ASKS CONGRESS REVISE TARIFF CATEGORIES Administration asked Congress replace U.S. tariff schedule new system bring line international tariff categories , U.S. Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter said .
new system add items fiber optics accurately define new composites , items widely traded current schedule devised 30 years ago .
Yeutter said Harmonized System , new schedule called , change tariff categories definitions meet present-day needs exporters importers , pay rates duties .
Yeutter said , `` American exporters find far easier deal one standardized worldwide system variety differing systems face . ''
said new system ended 12 years multinational negotiations create unified tariff schedule .
Yeutter said government business moves based data tariff schedules new system improve knowledge trade flows quality decision-making .
said 56 nations pledged bring standards new system , half expected join system January 1988 .

open access , gas pipelines serve purely transport company , moving gas suppliers customers .

exposure faced industry stems take pay contracts , pipelines bought gas long-term contracts could sell .
problem grew severe customers cheaper sources gas open access .
industry analysts speculated earlier week Tenneco might follow Transco 's lead close pipelines open-access take-or-pay issue .

spokesman said Tenneco faces 1.7 billion dlrs exposure take-or-pay contracts , specific figure Tennessee Gas , runs 2,000 miles pipelines Louisiana Texas New England .
`` remain convinced critical transitional issue facing industry -- take-or-pay -- must resolved FERC near future .

Thomas .

U.S. ECONOMY SLOWDOWN RAISES RECESSION FEARS economy faces lackluster growth risk recession year recent improvement U.S. exports falter , economists say .
Growth slow sharply next months due weakness key housing auto sectors could hampered unless consumer spending picks , say .
`` factors raise question : enough strength keep economy tipping recession ? ''
said Lyle Gramley , chief economist Mortgage Bankers Association former Federal Reserve Board official .
Commerce Department said week economy grew robust 4.8 pct annual rate first quarter , U.S. monetary official called weak report .
Housing starts fell 2.7 pct May , consumer spending rose weak 0.1 per cent .
`` two largest visible industries -- autos housing -- faltering , exports picking slack , `` Martin Mauro , senior economist Merrill Lynch Economics , told Reuters .
Gramley said worried consumer spending may slow inflation rising faster real wages .
offset , U.S. exports must continue rise , returning enough jobs manufacturing sector boost personal income consumption , says .
`` expect see enough improvement real net exports keep recession happening , close call , '' Gramley said .
Federal Reserve Board Governor Martha Seger told reporters apparent strength 4.8 pct growth figure result temporary buildup inventories last said recovery showing anemia .

SAUDI OIL COMPANY GETS NEW ACTING GOVERNOR acting governor Saudi Arabia's state-owned oil company , Petromin , Jamal Hassan Jawa , retired request , oil industry sources said .
said Ali Ibrahim Rubaishi , head organisation planning Petromin , would take acting governor .
Jawa held post since predecessor , Abdul-Hadi Taher , left major oil industry shake last December .
sources said Rubaishi expected hold post permanently .
government removed Taher Oil Minister Ahmed Zaki Yamani posts late last year move industry sources said aimed coming grips buyers ' oil market .
two men run Saudi oil industry 20 years .
Industry sources said despite huge resources , Saudi Arabia unable mould oil marketing strategy tuned competitive realities 1980s glut .
Hisham Nazer , replaced Yamani , successfully led OPEC-engineered return fixed oil prices 18 dlrs barrel last December .
Nazer believed reviewing Saudi oil operations could lead thorough overhaul way Saudi Arabia business , sources said .
sources said possible candidates governor's job include Prince Abdul Aziz Ibn Salman Ibn Abdul Aziz , earlier ran research center Saudi Arabia 's University Petroleum Minerals , former Deputy Planning Minister Faisal Beshir .
also list Abdulla Bakr , President University Petroleum Minerals , economist Ali Jonahi , Ahmed Shinawi , Zuheir Masoud , director Jeddah Islamic Port .

`` took positive view OPEC meeting Vienna , '' said .
`` accord reached means stability oil market shall continue making contribution . ''
cuts , originally brought February 1 , would probably officially approved July 10 parliament , Helle said .
ministry written Norway 's oil companies would discuss best implement cuts .
OPEC agreed weekend Vienna output ceiling 16.6 mln barrels per day ( bpd ) rest 1987 retained fixed prices set December accord based 18 dlr per barrel reference point .
OPEC 's first half 1987 output ceiling 15.8 mln bpd , 's December pact provisionally set third quarter ceiling 16.6 mln bpd , rising 18.3 mln fourth quarter .
Norway , pumps around one mln bpd offshore fields , previously said would continue output curbs planned production rest year OPEC remained within December accord output prices .
Norway 's oil production rose 10 pct average around 840,000 bpd 1986 .
Since risen around one mln bpd , expected reach 1.5 mln bpd 1995 .
7.5 pct cut planned production implemented since February reduced Norway 's oil output 80,000 bpd .
Norway 's Oil Minister Arne Oeien , currently Iceland meeting Nordic ministers , made official statement latest oil production cutbacks .
past year several leading non-OPEC producers , including Soviet Union , Mexico , China , Malaysia Egypt also pledged support OPEC 's bid keep prices stable .
Norway decided initial round cuts following OPEC agreement last December boosted oil prices around 18 dlrs per barrel around 14 15 dlrs last December .

firmer oil prices since brought stability economy helped narrow foreign trade deficit .

said country 's total import bill ( commercial imports ) expected reach 2.7 billion dlrs new year compared 2.4 billion dlrs 1986/87 .
minister said ending restrictions imports cars dropping 50 pct sales tax small cars would harm economy .

`` conference expressed satisfaction positive results agreement signed December , 1986 , OPEC re-established system fixed price level 18 dlrs per barrel supported OPEC production ceilings distributed national production levels .

`` conference examined supply/demand outlook second half year decided order secure continued firm prices market , OPEC production fourth quarter 1987 equal third quarter , I.E .
16.6 mln barrels per day ( bpd ) , distributed national production levels defined above-mentioned agreement quarter . ''
`` Furthermore , conference decided establish committee five heads delegation monitor price evolution market relation OPEC official prices order secure price stability around opec price structure .
`` significant change market prices , committee would immediately call extraordinary meeting conference view deciding necessary OPEC production levels second half year , would secure desired market stability . ''
`` conference reiterated necessity member countries ' strict adherence agreement signed December 1986 , terms official price , national production , levels .
`` purpose , conference decided establish committee three heads delegation undertake visits member countries order motivate comply terms agreement . ''
`` Moreover , conference stressed necessity cooperation oil-producing exporting countries outside OPEC essential prerequisite lasting market stability .
conference , therefore , decided reinstate group five heads delegation established 77th ( extraordinary ) meeting conference April , 1986 undertake necessary contacts countries .

IRAQ REJECTS NEW OPEC OIL QUOTA Iraq rejected new OPEC production quota set Vienna second half year , official Iraqi news agency INA reported .
quoted Oil Minister Issam Abdul-Rahim al-Chalabi , returned Sunday , saying `` Iraq continue adhere position considering included agreement . ''
Last December , Iraq rejected assigned first half 1987 quota 1.466 mln bpd demanded share equal 2.255 mln bpd quota set Iran , enemy nearly seven-year-old Gulf war .
accord reached OPEC ministers Vienna Saturday set output ceiling 16.6 mln bpd group 's 13 members July December , raising Iraq 's share 1.54 mln bpd Iran 's 2.369 mln .

IVORY COAST WEATHER PROBLEM 1986/87 CROPS Ivory Coast rainfall season less previous years , 1986/87 cocoa coffee production suffered , official Ivorian daily Fraternite Matin reported .
newspaper speculate whether recent dry conditions seriously threatened main 1987/88 cocoa crop .
Trade sources said weather could irrelevant good rainfall coming weeks .
Precipitation present campaign lowest northern savannah regions , cotton crop especially benefitted dry weather , Fraternite Matin said .
Agriculture Minister Denis Bra Kanon said earlier month 1986/87 cotton output would record 213,506 tonnes , compared 190,000 tonnes 1985/86 .
Fraternite Matin said mainstays Ivorian agriculture little affected dry weather .
Coffee need much water survive old cocoa plants affected regions , added .
London-based dealer Gill Duffus recently forecast 1986/87 Ivory Coast cocoa output record 590,000 tonnes , compares 585,000 estimated 1985/86 .
described early development new main crop patchy .
U.S. Agriculture Department ( USDA ) earlier year forecast drop 1986/87 coffee production Ivory Coast due drought western part country .
estimated crop 3.84 mln bags compared previous year's 4.33 mln bag harvest .
Ivorian officials described year 's coffee crop `` normal . ''

annual rate stayed U.S. second month succession , following release figures showing U.S. Inflation 3.8 pct April May .

move designed government improve India's trade deficit .

scheme replaces current rules allow different amounts foreign exchange used firms attain minimum annual turnover prescribed product .

include oil cakes , cereals , raw cotton , raw semi-processed leather , gems , castor sandalwood oil , psyllium husks seeds , opium various mineral ores .

said American decision inevitably carries risk armed confrontation , Iran -- despite blunt rhetoric -- would want avoid much Washington .

risk Iranian attack U.S .
Warships Kuwaiti oil tankers carrying U.S .
Flag naval escort rated diplomats low .

U.S. increasing Gulf fleet seven 10 warships sending refurbished battleship Missouri patrol outside Strait Hormuz .
build-up ties U.S. plans start escorting Kuwaiti oil tankers next month , re-registered fly American flag give naval protection .

military source Gulf said Iran also set launching site Silkworms captured Iraqi soil Faw peninsula , within range Kuwait .

`` 're fairly wet pattern normal normal moisture week . ''
Mohler said rainfall averaged 1/2 inch across southern Minnesota , 3/4 inch southwest Iowa , one inch eastern Nebraska 1-1/2 inches south-central Nebraska .
Illinois fields saw virtually rain weekend receiving scattered thundershower activity today , said .

day Campeau increased tender offer 80 pct Allied 's stock 55 pct raised bid 66 dlrs share 58 dlrs Sept 29 , Allied partnership headed DeBartolo began negotiating takeover deal aimed thwarting Campeau , SEC said .
Kern decided disclosing talks amended SEC filing , agency charged .
Allied 's first disclosure DeBartolo takeover made Oct 8 , even though board approved merger Oct 3 merger agreement executed Oct 7 , complaint said .
DeBartolo Campeau later engaged bitter battle control Allied , Campeau winning later October bought block 25.8 mln shares Allied stock , 48 pct total , controversial move made minutes dropped hostile tender offer .

U.S. END NETHERLANDS ANTILLES TAX TREATY Treasury Department said notified Netherlands terminating 1948 income tax treaty applies Netherlands Antilles Aruba .
termination effective January 1 , 1988 , Treasury said two-sentence announcement .
Treasury decided end treaty negotiations United States Netherlands past eight years failed reach accord , Treasury spokesman said .
decision means sale U.S. parent companies Eurobonds Netherlands Antilles subsidiaries longer free 30 pct U.S. withholding tax , spokesman said .
Terminating tax treaty Netherlands Antilles may cause bond issuers call bonds early .
maturities 10 years less issued 1984 , spokesman said .
said Treasury expect action adverse effect U.S. issuers bonds general decline interest rates means able refinance lower interest rates .
However , holders bonds presumably faced lower yields .

SAN FRANCISCO , REGION , HURT RESTRUCTURING Corporate mergers acquisitions around San Francisco past seven years modest effect metropolitan area 's economy , leading business-backed organization said .
Bay Area Council , group 300 business firms , said study corporate restructuring nine-county area found San Francisco suffered ill effects corporate shake-ups surrounding communities .
Seventeen 32 Fortune 500 companies area left due corporate restructuring 1979 1986 , another 21 firms added list .
Ten departing companies based San Francisco .
period , six located city achieved Fortune 500 status .
Ted Hall , council director local managing director McKinsey Co. conducted survey , said study grew concern mergers acquisitions seriously hurt economic climate northern California .
However , Hall said 36,000 jobs lost region , 600,000 new jobs created period .
time , said , region experienced greater rise per capita income lower unemployment rest United States California .
Council President George Keller , also chairman chief executive officer Chevron Corp. , told news conference region difficulties persuading companies locate fragmented local political system .
said amenities living San Francisco , envy many chief executives metropolitan area .
`` 's great place run business , '' added , `` hell place business government . ''
study concluded Chevron , mergered Gulf Oil 1984 , would benefit long run restructuring activity .
Among corporate headquarters lost period Crown Zellerbach , Memorex , Southern Pacific , Castle & amp ; Cooke Rolm .
Companies grew enough period make Fortune 500 list included Apple Computer , Pacific Telesis , McKesson , Tandem Computer , U.S. Leasing Amfac .
study management consulting firm said , partly due corporate restructuring , rate job growth San Francisco slowed since 1980 .
addition , said loss corporate leadership adversely affected Bay Area 's civic charitable activities .

CHEVRON N.SEA FIND MAY HOLD 300 MLN BBLS -ANALYSTS North Sea oil find announced Chevron Corp 's & lt ; CHV > Chevron Exploration North Sea Ltd may indicate new field recoverable crude oil reserves 300 mln barrels , industry analysts said .
Chevron said sidetrack well block 16/26 U.K. Continental shelf tested 9,000 barrels per day ( bpd ) 20 API crude oil tertiary `` Alba '' sand three-inch surface choke .
`` estimated amount oil Alba field around 320 mln barrels , '' Paul Spedding stockbroker Kleinwort Grieveson Co told Reuters .
said industry estimates put total reserves field one billion barrels , given low gravity oil , recovery rate would expected around 20-25 pct .
Analysts said results encouraging , potential difficulty operating recovering oil field shown fact first well plugged sidetrack drilled .
`` field seems shallow widespread , require multi-platform development recovery , pushing costs , '' Christopher Osborne stockbroker Hoare Govett said .
analysts said although low gravity oil found would require additional costs recovery , test well showed flows well .
`` Although gravity oil field seems low , seems flow quite well around 300 mln barrels could recovered , '' Carol Bell Phillips Drew told Reuters .
However , Chevron officials declined comment analysts ' reserve estimates .
said without research drilling area summer , would disclose reserve figures .
Analysts said field declared commercial developed , would ready local market heavy crude produced .
`` refineries upgraded refine heavy oils price differentials heavy light crudes lot narrower today , '' Osborne said .
Chevron operates block behalf 16 companies include British Petroleum Development Ltd , DSM Hydrocarbons ( UK ) Ltd , Enterprise Oil ( TNS ) Ltd , Marathon Int .
Pet .
( GB ) Ltd Phillips Petroleum Co U.K. Ltd .

ECUADOR PRODUCE OPEC QUOTA - MINISTER Ecuador produce crude oil excess 221,000-bpd OPEC quota second half year , Energy Minister Fernando Santos Alvite told news conference .
Ecuador plans produce 280,000 bpd August , rising 320,000 bpd next January , minister said .
`` producing quota pay crude products lent Venezuela , Nigeria Kuwait compensate crude unable produce past months , '' said .
Earthquake damage pipeline sharply cut Ecuadorean production March May year .
Santos said move explained fellow OPEC members last week 's meeting Vienna , increase Ecuador 's quota 221,000 bpd 210,000 approved .
`` understood position believe remain within spirit ( quota ) agreement , '' said .
Immediately March quake Ecuadorean production 250,000-260,000 bpd , 144,000 bpd exported .
production , Venezuela , Nigeria Kuwait loaned Ecuador total 12 mln barrels crude four mln barrels products , Santos said .

Azpur told reporters cabinet meeting measure `` fundamental conserving economic financial strength petroleum industry . ''
said new exchange rate , goes central bank final approval tommorrow , allow state oil company Petroleos De Venezuela , S.A. ( PDVSA ) solve problem working capital implement investment plans , estimated 20 billion bolivars 1987 .
say measure would become effective .
Venezuela 's oil industry previously sold dollar earnings government 7.50 dollar bought foreign exchange imports 14.50 bolivars .
new exchange rate promote purchases domestic goods services industry , Azpur said .
added would also put PDVSA position purchase government debt bonds .
PDVSA available liquid assets 20 billion bolivars start year , nine billion trust fund Central Bank Venezuela ( BCV ) placed government bonds .

INTEREST RATES HURT U.S. MAY HOUSING SALES Sales new single-family homes tumbled 14.9 pct May April levels higher mortgage interest rates , analysts said .
`` another month two weak new home sales interest rates stabilizing , sale new homes become stable mid-summer , '' said economist Lawrence Chimerine Wharton Econometrics Inc .
drop May , seasonally adjusted annual rate 616,000 units , largest since January 1982 , Commerce Department said .
Interest rates conventional mortgages bottomed 9.08 pct March rose 10.7 pct April , according Stephen Roach , economist Morgan Stanley .
effect freeze potential new homebuyers market , others said .
`` rates moved suddenly certainly unexpected homebuyers , '' said Cynthia Latta , economist Data Resources .
`` startled , wanted hold back see would happen . ''
drop sales new single-family home sales sharper expected , economists said .
`` fully expected decline extent anticipated , '' said James Christian , chief economist U.S. League Savings Institutions .
Christian said sharp rise May sales existing homes , generally less expensive new homes .
Latta Data Resources said strong sales new condominiums Northeast West Coast reflected sales existing new homes .
Christian U.S. League Savings Institutions said , `` Underlying housing demand remains strong .
think market going stabilize give us good second half . ''
Others less optimistic , however .
`` clearly wo n't boom ( new home sales ) n't think start collapse single-family housing , '' said Chimerine Wharton .
Eugene Sherman , chief economist Federal Home Loan Bank New York , said , `` lower sales level maintained awhile another change rates .
wo n't much specific improvement coming months . ''

determined stand firm certainly win . ''

ISRAEL MINISTER SEES INCREASED EXPORTS U.S. Israel 's exports U.S. must double next five years mideast nation's goal economic independence achieved , said Gad Yaacobi , Israeli minister Economy Communication .
Speaking American-Israel Chamber Commerce seminar , Yaacobi said 1986 Israeli exports U.S. 2.3 billion dlrs one-third Israel 's total exports , imports U.S. around 1.8 billion dlrs roughly one-sixth total .
`` convinced Israel exports U.S. reach five billion dlrs next five years , learn function American marketplace place greater emphasis product quality , '' Yaacobi said .
weakening dollar vis-a-vis European currencies `` bottleneck increasing exports U.S. , '' Yaacobi said expects Israel extend recent trend toward higher U.S. exports .
last ten years , Israeli exports U.S. rose fivefold , 417 mln dlrs 2.3 billion 1986 , imports rose 888 mln dlrs 1.8 billion last year .
Yaacobi said export growth must increase ten eleven pct annually , rate achieved 1973 Yom Kippur War .
said U.S./Israel Free Trade agreement , passed last year eliminating duties commercial restrictions two nations 1994 , would continue facilitate desired export growth .
Dual agreements included FTA allow Israel act economic bridge U.S. Europe , enabling U.S. firms export Europe lower cost certain percentage exported produced Israel , vice-versa .
Yaacobi said tensions among nations middle east one main reasons Israel yet able achieve economic potential .
Since 1973 U.S. given Israel 25 billion dlrs aid , went defense expenditures financing military conflicts `` imposed Israel , '' said .
Short achieving Israel 's full growth potential , however , Yaccobi said would still possible achieve economic independence 1993 1994 , based assumption exports doubled 1986 levels time period .

PAKISTAN UNVEILS NEW TRADE POLICY BOOST EXPORTS Pakistani government allowed freer cotton rice export three-year new trade policy aimed narrowing country 's yawning trade gap .
Commerce Planning Minister Mahbubul Haq said televised speech government also decided allow duty-free import cotton yarn make textile industry competitive , link bulk tea imports export Pakistani products .
Cotton rice Pakistan 's main exports , handled exclusively state corporations since early 1970s .
Haq said private sector would also export cotton rice along corporations , meets long-standing demand local traders .
duty-free import cotton yarn allowed bring prices help local ancillary industries compete effectively world market , said .
Haq said new policy , effective fiscal year 1987/88 beginning July 1 , would three years reviewed every year .
departure previous practice announcing trade policies single fiscal year , Haq said would enable businessmen plan market strategies longer period .
said export credit 250 mln dlrs provided export engineering goods selected third world countries soft credit terms .
Pakistan 's 1986/87 exports 3.6 billion dlrs , 18.2 per cent previous year , imports 5.23 billion dlrs compared 5.63 billion dlrs 1985/86 .
said government policy rationalise streamline import controls .
`` observed due restrictions imports , specially raw materials intermediate goods , local industry suffering want necessary inputs , '' said .
`` Prices increase quality goods produced low .
restrictive policy also gave rise smuggling hampering exports . ''
said correct situation , 136 items freed import restrictions .
Previously , Pakistan met trade gap largely remittances nationals working abroad , mainly Gulf .
However , remittances begun fall drop oil prices recent years leading spectre balance payments crisis Pakistan .

JUSTICE OPPOSES QUICK GREYHOUND-TRAILWAYS MERGER Justice Department said asked government proceed cautiously plan allowing nation 's two largest intercity bus companies merge operations , move one firms said may derail deal .
Justice 's opposition quick federal approval bid Greyhound Lines Inc take immediate control Trailways Corp prompted Greyhound threaten -- brief filed Interstate Commerce Commission ( ICC ) -- drop merger plan .
Greyhound officials told Reuters late today company hoped ICC action merger tomorrow .
`` Greyhound Lines go forward transaction permitted assume immediate , unconditional control Trailways ' operations integrate operations , '' Greyhound said filing ICC , federal regulatory agency final say mergers interstate bus companies .
Justice said earlier filing ICC wanted agency move slowly plan turn Greyhound 's request begin operating Trailways immediately .
`` department begun receive relevant information Trailways ' financial condition process assessing correctness company's allegations , '' acting Assistant Attorney General Charles Rule said comments submitted ICC .
Greyhound announced June 19 wanted ICC let begin operating Trailways immediately continuing evaluate merger possible antitrust problems .
Greyhound said would pay 80 mln dlrs many Trailways ' terminals , buses garages .
two companies said papers filed ICC Trailways `` could collapse matter days . ''
said Trailways owed suppliers six mln dlrs , another six mln dlrs due June 30 .
suppliers , said , could force Trailways bankruptcy `` time . ''
Trailways also owes consortium banks 76 mln dlrs , consortium threatened call loan Trailways fails pay interest due June 30 , said .

JAPAN UNEMPLOYMENT RISES RECORD 3.2 PCT MAY Japan 's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate rose record 3.2 pct May , worst level since government started compiling unemployment statistics 1953 , government 's Management Coodination Agency said .
May rate surpassed previous record 3.0 pct marked set January April year .
also sharply 2.7 pct year earlier .
Unadjusted May unemployment totalled 1.91 mln people , 1.90 mln April 1.62 mln year earlier .
agency official blamed industrial restructuring strong yen rise unemployment .
seasonally adjusted male unemployment rate May rose record 3.2 pct , surpassing previous record 3.0 pct set July 1986 .
compares 2.9 pct April 2.7 pct year earlie .
Unadjusted male unemployment totalled 1.12 mln , 180,000 year earlier .
female unemployment rate May unchanged April record 3.1 pct .
year ago , rate 2.8 pct .
Unadjusted female unemployment rose 100,000 790,000 .
yen 's appreciation continued affect employment manufacturing industries total employed May fell 210,000 1.5 pct year earlier 14.10 mln .

WORLD COULD COPE HORMUZ CLOSURE , SUBROTO SAYS Oil prices would skyrocket time conflict Gulf closed Strait Hormuz , oil supplies could adjusted take care world demand , Indonesian Energy Minister Subroto said .
made explicit reference latest U.S. Military action Gulf .
address conference Indonesian Petroleum Association , said , `` worst comes worst say flow oil Straits Hormuz completely shut , believe world oil supply , given time adjust , take care situation . ''
`` say prices , least short duration , skyrocket speculators take advantage situation , '' declared .
Tensions Gulf , however , usually relatively short-term impact prices , added .
Assessing future price trends , said , `` Short-term spot prices probably still fluctuate , likely hover around official Opec price basket 18 dlrs per barrel .
`` upward deviations , however , likely greater downward ones . ''
`` balance supply demand short term still delicate , '' added .
`` Non-Opec production may still go , competing Opec expected additional increase world demand . ''
Subroto , member Opec 's three-man quota committee touring cartel members , said speculation may play havoc spot prices , Opec trying stabilize situation urging cooperation non-Opec producers .
medium term , non-Opec production would reach plateau early 1990s , leaving Opec much stronger , said .

`` consider interest rate increase occurred internationally problem cause concern , '' Poehl told investment conference .
`` would like stress Bundesbank interest higher capital market rates , '' said .
Shortly Poehl spoke , Bundesbank announced tender securities repurchase pact fixed rate 3.80 pct .
Previous tenders last month interest rate seen allocation rate facilities rise 3.85 pct last week 's pact 3.60 last fixed-rate tender late September .
Bundesbank 's reduction key allocation rate 3.80 3.85 pct heralded Monday repeated injections money market liquidity 3.70 3.80 pct .
moves cap interest rates followed meeting Poehl , Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker Monday Frankfurt .

weekend , criticism Baker tightening West German monetary policy prompted sharp fall dollar speculation Louvre cooperation ended .
dollar rallied news Monday 's meeting nervous trading trade 1.79 marks Tuesday .
Poehl said recent rise interest rates due central bank policy , markets ' expectations , currency developments .

inflationary fears unjustified exaggerated , said .
Poehl rebuffed recent U.S .
Criticism West Germany , saying Bundesbank made substantial contribution international cooperation interest monetary policy .
Bundesbank tolerated overshooting money supply target , arousing criticism quarters , said .
`` Today still lower interest rates end 1986 ... Quite contrary countries , interest rates risen substantially , '' Poehl said .
taken account considering recent rises repurchase pact allocation rates , due rising international money market rates spilled German market , said .
Poehl expressed surprise financial markets far ignored improvements U.S .
Deficits .

spectacular improvement budget deficit also attracted little attention , said .

PHILIPPINES APPLAUDS DEFEAT U.S. LABELLING BILL Philippine coconut industry greeted relief defeat U.S. Senate bill requiring edible oils labelled saturated fats .
bill , defeated Senate Agriculture Committee Monday , could cost 60 mln dlrs year lost exports , Philippine Coconut Authority ( PCA ) said .
`` Naturally , welcomed defeat chance bill resurrected attached rider another Senate bill , '' spokesman United Coconut Association Philippines ( UCAP ) .
PCA chairman Jose Romero noted vote close , eight senators voting , 10 one abstaining .
UCAP spokesman said American Soybean Association ( ASA ) spent 25 mln dlrs lobbying bill .
said ASA also obscured health issue debate .
`` Coconut oil high saturated fats , unlike saturated animal fats , enter blood lymph systems leaving fatty deposits connected heart disease , '' said .
U.S .
Soybean cottonseed producers argued saturated fats cause heart disease labels would discourage consumption health conscious consumers favour domestic unsaturated alternatives .
Opponents bill said proposal discriminated imports would damage Philippines , Malaysia Indonesia .
Philippines earned 488 mln dlrs coconut products 1986 , 477 mln 1985 , UCAP figures show .
Exports United States edible non-edible use account half total , PCA 's Romero said .
TOKYO STOCK PLUNGE COULD FORCE EASIER MONEY POLICY Plunging Tokyo stock prices prevent Bank Japan raising discount rate could even force ease monetary policy collapse continues , government private economists said .
rise interest rates would serve spark selling shares could ultimately major deflationary impact real economy , said .
Although Bank Japan officials consistently maintained plans raise 2.5 pct discount rate , many markets thought otherwise .
Fears rise discount rate fanned central bank 's apparent decision last week countenance higher rates commercial bills , dealers said .
today 's stock market collapse -- prices fell nearly 15 pct -- means Bank Japan would hard pressed raise discount rate , despite concerns renewed outbreak inflation , dealers economists said .
Japanese government bond prices rose sharply today markets concluded stock market 's collapse precluded central bank carrying widely-rumoured discount rate increase .
senior government economist suggested U.S. Japan needed ease monetary policy prevent drop New York Tokyo stock prices .
`` need support stock security markets , '' said .
Bank Japan officials said saw need change policy moment , although one admitted central bank may rethink strategy Tokyo stock prices continue plunge rest week .
government Bank Japan economists agreed economy better placed cope deflationary impact plunging stock prices months ago .
economy recovering strongly , steep drop stock prices likely put major dent consumer business confidence , one government economist said .
`` impact real economy , big , '' said another .
Individuals heavily invested stocks , although participate trust funds investment vehicles .
many manufacturing firms turned financial market investments profits last year's economic downturn , recent rebound allowed refocus attention core businesses , said .
Paradoxically , pick-up economy partly blame stock market collapse companies shifted funds away financial investments increase inventories step capital spending , one government economist said .
deciding response make steep stock price drop , Bank Japan must first determine whether prices continue fall decide pose greater economic danger threat higher inflation , one central bank official said .
`` least take couple days , weeks , '' said .

INDONESIA FINDS NEW OFFSHORE OIL GAS RESOURCES Indonesian state-owned oil company Pertamina found new offshore oil gas resources East Aceh , western tip northern Sumatra , company spokesman said .
spokesman said discovery made GOS IA-1 offshore exploratory well 38 kms east Langsa Aceh .
`` Oil gas found sand layers depth 2,300 metres within Baong formation , '' said .
said preliminary tests showed well could flow oil rate 1,320 barrels day 50 degrees API 20 degrees centigrade 5/8 inch choke .
`` well also flows natural gas rate 12 mln standard cubic feet day , '' added .
GOS IA-1 well , located water depth 41 metres , drilled production sharing contract Pertamina Japex North Sumatra Ltd , 50 pct shares .
`` Petroleum operations carried Pertamina operator joint operating body established two companies , '' Pertamina spokesman stated .
contract covers Gebang block contract area .
two companies previously completed drilling GOS IIA-1 exploratory well , around 14 kms south GOS IA-1 .

August , housing starts unchanged July levels 1,598,000 units , instead 1.5 pct previously reported .
increase September housing starts largest since 10.8 pct gain starts December 1986 , Commerce Department officials said .
rate permits issued future construction fell 0.6 pct September seasonally adjusted 1,493,000 units 1,502,000 units August .
Permits risen 1.0 pct August July levels 1,487,000 units .
seasonal adjustment , permits rose 135,500 September 128,000 August .
Housing starts adjustment rose 150,200 September 144,600 August .
seasonally adjusted rise starts included 5.1 pct increase September single-family unit starts 1,168,000 1,111,000 August .

Monday , National Coffee Association newsletter said Office U.S. Trade Representative implement voluntary compliance system temporarily legislation monitor imports tied Congressional trade bill .
arrangement , milar one 1980 , coffee importers would voluntarily present needed documents U.S. government Congress approves monitoring authority , coffee arrives without valid certification , still allowed entry .
many believe producers seek add overburdened stock situation U.S. , others believe ship outside quota requirements lieu monitoring controls , trade sources said .
`` Last time , lot false information submitted customs resulted lot indictments fines , '' U.S. Customs spokesman said .
`` Customs good job given tools , hands tied , n't authority demand Form ( documents tracking merchandise source destination ) , '' said .
Many see true test whether producers importers abide quota system .
`` key seeing whether teeth quota agreement , '' said one major U.S. roaster .
`` Last time gentleman 's agreement , trade act gentleman , '' said another analyst adding , `` without need submit documents , ball producers ' hands . ''
feel importers take advantage voluntary compliance due development two-tier market , non-member countries buy coffee big discount .
Many fear dealers buy coffee destined non-member countries discounts bring U.S. falsely labelled .

`` , going continued fear pressure emerges dollar , Fed forced tighten .
throws economic abyss recession U.S. obvious knock effects rest world . ''

considerations may helping bond markets resist equity crash , according Mike Osborne Kleinwort Grieveson .
`` would suicidal government context happened last couple days jack interest rates , '' added .

news eroded immediate fears stock collapse would spill economy , via banking crisis example , thus precipitating recession .
also helped dollar rally sharply , high 1.8200 marks European low 1.7880 .

NORWAY BOOSTS OIL OUTPUT 22 PCT SEPTEMBER Norway 's September oil output rose 22.2 pct 1.07 mln barrels per day ( bpd ) 830,492 bpd August , according Reuter survey firms operating .
Operators said sharp rise reflected higher output several Norway 's biggest fields resumed production fields shut 27 days August Ekofisk field rescue project .
Industry analysts said increase exceed Norway's voluntary move curb 7.5 pct planned growth oil output , move designed back OPEC-led efforts stabilise oil prices limiting supplies world crude markets .
Norway , OPEC member , decided June extend production restraints , enforced since February 1 1987 , North Sea fields rest year .
Oil Minister Arne Oeien said last month expected Norway would extend 1988 policy slowed production growth .
biggest increase seen Ekofisk field , pumped 168,023 bpd September 48,195 bpd August , field operator Phillips Petroleum Norway Inc said .
Ekofisk nearby Valhall Ula fields , use Ekofisk pipeline , shut August Phillips raised Ekofisk platforms counter seabed subsidence .
BP Petroleum Development Norway Ltd , operator Ula field , said September output rose 86,727 bpd dropping 27,237 bpd August shutdown .
Valhall , operated Amoco Norway A/S , flowed 74,694 bpd last month compared 69,748 bpd August , company said .
September production also sharply higher Statfjord field .
Norway 's 84 pct share Statfjord , extends British North Sea sector , 611,138 bpd 552,646 bpd August , operator Den Norske Stats Oljeselskap A/S ( Statoil ) said .
Norway 's 22.2 pct share Murchison field , like Statfjord , extends British sector , yielded 15,388 bpd September , slight 920 bpd decrease previous month , Norwegian partners British-operated field said .
Statoil boosted output Gullfaks field 109,670 bpd September , compared 100,188 August .
Norsk Hydro , operator Oseberg field , said test output field mobile production ship Petro Jarl totalled 1,719 bpd last month , sharply 16,170 bpd August .
Hydro said drop caused failure bring stream second well , cutting September production two days .

LYNG PLEASED EC OFFER GATT FARM PROPOSAL U.S. Agriculture Secretary Richard Lyng said pleased European Community plans offer global farm reform plan GATT later month , although United States opposes key parts proposal .
`` 're pleased moved tabling proposal .
help us getting negotiations underway , '' Lyng told Reuters interview Tuesday .
Lyng 's comment came EC ministers Luxembourg endorsed farm reform package drafted EC Commission .
EC plan presented next meeting Uruguay round agriculture negotiators Geneva October 26 .
Lyng said United States would oppose parts plan seeking market sharing agreement grains , proposing curbs U.S. soybean cereal substitute exports Europe .
U.S. July proposed GATT elimination farm subsidies affecting trade within ten years , pressed EC make counter-offer aim reaching global farm subsidy agreement end 1988 .
However , EC U.S. domestic groups said Reagan administration plan end farm trade subsidies unrealistic .
Asked criticism , Lyng said `` alternative say preserve maintain .
think unrealistic position . ''
`` would suggest ( EC ) listen trying say . ''
Lyng also rejected suggestions U.S. EC agree freeze export subsidies get GATT negotiations started .
`` countries would like would wheat agreement would stop export subsidies wheat .
n't thing us , '' Lyng said .
United States wants end subsidies range agricultural products dairy products vegetable oils , said .
GATT negotiators meeting next week Canada expected offer proposal well EC .
United States represented meeting former agriculture undersecretary Daniel Amstutz , recently appointed special U.S. negotiator agriculture .

ASA Vice President James Adams told ASA-sponsored Outlook 87 conference : `` filed unless EC takes drastic immediate steps . ''
`` subsidies blatantly unfair GATT illegal , since established zero soybean duty established 1962 , '' said .
ASA 's unfair trade petition EC would ask investigation modification EC oilseed policies make regime non-discriminatory .
EC 1962 ruled EC oilseed imports duty-free , effort fill oilseed needs .
EC oilseeds production risen dramatically since .
EC guarantees oilseed prices farmers world market levels considering implementing controversial oils fats tax .
subsidies `` obvious attempts circumvent zero duty binding makes U.S .
Farmers mad hell , '' Adams said .

U.S .

rights challenged European Community 's ( EC ) agricultural support policies , told conference sponsored American Soybean Association .

also calls reduction farm subsidies .

said new development strategy , fuller use oil deposits better housing pay oilmen allowed upsurge oil industry three years stagnation began late 1983 .

1987 target 617 million .

called speedier geolog prospecting across country spur oil industry .

BAKER SEEN WINNING GERMAN INTEREST RATES BATTLE United States appears transatlantic battle forcing Bundesbank trim interest rates , European economists said .
added Washington set stakes high testing limits Louvre accord global stock markets plunging .
West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker reaffirmed commitment currency stability secret meeting yesterday Frankfurt , according official statements released late Monday .
13 hours statements released , Bundesbank reduced short-term interest rates offering banks liquidity fixed bid rate 3.80 pct , 3.85 pct facility rate offered last week .
two ministers meeting Bundesbank president Karl Otto Poehl , central bank also added money market liquidity repeatedly , signalling want strong rise tender allocation rate Tuesday .
`` 's round one Americans , `` said Richard Reid , senior European economist brokers UBS/Philips Drew London .
Reid added , `` n't forget taken one biggest stock market crashes decades get West Germans cut security repurchase rate 0.05 percentage point . ''
weekend , criticism Baker earlier tightening West German monetary policy led sharp dollar fall fuelled speculation Louvre accord longer valid .
Six leading industrial nations agreed February's Louvre Accord stabilise currencies coordinate monetary policies .
since reaffirmed Group Seven - US , Japan , West Germany , Britain , France , Italy Canada .
Frankfurt meeting Monday soothed currency markets dollar gained two pfennigs hours trading New York .
Frankfurt fixing Tuesday , dollar quoted 1.7918 marks compared 1.7740 Monday .
Guenther Aschoff , chief economist Deutsche Genossenschaftbank Frankfurt said massive declines world stock markets main reason fall West German short-term interest rates Tuesday .
`` Bundesbank wanted set marker stock market losses ... responsible thing fits Baker 's wishes , better , '' said .
central bank wants let interest rates rise , Bundesbank forced put rates following rises U.S. , Aschoff said .
Poehl told conference Frankfurt Tuesday central bank interest higher capital market rates thought global rate increase cause concern .
Giles Keating , economist Credit Suisse First Boston Ltd London said `` cautious Bundesbank beaten retreat Baker battle ... n't war security repurchase rate still 20 points higher IMF meeting last month Washington . ''
IMF meeting , Louvre Accord reaffirmed , Bundesbank offering money market liquidity 3.60 pct , Keating noted .
Economists said United States appeared agreed play rules Louvre Accord support dollar return German action interest rates .
sharp decline dollar would hinder Washington 's efforts reduce trade deficit , Stoltenberg told news conference Tuesday .
added would rule central banks leading industrial countries intervening exchange markets defend dollar 's value .
Deutsche Genossenschaftbank 's Aschoff stressed West Germany 's heavy dependence exports need currency stability .
addition , U.S. West German central banks keen avoid dollar slide would force spend vast sums intervening support dollar .

deal agreed EC foreign ministers , Argentina gain additional trading rights series products including meat , fish cereals by-products .
ministers failed agree new trade deals Canada Japan due study , officials said .
deal Argentina agreed majority EC states West Germany withdrew objections increased quotas Argentina high-quality beef .

deal , Argentina benefit improved quotas exports beef EC .
particular quota high-quality Hilton beef raised 4,500 tonnes 34,300 tonnes quotas frozen boneless beef increased 3,000 tonnes 53,000 tonnes .

negotiated rules GATT ( General Agreement Tariffs Trade ) .
officials said ministers unable resolve Canadian claims sales certain fish Spain affected country 's EC membership .

Stoltenberg told West German Trade Industry Association ( DIHT ) meeting Baker Monday , `` surprising notes criticism ( United States ) . ''
added .
`` Criticism one-way street . ''
elaborate , Bonn often called U.S. reduce federal budget deficit .
weekend Baker criticised West German economic policies , saying rises domestic interest rates spirit last February 's Louvre pact stabilise currencies .
Stoltenberg told DIHT meeting Monday Baker resolved differences two countries .
news conference earlier Tuesday Stoltenberg declined comment specifically Baker 's criticisms , said three hours discussions Monday , `` one remark another clarified . ''
US RULED ATTACK IRANIAN SILKWORMS U.S. military planners ruled Iran 's Silkworm missiles target retaliatory attack mounted Monday fear drawn deeply Iran-Iraq war , defense Middle East experts said .
U.S. naval forces destroyed offshore oil platform raided another administration called `` measured appropriate response '' Iranian Silkworm missile attack last Friday U.S.-flagged tanker Kuwaiti waters .
Private analysts generally agreed going rig rather onshore economic military target Silkworm launch sites reflected careful bid Washington limit political , military diplomatic fallout home Gulf .
`` simply demonstrated United States take military action ( Iran ) take military action , '' Norman Polmar , defense analyst author , said .
said hitting platforms spared Iran embarrassment casualties soil , possibly avoiding escalating spiral attack counterattack .
addition , minimized risk U.S. forces potential embarrassment losses , including aircraft could shot taken part attack .
Anthony Cordesman , author new book Iran-Iraq war , said United States apparently chose limited target keep alive possibility U.N. Secretary General Javier Perez de Cuellar might still persuade Iran accept Security Council call ceasefire .
`` want U.N. peace initiative work 's chance , '' said , adding action made clear tougher steps would follow Iran attack Gulf shipping .
targeting oil rig -- albeit one said Pentagon turned military command post -- Washington also sent message might willing attack Iran's economic lifeline .
Pentagon officials said platform used base Iranian raids shipping lower Gulf .
`` chosen military target , also shown Iran willing interfere oil-exporting capabilities , '' Cordesman said .
predicted United States would respond future major Iranian challenges hitting Iran 's naval base Bandar Abbas Straits Hormuz , followed mining approaches Iran 's oil export terminal Kharg Island .
Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger said Monday United States seek confrontation Iran , `` prepared meet escalation military action Iran stronger countermeasures . ''

`` offer still stands , changed offer , '' Bank New York spokesman said .
Irving would comment drop market affects position bid whether would buy back shares .
Earlier month , Irving rejected bid inadequate said wanted retain independence .
late September , Bank New York offered 80 dlrs per share cash 47.4 pct Irving .
remaining 52.6 pct , offered exchange 1.9 shares shares one Irving share .
time , stock purchase portion worth close 80 dlrs per share , portion worth 53 dlrs per share net price 68 dlrs , one analyst said .
According prospectus offer , shareholders may tender cash shares first come , first serve basis .
Analysts mixed stock price drop would affect acquisition .
`` gets Irving shareholders , would approve , Irving hopes offer wo n't go shareholders , '' said Mark Alpert , banking analyst Bear Stearns Cos Inc. `` market saying deal wo n't go , '' Alpert said .
`` transaction looks highly unlikely completed present .
Irving would n't go offer 80 dlrs share , wo n't go lower price , '' another analyst said .
analyst also doubted Bank New York could afford retain original offer .
However , industry sources uncertain prospects deal .
`` Irving 's price low , Bank New York 's offer look good Irving shareholders , '' said Michael Flores , consultant Bank Earnings International , consulting firm .
drop Irving 's share 44 dlrs per share , 26 dlr drop beginning last week , increases chance Bank New York succeed , Flores said .
Analysts said drop bank stock prices likely depress level mergers acquisition banking industry .
`` Bank takeovers less likely banks ca n't use stock make acquisitions share price depressed , '' Alpert said .
Since banks buy another bank , possible acquirors would foreign bank , Alpert said .
`` market drop stock acquirors got clobbered acquirees , '' another analyst said .

BRAZIL 'S SEPT TRADE SURPLUS HIGHEST YEAR Brazil 's September trade surplus best far year , totalling 1.494 billion dlrs , compared 1.434 billion dlrs August 540 mln dlrs September last year , Banco Brasil 's Foreign Trade Department ( Cacex ) director Namir Salek said news conference .
September exports 2.694 billion dlrs , slightly 2.76 billion dlrs August .
Imports September amounted 1.2 billion dlrs , 1.32 billion dlrs August .
Salek said accumulated surplus Jan-Sept period 7.857 billion dlrs , compared 8.667 billion dlrs similar 1986 period .
Coffee accounted 320 mln dlrs exports , 222 mln dlrs August 212 mln September 1986 , Salek said .
Cacex director said expected country 's trade surplus average 800 mln dlrs remaining three months year , estimating year 's overall surplus reach 10.2 billion dlrs , 25.6 billion dlrs worth exports 15.4 billion dlrs imports .
attributed good surplus exports manufactured semimanufactured goods .
mentioned car exports , accounted alone sales 617 mln dlrs Jan-Sept period , 194 mln dlrs similar 1986 period .

government decide whether change duty .
TREASURY 'S BAKER FIRE WALL STREET DROP official Washington sought restore investor confidence Monday 's Wall Street collapse , Treasury Secretary James Baker came fire critics claimed helped precipitate crisis .
Baker 's weekend blast West German Bundesbank boosting interest rates seemed signal unraveling international accord stabilize currency values .
Nigel Lawson , British Chancellor Exchequer , among said treasury secretary 's statements helped spur wave stock sales making already jittery investors think clash two major economic powers would damage world economy .
Lawson told London television interviewer Tuesday , `` think scale ( stock ) fall great .
, think , partly due statements made senior figures side Atlantic . ''
dispute never happened , added .
Although Baker appeared patch rift hastily-called meeting West German officials Monday , still faced storm criticism return United States Tuesday .
Baker cut short long-planned trip Scandinavia return deal economic crisis .
Said one U.S. analyst Baker 's weekend remarks , `` timing could worse . ''
One government bond salesman New York said , `` actually thought yelling Germans , threatening smack dollar would work .
n't show much understanding international monetary gamesmanship . ''
However , analysts said West Germany 's stubborn march toward higher interest rates may forced Baker 's hand .
`` surface Baker may look responsible , go back see caused ( unsettling financial markets ) , West German policy , '' said Robert Brusca Nikko Securities International New York .
`` Mr. Baker mention obvious public , making responsible little like killing messenger , '' said .
Monday 's talks , U.S. West German governments made clear Louvre currency accord , pieced together Paris February , still effect .
Wall Street feared collapse agreement might prelude hyper-inflation economic malaise similar late 1970s .
Analysts believe Monday 's Wall Street crash wiped 500 billion dlrs stock values .
Treasury sources said Baker , already unhappy Bonn 's refusal stimulate economy order keep global recovery moving , angered Bundesbank interest rate boost seemed destined opposite .
felt U.S. recovery , inching along 59th month , could longer engine global economic expansion .
growing U.S. economy serving huge market debtor country exports .
Moreover , Baker , consummate politician , worried Republican party might face next year 's presidential election main showpiece -- vibrant economy -- badly tarnished .
rise global interest rates might worsen debt crisis completely choke U.S. economic growth already slowed tepid 3.2 pct annual rate .
`` 's doubt adverse effect economy , 's important psychology turn around quickly , else obviously panic feed , eventually 'll serious price pay economically , '' former deputy Treasury Secretary Richard Darman said television interview .
many ways , official response mild .
Washington stunned sudden Wall Street retreat , President Reagan speaking people admitting `` puzzled . ''
U.S. government sources said secretary immediately returned Treasury briefed market developments , presumably , political impact .
, seems unlikely Baker 's status Washington diminish market fall .
Asked reporters somebody 's head roll Wall Street retreat , Texas Democratic Senator Lloyd Bentsen said irony , `` Oh , think 's much late ... administration 's taken attitude put country automatic pilot -- - retire living room take nap .
ca n't . ''

REAGAN SEES ROOM INTEREST RATE DECLINES President Reagan said pleased actions banks reduce prime lending rates today said sees room decline interest rates .
`` believe room market decline interest rates , '' Reagan said statement left White House visit wife Nancy Bethesda Naval Hospital .
Reagan 's statement followed meeting top economic advisers .
Reagan said remains concerned market , actions taken Federal Reserve helped .
`` Interest rates across spectrum , '' Reagan said .
`` Specifically , pleased bond market strong foreign exchange markets stable , '' Reagan said .

President Reagan imposed 300 mln dlrs sanctions Japanese goods last April failure honor 1986 agreement end dumping semiconductors U.S. third country markets open home market U.S. goods .
move raised tariffs 100 pct five pct Japanese color television sets , hand-held power tools portable computers .

said likely 51 mln dlrs sanctions would lifted end month .

kenaf plant member hibiscus family artificially developed several years ago .
plant , grown Southern Texas , reaches height 10 feet three months said produce better quality newsprint wood pulp , CIP official said .

`` yet ready commit hundreds millions dollars would take project , '' Slenniken said .
said CIP using pulp trial basis make newsprint containing 90 pct kenaf fibre 10 pct softwood fibre Trois-Rivieres , Quebec plant .

REAGAN SAYS U.S .
COMMITTED LOUVRE ACCORD President Reagan said United States remains committed Louvre accord seven major industrial nations agreed stabilize currency exchange rates .
`` United States remains committed Louvre agreement , '' Reagan said statement following meeting top economic advisers .
Reagan said United States , Japan West Germany reaffirmed commitment coordinate economic policies .
Reagan said Japanese Prime Minister-designate Noboru Takeshita said telephone conversation Tuesday morning `` ( Takeshita 's ) top priority maintain stable economic relations United States . ''
Reagan noted Treasury Secretary James Baker met West German financial officials reaffirmed commitment Louvre agreement .
`` reaffirmed agreement coordinate economic policies provide non-inflationary growth stable exchange rates , '' Reagan said .

US SAYS CANADIAN , ISRAELI PACTS SPUR TRADE Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter said Monday U.S. free trade agreements Canada Israel help pave way liberalizing global trading system .
said Canadian Israeli pacts set back worldwide reform efforts General Agreement Tariffs Trade ( GATT ) critics feared help .
GATT talks began year ago Punta del Este , Uruguay liberalize global trading system include trade agriculture services banking .
Yeutter made remarks U.S.-Israeli trade meeting marking second year bilateral accord .
Canadian-U.S. pact , signed two sides two weeks ago , yet approved U.S. Congress Canadian Parliament .
two free trade agreements ( FTA ) would gradually remove tariffs barriers cross-border trade goods many services .
Yeutter said aftermath Canadian Israeli pacts `` countries realized want continue access world 's largest market , better get serious improving GATT . ''
pact Israel , said , gradually increasing shipments ways Canadian pact substantially increase gross national products countries .
Yeutter also said Canadian Israeli pacts serve important precedents progress GATT .
Yeutter said , `` increasing trade one keys enhanced political economic stability around globe . ''
said , `` stronger GATT enhance prosperity , advanced industrial nations , also countries need increase trade order better standards living . ''
Yeutter added important risk progress made Israeli Canadian trade pacts resorting protectionism .
referring trade legislation pending Congress would force United States take retaliatory actions nations large trade surpluses United States countries practiced unfair trade .
legislation prompted growing U.S. trade deficit hit 156 billion dlrs last year still rising .
Yeutter said pressures Congress act hard resist , pending legislation would undermine President Reagan 's efforts liberalize world trade .
Yeutter renewed threat White House veto .
said , `` President Reagan veto bill contains serious flaws , believe veto would sustained . ''

EX-ARCO & lt ; ARC > CHIEF SEES ENERGY CRISIS 1990 Dwindling global crude oil reserves lack major new discoveries recent years send world energy crisis 1990 , former Atlantic Richfield Co chairman Robert O. Anderson said .
`` 's going come sooner anyone thinks , '' Anderson told reporters addressing Houston business lunch .
`` believe 're going see change world oil markets two three years oil becoming harder find . ''
Anderson , retired Arco last year form Hondo Oil Gas Co , said world oil consumption approaching 60 mln barrels day current excess capacity cushion 4.5 mln barrels day rapidly disappear .
`` looked around world , could scrape one mln barrels day shut-in production outside Middle East , '' said .
`` 're soon going right back 1973 1979 . ''
Anderson predicted world oil prices would end 1987 24 dlrs barrel continue gradual climb .
`` 's way prices stay flat enough supply , '' said .
`` major oil discoveries past 15 20 years . ''
Alaska 's Prudhoe Bay oil reserves , last major world discovery , already produced five billion barrels oil half estimated reserves , said .

basis justice country 's petition . ''
added however , quota increase gradual avoid harming market , added .

Many Democrats , control Congress , Republicans expressed support attack praised appropriate `` measured response . ''
Democrats liberal Republicans voiced new fears growing confrontation Tehran United States could erupt major war , demanded Reagan comply 1973 War Powers Act , could lead pullout American forces waterway .
`` contend strike necessary must realize words easily construed tacit endorsement war Iran , '' said Sen Mark Hatfield Oregon , Republican .

office said Lawson welcomed outcome meeting U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker , Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl , West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg Frankfurt .
meeting , Bonn finance ministry spokesman quoted Stoltenberg saying confident foreign currencies could stabilised around current levels .
meeting came Baker criticised West Germany increasing key interest rates , saying line last February 's Louvre accord .

BONN CONFIDENT MAINTAINING CURRENCY STABILITY U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker met West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl Frankfurt Monday , Bonn Finance Ministry spokesman said .
meeting spokesman quoted Stoltenberg saying confident foreign currencies could stabilised around current levels .
meeting came Baker criticised West Germany increasing short-term money market interest rates .
said rise line spirit Louvre accord aimed stabilizing U.S. dollar last February .
meeting arranged last week , spokesman said .
Baker , Stoltenberg Poehl agreed pursue policies agreed Louvre pact reference currency stability monetary policy .
Earlier Monday Bundesbnak injected liquidity West German money market move money market dealers interpreted attempt West German monetary authority curb interest rate rises .
spokesman described Monday 's talks , called private , positive .

US TROPICAL OIL LABELING PLAN SUFFERS DEFEAT proposal require imported tropical oils labeled saturated fats suffered narrow possibly debilitating defeat U.S. Senate .
Senate Agriculture Committee rejected proposal 10-8 vote , virtually snuffing U.S. soybean producers ' hopes plan would adopted year .
similar proposal made headway House .
Sen. Tom Harkin ( D-Iowa ) offered proposal amendment farm spending reduction package .
`` n't see trade issue .
see giving American consumers information need , '' said .
Proponents measure , including American Soybean Association , claimed palm , palm kernel coconut oils high saturated fat contribute heart disease .
U.S. soybean industry believes labels indicating tropical oils high saturated fats would discourage consumption oils , imported primarily Malaysia , Indonesia Philippines .
Sen. Richard Lugar ( R-Ind . )
read letter U.S. Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter , said proposal `` blatantly discriminates '' imports , would impossible defend international trade law would harm relations Philippines , Malaysia Indonesia .
Yeutter 's letter also said Americans derive saturated fats meat dairy products relatively little tropical oils .
committee voted largely along party lines , three Democrats joining seven Republicans oppose measure .

DELORS CALLS G-7 MEETING European Community Commission President Jacques Delors called swift convening meeting G-7 countries following instability today 's trading world money stock markets .
told press conference : `` G-7 meet discreetly quickly . ''
Delors said dollar fall mark levels around 1.60 , European Monetary System would undergo `` test fire . ''
Delors said current problems markets caused excessive growth financial trading , excessive deregulation failure fundamentals world economy adapt quickly enough changing circumstances .
said `` profoundly unjust '' blame recent increases West Germany .
U.S. TREASURY 'S BAKER MEETS WEST GERMAN MINISTER U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker met West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl today West Germany agreed support Louvre pact , Treasury Department said .
Treasury described meeting `` positive , private meeting Frankfurt , West Germany agreed upon last week .
`` parties agreed continue economic cooperation Louvre agreement flexible application including cooperation exchange rate stability monetary policies , '' Treasury said .
Treasury said Baker Stoltenberg `` consulting G-7 colleagues confident enable foster exchange rate stability around current levels . ''
Louvre pact agreement Group Seven leading industrial countries including United States West Germany promote currency stability .
Baker scheduled visit Scandinavia Belgium week department earlier refused release details travel itinerary , citing security considerations .

19-OCT-1987 19-OCT-1987
U.S .
FORCES DESTROYED OIL RIG , RAIDED ANOTHER U.S. warships destroyed Iranian oil platform Gulf Monday Navy also raided second oil rig retaliation Friday 's Iranian missile attack U.S. flag tanker , Pentagon said .
President Reagan Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger warned Iran even stronger countermeasures military escalation two countries continued volatile waterway .
Reagan said ordered strike first platform four U.S. destroyers , fired 1,000 five-inch shells Rostam oil rig 120 miles east Bahrain central Gulf .
short time later , Navy personnel boarded second Iranian oil platform five miles north destroyed radar communications equipment leaving structure , Pentagon said .
Defense Department spokesman Fred Hoffman told reporters second platform abandoned Iranian personnel shelling destruction first rig .
United States said platforms used keep track Gulf merchant shipping launch speedboat attacks shipping Iranian Revolutionary guards .
GULF WESTERN & lt ; GW > ACQUIRE BRITISH COMPANY Gulf Western Inc 's publishing unit , Simon Schuster , said agreed principle acquire & lt ; Woodhead-Faulkner ( Publishers ) Ltd > , British-based publisher professional consumer books , undisclosed terms .
Upon completion proposed transaction , Woodhead-Faulkner become part Simon Schuster's International Group , U.K. includes Simon Schuster trade books , Prentice Hall academic texts .
Simon Schuster said Woodhead-Faulkner continue publish name .
company continue direction Martin Woodhead , report Henry Hirschberg , president Simon Schuster 's International Group .
Woodhead-Faulkner , founded 1972 , publishes international banking , finance , investment books .

said offer would made meeting later month U.S. Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter EC External Relations Commissioner Willy de Clercq .

BRITAIN BACKS U.S. STRIKE IRAN OIL PLATFORM British Foreign Secretary Sir Geoffrey Howe backed United States ' attack Iranian oil platform Monday said worsen Gulf crisis .
`` United States fully entitled take military action exercise rights self-defense , face imminent threat attacks , '' Howe said statement issued London .
United States said forces destroyed platform Monday retaliation Iranian missile attack U.S.- flagged Kuwaiti ship last Friday .
Referring attack , Howe added , `` trust Iranians fully understand continued attacks kind enhance justification firm action self-defense . ''
press conferenced Luxembourg meeting European Community ( EC ) ministers , Howe asked statements senior Iranian official said America involved full-scale war .
`` would profoundly undesirable quite unjustified Iran react way , '' said .

HUGE OIL PLATFORMS DOT GULF LIKE BEACONS Huge oil platforms dot Gulf like beacons -- usually lit like Christmas trees night .
One , sitting astride Rostam offshore oilfield , blown water U.S .
Warships Monday .
Iranian platform , unsightly mass steel concrete , three-tier structure rising 200 feet ( 60 metres ) warm waters Gulf four U.S. Destroyers pumped 1,000 shells .
U.S. Defense Department said 10 pct one section structure remained .
U.S. helicopters destroyed three Iranian gunboats American helicopter came fire earlier month U.S. forces attacked , seized , sank Iranian ship said caught laying mines .
Iran deterred , according U.S. defense officials , said Iranian forces used Chinese-made Silkworm missiles hit U.S.-owned Liberian-flagged ship Thursday Sea Isle City Friday .
ships hit territorial waters Kuwait , key backer Iraq war Iran .
Henry Schuler , former U.S. diplomat Middle East CSIS said Washington agreed escort Kuwaiti tankers order deter Iranian attacks shipping .
said deterrence policy failed level violence threats shipping increased result U.S. intervention Iran 's response .
attack oil platform latest example U.S. `` tit-for-tat '' policy gave Iran initiative , said Harlan Ullman , ex-career naval officer CSIS .
said appraoch America would suffer `` death one thousand cuts . ''
United States grab initiative militarily , must take warlike steps mining Iran's harbors blockading mouth Gulf shipping must pass , Schuler said .
among advocating mining means bringing Iran neogtiating table .
vital supplies cut , Tehran could continue war Iraq .
Ullman said Washington join Moscow diplomatic initiative end war superpowers impose arms embargo Tehran refused negotiate .
said United States also threaten mine blockade Iran continued fighting must press Iraq acknowledge responsibility starting war part settlement .
Iranian Western diplomats say Iraq started war invading Iran 's territory 1980 .
Iraq blames Iran outbreak hostilities , entailed World War I-style infantry attacks resulting horrific casualties .
side attacked others ' shipping .
