DIPLOMATS CALL U.S .
ATTACK OIL RIG RESTRAINED U.S. attack Iranian oil platform Gulf Monday appeared tit-for-tat raid carefully orchestrated provocative upset Arab allies , Western diplomats region said .
U.S. Defence Secretary Caspar Weinberger said Monday U.S .
Warships destroyed oil platform southern Gulf response missile strike American-registered Kuwaiti tanker Sea Isle City Kuwaiti waters Friday .
`` consider matter closed , '' said , signal U.S. administration want Gulf crisis escalate .
Iran warned United States earlier day exacerbating Gulf crisis , saying military action would endanger American interests .
Following raid , okesman Tehran 's War Information Headquarters vowed avenge attack `` crushing blow . ''
`` United States entered swamp way get safely , '' Tehran Radio quoted saying .
Diplomats noted , however , Iran also seeking avoid ostracism Arab states due meet summit Amman November 8 discuss Iran-Iraq war .
Iranian Prime Minister Mir-Hossein Mousavi currently Damascus , diplomats said would seek Syrian help preventing total Arab breach Tehran .
escalation war threatening Gulf Arab states could work Tehran Amman gathering , said .
`` ball Iran 's court .
's Tehran respond one way , '' diplomat said .
President Ronald Reagan warned Iran stronger American countermeasures military escalation continued .
Western diplomats military sources area said shelling platform appeared least provocative act United States could taken decided retaliate tanker attack , blamed Americans Kuwaitis Iran .
`` 's interesting chose something international waters n't implicate nation , '' one diplomat said .
`` better U.S. Relations Gulf Arab states , particularly Kuwait . ''
Commented another diplomat : `` Kuwait must happy U.S. done something , relieved Faw attacked doorstep . ''
One source said attack oil platform : `` managed warn crew hit something least nuisance everybody . ''
diplomat commented : `` clever place chose .

experts told Reuters Tehran holds initiative likely control tempo direction conflict long America simply reacts Iranian attacks launching limited retaliatory strikes .

`` 's like Greek tragedy , '' said retired Adm. Eugene Carroll Washington 's private Center Defense Information ( CDI ) think tank .

say feasible America withdraw 30-ship force Gulf area , Navy began escorting U.S.-flagged Kuwaiti tankers July .

SOVIET 1988 GRAIN TARGET INDICATES 1987 OUTPUT Recent announcements Moscow next year 's grain production targets indicate Soviets estimating year 's grain crop 205 213 mln tonnes , Agriculture Department analysts said .
USDA projecting Soviet crop 210 mln tonnes , earlier estimates Soviet officials 1987 grain crop could match 1978 record 237 mln tonnes .
Moscow outlined economic targets 1988 Monday , putting grain harvest goal 235 mln tonnes .
analyst Soviet agriculture USDA noted recent article Izvestia said Soviet grain production 1988 planned `` 25 30 mln tonnes expected year . ''
`` indicates estimate 205 213 mln tonne ( grain ) crop , '' analyst said .
calculating Moscow 's crop estimate , USDA used 235 mln tonne production goal , well 238 mln tonne figure published Soviet economic journal month .
USDA 's production estimate 210 mln tonnes reflects range 207 212 mln tonnes , USDA source said .
Late season rains damaged Soviet crops , slowed harvest progress lowered Soviet production , analysts said .
U.S. earlier month , Soviet agriculture official Viktor Nikonov predicted grain crop would good better last year 's 210 mln tonne harvest .
member Nikonov 's party commented although 230 mln tonnes grain fields , harvest problems would bring final crop around 210 mln tonnes .

said exchange rates stable far 1987 result accord .

Reuter International Energy Agency ( IEA ) estimates put OPEC September production 18.5 mln bpd .

FED 'S JOHNSON WARNS LOWER DOLLAR Federal Reserve Board Vice-Chairman Manuel Johnson cautioned seeking `` quick-fix solutions '' persistent U.S. trade federal budget deficits .
particular , told American Stock Exchange conference , decline dollar current levels would exacerbate financial market conditions .
`` Trying artificially depress dollar severely current levels ... would exacerbate financial market conditions lead potential financial problems . ''
Nowhere , Johnson said , Fed officials hearing U.S. businesses compete current exchange rates .
acknowledged U.S. trade deficit persisting despite decline dollar 's value 40 50 pct past two years .
deficit improving volume terms soon begin showing improvement .
`` stage think set healthy , constructive expansion without inflationary instability , '' said .

budget-saving proposal drafted chairman Patrick Leahy ( D-Vt ) would limit adjustments county loan rate differentials one pct per year national average loan rate , starting 1988 crops .
plan also would allow Agriculture Secretary increase unpaid acreage reduction requirement corn `` appropriate amount generate savings '' projected corn stocks exceeded 6.0 billion bushels .

TRANSATLANTIC ROW IMPERILS LOUVRE ACCORD-DEALERS Louvre accord currency stability , maintained uneasy calm currency markets since last February , appeared serious danger today transatlantic dispute West German interest rates came boil , foreign exchange dealers said .
dollar slid mark world stock bond markets plunged , officials major industrial countries played dispute bilateral problem United States West Germany insisted currency pact still alive .
U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker sparked market fears attacked rise West German short-term interest rates .
`` 's keeping spirit agreed recently earlier month Washington , '' Baker said U.S. Television interview Sunday .
referring meetings Finance Ministers Group Seven ( G7 ) leading industrial nations reaffirmed pact .
Louvre Accord West Germany Japan , large trade surpluses , pledged boost economic growth take exports U.S. , U.S .
Agreed stop talking dollar .
However , Baker said Saturday Louvre agreement still operative , West German interest rate move would force U.S. re-examine accord .
`` foreign exchange market told Baker 's going hammer Germany ...
declared bets terms currency cooperation , '' Chris Johns , currency analyst UBS-Phillips Drew London said .
Bank Japan official took much sanguine view , telling Reuters `` exchange market apparently reacting much , anyone sold dollar Baker comment regret later . ''
French Finance Minister Edouard Balladur , hosted Louvre meeting , one G7 Finance Ministers respond directly Baker 's remarks .
called `` faithful firm adherence major industrial countries Louvre accords -- letter spirit . ''
Neither West German Finance Ministry British Treasury commented row .

Frustration higher interest rates abroad , `` represent readiness scrap basic framework Louvre Accord . ''
Frankfurt F. Wilhelm Christians , joint chief executive West Germany 's largest bank , Deutsche Bank , said following recent meetings Baker , believed U.S. still committed accord .

UK SUGAR FACTORY CLOSES DUE SHORTAGE BEET British Sugar Plc forced shut Ipswich sugar factory Sunday afternoon due acute shortage beet supplies , spokesman said , responding Reuter inquiry Beet supplies dried Ipswich due combination wet weather , prevented farmers factory 's catchment area harvesting , last week's hurricane blocked roads .
Ipswich factory remain closed roads cleared supplies beet build .
first time many years factory closed mid-campaign , spokesman added .
factories continuing process beet normally , harvesting remains difficult areas .
Ipswich one 13 sugar factories operated British Sugar .
processes excess 500,000 tonnes beet year annual beet crop around eight mln tonnes .
Despite closure Ipswich severe harvesting problems factory areas , British Sugar maintaining estimate sugar production campaign around 1.2 mln tonnes , white value , 1.34 mln last year , spokesman said .
British Sugar processes sugar beet grown U.K .
sugar beet processing campaign , began last month , expected run end January .
Sugar factories normally work 24 hours day , seven days week campaign .
October 11 , 12 pct U.K. Sugar crop harvested , little different stage last year 13 pct lifted .
Since , however , wet weather severely restricted beet lifting .
Harvesting figures week October 18 yet available .

complaint also discloses occasion , Multifoods management rejected group 's overtures .

suit seeks compensatory punitive damages amount determined .
addition , Multifoods seeking stop Bregman Partners acquiring stock , voting shares reportedly owns , suit said .

past three years , Multifoods substantially altered domestic business mix divesting U.S. consumere foods operations emphasizing growth selected segments U.S. foodservice industry .

STUDY SAYS PORK LEANER USDA FIGURES SHOW Iowa State University study showed pork contains considerably less fat indicated long-established U.S. Department Agriculture statistics , National Pork Producers Council ( NPPC ) said .
Six seven muscle cuts evaluated study averaged 4.3 pct fat less , well American Heart Association guidelines recommended foods .
Eighty pct raw boneless rib chops evaluated study contained less six pct fat , NPPC said .
Meanwhile , USDA Handbook 8-10 - long used established authority nutrient composition , indicates fat content center loin pork 7.3 pct , NPPC said .
Robin Kline , dietitian Director Consumer Affairs NPPC said surprised wide discrepancy study USDA handbook .
`` Handbook 8-10 based certain extent information accumulated past 30 years .
statistics pork reflect hog today 50 pct leaner 20 30 years ago , thanks genetic improvements better feeding practices , '' Kline said .
study , funded NPPC producer checkoff money , evaluated pork carcasses 47 Iowa producers categories 0.7 1.3 inches backfat .
Researchers measured fat content seven muscles cooking , fat , moisture tenderness cooked boneless rib chops .
SOVIETS OUTLINE 1988 ECONOMIC TARGETS Soviet Union outlined economic targets 1988 Monday , stressing need improve standards country 's sluggish engineering industry .
Planning chief Nikolai Talyzin told Supreme Soviet industrial output rise 4.5 pct 1988 , planned 4.4 pct 1987 .
rose 3.6 pct Jan-Sept 1987 .
Talyzin said national income , nearest Soviet equivalent gross national product , rise 4.3 pct planned 4.1 pct year .
Gross national product measures output country 's goods services .
said Kremlin planned produce 235 mln tonnes grain 1988 versus planned 232 mln year .
Moscow produced 210 mln tonnes 1986 .
Kremlin leader Mikhail Gorbachev described machine-builing sector whose rapid modernization essential Soviet Union compete effectively world markets .
`` Certain difficulties arisen year machine-building industry .
economy receiving considerable amount equipment requires , '' said Talyzin , heads state planning committee GOSPLAN .
Soviet data show machine-building industry , makes machine tools , instruments engineering goods , increased output 3.3 pct first nine months 1987 compared period last year .
However , far 7.3 pct increase planned industry whole 1988 .
Talyzin said ruling Politburo concluded recent meeting improvement economic performance depended large extent conserving resources better .
`` Large-scale measures planned save resources , '' said .
Finance Minister Boris Gostev told Supreme Soviet defense spending 1988 would total 32 billion dlrs , figure announced last year .
Western governments view official Soviet estimates defense spending highly understated , say real figure hard calculate Soviet military industries intertwined civilian economy .
Talyzin said Kremlin also decided increase spending next year medical services , education , pensions social insurance schemes .
TASS DENOUNCES U.S .
ATTACK IRAN ADVENTURISM official Soviet news agency Tass denounced U.S .
Attack Iranian oil-drilling platform Gulf Monday military adventurism said would bring dividends Reagan administration .
Tass commentator Mikhail Krutikhin said administration embarked adventurist path order deflect attention scandal United States sold arms Iran profits diverted Nicaraguan rebels .
`` confrontation fact .
obvious latest military adventure bring political dividends American administration , '' Krutikhin said .
Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev Foreign Minister Eduard Shevardnadze abruptly left parliamentary session earlier Monday , sparking diplomatic speculation concerned urgent matter foreign affairs .
Soviet officials previously criticized United States sending naval forces Gulf , saying presence serves increase tension .
Moscow officially neutral war Iran Iraq .
major arms supplier Iraq also sought broader contacts Iran last year .
Krutikhin said : `` United States undertaken act armed aggression Iran , probability long spoken Washington officials . ''

new ruling make easier calls made remote regions .

Duffy told press conference Cairns Group 14 major agricultural producers , Australia Thailand belong , emerged important third force multilateral trade talks .
`` 's doubt Cairns Group seen third force reckoned inside General Agreement Tariffs Trade international trade negotiations , '' said .

minister said EC Commission 's new farm trade paper recognise heavy financial burdens imposed Common Agricultural Policy future expansion .
said Reagan Administration also displayed determination resist currently strong protectionist sentiment U.S. Congress .

cumulative trade position July showed 1.85 billion dlr deficit 1.33 billion June 1.89 billion year earlier , exports 4.91 billion imports , FOB , 6.76 billion .
government aims narrow current account deficit whole 1987 975 mln dlrs , compared 1.52 billion last year , 1.01 billion 1985 .

SOVIET UNION SETS 4.5 PCT INDUSTRIAL OUTPUT GROWTH Soviet Planning chief Nikolai Talyzin told Supreme Soviet ( parliament ) industrial output planned rise 4.5 pct 1988 , planned 4.4 pct 1987 .
first nine months year , industrial output rose 3.6 pct .
Talyzin said national income , nearest Soviet equivalent gross national product , planned rise 4.3 pct planned 4.1 pct year .
said grain production planned 235 mln tonnes 1988 , compared planned 232 mln year .
Soviet Union produced 210 mln tonnes grain 1986 Soviet press said heavy rain affected harvest year .
Talyzin said 1988 Soviet plan stressed engineering industry , Kremlin leader Mikhail Gorbachev described sector rapid modernisation essential Soviet Union compete effectively world markets .
`` Certain difficulties arisen year machine-building industry .
economy receiving considerable amount equipment requires , '' said Talyzin , heads state planning committee Gosplan .
Soviet data show machine-building industry , makes machine tools , instruments engineering goods , increased output 3.3 pct first nine months year period 1986 .
well 7.3 pct rise planned industry 1988 .
Talyzin said ruling Politburo concluded recent meeting improvement economic performance depended large extent conserving resources better .
`` Large-scale measures planned save resources , '' said .
Finance Minister Boris Gustev told Supreme Soviet defence spending 1988 would total 20.2 billion roubles , announced last year .
Talyzin said Kremlin also decided increase spending next year medical services , education , pensions social insurance schemes said state expenditures fields would reach 171 billion roubles 1988 , 3.5 billion roubles originally envisaged 1986-1990 Five-Year Plan .

IRAN SAYS U.S .
NAVAL FORCES ATTACKED TWO PLATFORMS Iran said U.S .
Naval forces attacked two oil platforms southern Gulf Monday afternoon , Iranian news agency IRNA reported .
IRNA , received Nicosia , said informed source Iranian oil ministry identified two platforms Resalat Reshadat , 60 miles Iran 's Lavan island oil storage site .
Regional shipping sources earlier said three Iranian offshore oil sites Sassan , Rostam Rakhsh attacked 7.00 A.M. ( 0300 GMT ) Monday unidentified aircraft .
Washington , U.S. Defence Secretary Caspar Weinberger said four U.S. Destroyers attacked destroyed Iranian oil platform 120 miles east Bahrain .

GAF & lt ; GAF > GROUP RECONSIDERS BUYOUT BID GAF Corp said management group led chairman Samuel J. Heyman intends reconsider proposal acquire GAF .
September 8 , group offered 64.00 dlrs cash 2.50 dlrs principal amount 15 pct junior subordinated debentures due 2007 GAF share .
Heyman owns 2,700,000 GAF 's 33.5 mln shares outstanding .
letter committee independent directors formed consider offer , Heyman said modify terms offer continue bid , due rising interest rates financial market conditions .
Heyman said `` considerable time elapsed since original proposal submitted , credit financial markets experienced extraordinary almost unprecedented deterioration .
present time , average interest rate financing proposed raise connection acquisition increased , since original proposal , approximately 150 basis points . ''
said group intends promptly review available options , including revision offer reflect current market conditions .
S.KOREA CURRENT A/C SURPLUS SEEN NEAR 10 BLN DLRS South Korea 's national news agency , Yonhap , said year 's current account surplus near 10 billion dlrs amid signs continuing high world demand country 's cheap cars electronic goods .
Bank Korea officials would neither confirm deny Yonhap forecast , saying bank would issue figures later week .
Yonhap said January-September surplus current account , covers trade goods services , totalled 7.03 billion dlrs .
already exceeds seven billion dlr ceiling whole 1987 government set June talks International Monetary Fund aimed averting rapid revaluation dollar .
agency said September surplus 1.4 billion dlrs , 468.1 mln August 899 mln year earlier .
`` Exports October could relatively modest due many public holidays , end year surplus well nine billion dollars , close ten , '' Yonhap said .
sharp rise September surplus came resumption export deliveries delayed strikes previous month .
3,300 companies , including car manufacturers , electronic electric firms , hit labour unrest July September .
South Korean government originally targeted five billion dlr current account surplus year , raise seven billion reflect startling first-half export boom .
confirmed , soaring 1987 current account surplus seemed certain trigger tougher pressure United States recorded 7.4 billion dlr trade deficit Seoul last year , government economists said .
U.S. Government , trying stem protectionist pressure home , called South Korea open markets American goods revalue faster .
fixed 804.90 dollar Monday , representing 7.01 pct gain far year .

shipping sources said Iran 's Sassan , Rostam Rakhsh offshore oilfields attacked 0700 local ( 0300 GMT ) wave jet fighter bombers .

least one two targets also believed ablaze , sources said .

Japan , diversifying supply sources propane butane stable supplies , continue bank Saudi Arabian LPG , sources said .
said Saudi 's supply capabilities LPG , associate crude oil , guaranteed crude output capacity .
`` Saudi reliable supplier sense , '' said one trader .
Japan imports 50 pct LPG Saudi Arabia .
single nation could substitute Saudi Arabia LPG supply source Japan , sources said .

October shipments back contractual volumes Saudi able boost exports ports .

said Iranian blockade Strait Hormuz unlikely would block Iran 's oil shipments .

INDIAN RESERVE BANK TIGHTENS CREDIT POLICY Reserve Bank India said tightening credit policy commercial banks raising cash reserve ratio 0.5 pct 10 pct , effective October 24 .
move , announced last weekend , part bank's policy second half fiscal 1987/88 ending March aimed curbing excess bank liquidity .
central bank also put selective controls bank advances oilseeds , vegetable oils foodgrains trades .
`` policy 's main objective fully meet credit requirements agriculture , industry exports , preventing excessive monetary expansion , '' bank Governor R.N .
Malhotra told earlier meeting chief executives banks .
Malhotra said rate monetary expansion must kept control second half current financial year .
Bank deposits rose 75.40 billion rupees first six months fiscal 1987/88 66.92 billion period last year , according bank .
Bankers said bank 's move raise cash reserve ratio 0.5 pct mean impounding five billion rupees banking system .
Banks ' total deposits estimated around 1,000 billion rupees .
said banks pressure low returns commercial lending investments government securities .
`` Already many banks finding difficult maintain statutory liquidity cash reserve ratios resorting heavy inter-bank borrowings , '' said one banker .

GERMAN FINANCIAL POLICY MAKERS RARE DISSENSION Karl Otto Poehl , head West Germany's central bank , Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg normally much agreement foreigners doubt central bank 's independence .
rare public row ebullient Poehl , president Bundesbank , Stoltenberg , controversial investment tax proposal , added woes country 's already nervous financial markets , bankers said .
Poehl told investment symposium Frankfurt last Thursday feared tax would raise borrowing costs interest rates Stoltenberg quickly issued statement rebutting Poehl's criticism , saying West Germany would remain attractive place foreign investors .
`` obvious lack coordination Bundesbank Finance Ministry instil confidence foreign investors , '' said one economist London broker , asked identified .
Bankers expressed confidence two top financial policy-makers would quickly patch relationship steer economy particularly difficult time .
`` plenty objective pressures result things getting back normal period ill feeling , '' said Commerzbank AG chief economist Juergen Pfister .
News October 9 government planning 10 pct withholding tax wiped billions marks shares bonds market already reeling rising interest rates home abroad .
Bankers said Bundesbank angered way finance ministry announced plan -- without consulting Bundesbank adequately , allowing apparently conflicting details dribble unprepared uncertain market .
Poehl , 57 , Stoltenberg , 59 , extraordinary pressures lately .
Poehl switch hard line promoted deputy , Helmut Schlesinger , jacking interest rates fight inflationary fears abandoning pragmatic policies pursued far year promote currency stability .
recent statements Poehl sounded like Schlesinger .
years softly-spoken economist warning speech speech excessive money supply growth would eventually lead rising prices .
Schlesinger majority support Bundesbank council , since late summer Poehl represent views , bankers said .
`` Poehl minority house , '' said Commerzbank's Pfister .
`` Poehl dilemma .
must follow policy entirely , '' said another economist .
dilemma German interest rates rise far , attract funds country , pushing mark hurting West German exporters .
dollar shed seven pfennigs since Bundesbank 's new tack became clear early October .
Since last Thursday , United States Treasury Secretary James Baker criticized Bundesbank rate increases .
Bankers said could foreshadow revival 1986 war words U.S. West Germany , U.S. Officials talked dollar force West Germany stimulate economy thus suck U.S. Exports .
One way West Germany agreed making round tax cuts worth 39 billion marks 1990 .
financing tax cuts proved difficult Stoltenberg bargained .
cool , unflappable northerner , regularly voted popular government politician last year , face resistance local barons government coalition parties trade unions planned subsidy cuts .
withholding tax intended plug one gap raising 4.3 billion marks .
caused outcry among bankers , say push borrowing costs .
extra amount costs government could wipe revenue tax brings .
Meanwhile Stoltenberg dealing local political row turned country 's worst political scandal .
Stoltenberg leave monetary talks Washington last month early sort row northern state Schleswig-Holstein , heads ruling CDU party .
state 's CDU premier , Uwe Barschel , resign allegations `` dirty tricks '' election campaign led heavy losses CDU state elections .
Barschel found dead hotel bath Geneva last weekend .
Police say death appears suicide .
Cooperation Poehl Stoltenberg remarkable Poehl opposition Social Democrats , appointed former chancellor Helmut Schmidt .
Poehl 's contract came renewal earlier year , Chancellor Helmut Kohl 's CDU-led coalition government gave Poehl another eight-year term .

Poehl criticized Stoltenberg 's tax plans voicing many bankers felt demonstrating Bundesbank 's independence government , Chrobok said .

HIGHER SPENDING EXPECTED MALAYSIA 'S 1988 BUDGET Malaysia 's recovery worst recession 20 years receive boost Friday government announces reflationary budget calendar 1988 seven years austerity , economists said .
`` country walking one leg , '' said Ismail Salleh , economist Institute Strategic International Studies .
`` depend public sector investment faster growth private sector moving . ''
Gross domestic product grew one pct 1986 shrinking one pct 1985 .
fiscal year ends December 31 .
government said expects 1987 growth two pct analysts believe nearer three pct prices commodity exports risen sharply .
Malaysia leading exporter rubber , palm oil , tin semiconductors major producer cocoa , timber oil .
government slashed development spending 9.8 billion ringgit year 14.5 billion 1986 .
Economists said unemployment expected exceed 10 pct 1988 9.5 pct year .
Local investment also stagnated , businessmen blaming inconsistent economic policies lack incentives .
One businessman said many politicians give impression Malaysia unstable .
`` take care investment confidence , potential recover strongly great , '' banker said .
Malaysia 's 1987 current account expected black Central Bank projecting 500 mln ringgit surplus compared last year 's 1.2 billion ringgit deficit .
government said fiscal policies balance budget 1989 .
deficit 1986 952 mln ringgit .
government also repay external debt , stood 51 billion ringgit end 1986 .
Political leaders said budget hurt ordinary people taxes basic food essential goods unlikely change .
Businessmen said hope government also cut corporate tax , 45 48 pct , enable Malaysia compete investors neighbouring states .

vessel voyage Trombetas , Brazil , Matanzas , Cuba , carrying 50,000 tonnes bauxite .
draught 36 feet .
Attempts refloat vessel help six tugs unsuccessful .
owners considering unloading part cargo onto barges .
CHINA FORECASTS 397 MLN TONNES GRAIN HARVEST China expects 1987 grain harvest 397 mln tonnes , eight mln tonnes short target , New China News Agency quoted State Statistical Bureau spokesman saying .
harvest China 's second highest history poor weather low incentives grain-producing farmers kept yields , earlier Chinese press reports said .
Industry sources expect China import least 10 mln tonnes grain year harvest shortfall .
Chinese customs figures showed grain imports 9.59 mln tonnes first eight months 1987 , compared 6.09 mln 1986 period .
Agriculture Minister Kang said last month state prices grain purchase growers adjusted increase incentive grain production .
China could afford become major food importer , said .
State Statistics Bureau spokesman also said China's 1987 cotton output expected rise 10 pct 1986 390 mln tonnes .
PHILIPPINE INFLATION PREDICTED RISE Philippine 1987 inflation rate rise 4.8 pct 0.74 pct 1986 government implements employers ' association recommendation 10 pct increase 54 peso minimum daily wage month , Economic Planning Secretary Solita Monsod said .
government 's proposal across-the-board daily pay rise six pesos non-agricultural workers eight pesos agriculture workers , would push full year average higher 5.4 pct , told Senate last week .
10 pct rise minimum wage recommended Employers Confederation Philippines ( ECOP ) .
ECOP proposal would push year-on-year inflation rate 11.6 pct December compared predicted 14.4 pct government 's recommendation implemented , Solita said .
proposed last month .
Annual inflation 1987 forecast four 4.5 pct National Economic Development Authority early month .
first three months year , inflation negative 0.5 , 0.6 0.7 pct respectively , rising 1.0 , 2.5 4.6 pct April May June , National Statistics Office said .
annual inflation rate rose 5.8 pct June , 6.2 pct July 6.15 6.188 pct August September respectively , National Statistics Office said .
attributed acceleration higher fuel water prices .
government 's six eight peso wage increases would displace 20,000 workers , Monsod said , bringing number unemployed 4.2 mln 19.2 pct population .

Cents .
economists estimate continued high inflation .

SOVIET SUGAR CONSUMPTION HOME BREWING GROWS sharp rise Soviet sugar consumption since start Kremlin 's anti-alcohol drive indicates home brewing costing state 20 billion roubles lost vodka sales , Pravda said .
Communist Party newspaper said sugar sales increased one mln tonnes year , enough turned two billion bottles moonshine .
current vodka prices 10 roubles bottle , said , meant illicit alcohol consumption reached equivalent 20 billion roubles year , annual revenues vodka sales May 1985 anti-alchohol decree .
`` Official statistics show reduction consumption vodka , deceptive statistic -- count home-brew , '' Pravda said .
`` epidemic first engulfed villages also firmly settled cities , availability natural gas , running water privacy made much easier . ''
Kremlin leader Mikhail Gorbachev launched anti-alcohol campaign shortly taking office March 1985 first step improving Soviet economic performance , seriously hurt drunkenness among working population .

BANKS EXTEND TRADING HALT LEBANESE POUND Lebanon 's Bankers Association said extended suspension trading Lebanese pound two working days study ways stem currency's collapse .
Central Bank post rate pound dollar currencies Monday .
pound closed Thursday 407.00/412.00 dollar compared Wednesday 's close 384.00/386.00 .
Association sources told Reuters Friday 's suspension trading two working days continued Monday two days study proposals reinforce pound .
Association , comprises 106 commercial banks east west Beirut , halted trading Friday chaotic market pound crashed four record lows week .
pound , hit inability Lebanon 's religiously ideologically divided government end 12 years civil war , lost 80 pct international value year .
STATOIL PLACES NORTH SEA VESLEFRIKK FIELD ORDERS Den Norske Stats Oljeselskap A/S ( Statoil ) & lt ; STAT.OL > , operator Norway 's North Sea Veslefrikk oil field , placed field development contracts totalling 1.5 billion crowns two domestic yards , company said statement .
Moss Rosenberg Verft , subsidiary Kvaerner Industrier A/S & lt ; KVIO.OL > 1.2 billion crown contract convert Statoil 's semisubmersible rig West Vision floating production platform build deck separate , fixed well-head platform placed field , said .
Statoil said Aker Verdal , unit Aker Norcem A/S & lt ; AMVO.OL > , 300-mln crown contract design build well-head platform 's 10,000-tonne steel substructure , stand 150 metres water next converted rig .
Statoil said using floating production unit rather fixed platform would cut construction time , enabling field partners bring Veslefrikk stream late 1989 -- several months earlier previously planned .
Veslefrikk , estimated recoverable reserves 258 mln barrels oil 140 billion cubic feet gas , located 145 km west Bergen .
Statoil estimates field 's total development cost , including drilling , 6.6 billion crowns .
Planned daily output 65,000 barrels oil 35 mln cubic feet gas .
Veslefrikk 's oil landed via nearby Oseberg field pipeline Sture crude terminal near Bergen .
gas fed Statpipe line , gathers gas Norway 's Statfjord , Gullfaks Oseberg fields .
Partners field Statoil , operator , 55 pct share , & lt ; Unocal Norge A/S > ( 18 pct ) , & lt ; Deminex ( Norge ) A/S > ( 13.5 pct ) , Norsk Hydro A/S & lt ; NHY.OL > ( nine pct ) & lt ; Svenska Petroleum AB > ( 4.5 pct ) .
LOUVRE ACCORD STILL EFFECT , JAPAN OFFICIAL SAYS Group Seven ( G-7 ) industrial nations still comply last February 's Louvre accord stabilize currencies , senior Bank Japan official said .
U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker 's remarks weekend indicating need revise herald lower range dollar , senior officials Bank Japan Finance Ministry agreed interviews .
`` exchange market apparently reacting much , anyone sold dollar Baker comment regret later , '' Bank Japan official told Reuters .
Bank official said Baker mean talk dollar .
lower dollar would harm U.S. Economy , noted .
Finance Ministry official directly involved monetary talks nations also said U.S. Would never attempt lower reference range dollar mark yen .
market assumes dollar reference range 140-150 yen 1.70 1.90 marks .
dollar closed Tokyo today 1.7730/35 marks 141.35 yen .
`` Behind Baker 's remark U.S .
Frustration higher interest rates abroad , especially West Germany , represent readiness scrap basic framework Louvre accord , '' Finance Ministry official said .
said contrary Baker wanted avoid rise U.S. Interest rates would hurt U.S. Economy aggravate Third World debt problem .
Higher U.S. Interest rates would merely raise interest payment burden depress U.S. Stock bond markets , monetary officials said .
ministry central bank officials , declined named , noted U.S. longer wants see decline dollar could also fan inflationary expectations U.S. `` 's Baker fail add Louvre agreement still operative , '' senior ministry official said .
Baker said U.S. Television interview Sunday Washington would reexamine Louvre accord West Germany 's increase short-term interest rates .
market first interpreted indicating U.S. Would ready scrap Louvre accord let dollar decline unless surplus countries , notably West Germany , try harder stimulate economies pledged accord , foreign exchange dealers said .
market reflection also noted Baker 's additional statement `` Louvre agreement still operative , '' caused dollar short-covering Tokyo today , dealers said .
Uncertainty , however , remained flavour day Tokyo currency markets .
Japanese monetary officials said Baker 's undisguised pressure West Germany refrain guiding interest rates higher may part process multilateral surveillance , international economic policy coordination .
G-7 , comprising U.S. , Japan , West Germany , Britain , France , Italy Canada , agreed monitor other's economic policies time time apply `` peer pressure '' persuade others change policies desired course , noted .
`` Without basic agreement multilateral surveillance , Baker would never criticized West German policy openly , '' ministry official said .
U.S.-West German squabble Bonn 's monetary policy thus regarded process healthy policy coordination indication possible collapse Louvre agreement , official said .
also said Japan received specific request U.S. monetary policy , although short-term money rates edging higher .
`` , unlike Germans , taking policy guide interest rates higher , marginal rate rise recent days primarily seasonal reasons , '' added .

Balladur , responding weekend remarks U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker U.S. Would take another look accords , said `` firmly desire faithfull firm adherence major industrial countries Louvre accords -- letter spirit . ''
Sunday , Baker said last week 's rise short-term West German interest rates keeping accords .
Louvre accords , agreed Paris last February , called stability among major currencies prolonged dollar slide .
accords reaffirmed Group Seven Finance Ministers Washington last month .
Baker said weekend West German rate rise `` keeping spirit agreed . ''
`` 'm really saying expect us simply sit back accept increased tightening part assumption somehow going follow , '' added .

`` said along rubber holding well condition quality standpoint ... Rubber stored proper conditions deteriorate , '' told Reuters telephone interview .
quality buffer stock rubber sold since entered market September would discussed INRO Council meeting opened today , said .
Tokyo traders said Friday little interest buying rubber INRO buffer stock possible poor quality .
Hofmeister began selling rubber prices exceeded `` may-sell ' level 232 cents per kg early last month .
INRO's five-day moving average quoted 237.3 cents October 16 .
said quality five six-year old rubber stock uppermost consumers ' minds .
`` received good interest rubber .
understand Japanese concern .
Many consumers want try rubber carry buying , '' said .
Hofmeister said INRO rubber stored 28 different locations producing consuming nations , adding warehouses used suitable long-term storage .
Selling buffer stock rubber levelled past week 10 days could reflect `` wait see attitude '' buyers , said .
`` Consumers holding back buying additional amounts test rubber .
tests positiive , likely buy . ''
Hofmeister said could reduce offer price buffer stock rubber stimulate interest INRO want depress prices artificially .
Hofmeister declined comment Japanese trade estimates sold around 30,000 32,000 tonnes Kuala Lumpur New York since September .
said Japanese traders position idea quantity sold , noting traders overall put buffer stock sales 25,000 35,000 tonnes .
question sales original 360,000 tonne buffer stock expected main topic Council meeting scheduled end Thursday .
current international rubber pact expires October 22 .

ECONOMIST URGES TAXES LOWER N.Z .
DOLLAR income tax surcharge capital gains tax could bring urgently needed depreciation N.Z .
Dollar , independent economist Len Bayliss said .
Bayliss , former economist Reserve Bank Bank New Zealand , said major depreciation needed restore export competitiveness even inflation cut current government policies .
taxes would help cut budget deficit , turn would lower value N.Z .
Dollar , said speech .
added deficit year ending March 1988 could much higher government 's 1.3 billion dlr forecast .
Since government unlikely cut expenditure percentage gross domestic product , major tax increase probably unavoidable , Bayliss said .
would preferred increase 10 pct value-added goods services tax , introduced October 1986 , would short-term inflationary impact .
Import tariffs lowered minimise inflationary impact currency depreciation .
government failed bring inflation despite lower oil prices appreciation currency , added .
New Zealand 's inflation rate 16.9 pct year end-September 18.9 pct year end June .
major deficiency government 's anti-inflation policies reliance high interest exchange rates insufficient emphasis reducing budget deficit , Bayliss said .
government also failed reduce overseas debt debt ratios cut balance payments deficit .
`` widespread belief ( New Zealand 's ) problems going take much longer solve originally thought soundly based -- primarily government's macro-economic policies unsuccessful , '' Bayliss said .
PHILIPPINE TRADE GAP WIDENS JANUARY-AUGUST Philippines ' trade deficit widened 542 mln dlrs eight months end-August 159 mln dlrs 1986 period , National Statistics Office said .
said exports eight-month period rose 3.58 billion dlrs 3.18 billion 1986 , imports rose 4.12 billion dlrs 3.34 billion year earlier .
country 's trade deficit totalled 202 mln dlrs 1986 .

sanctions end military cooperation cut economic aid .
New Zealand also renew agreement supports price Fijian sugar expires March .
loss aid sugar supports cost Fiji 10 mln dlrs year .
Palmer told reporters cabinet meeting government asked High Commissioner Rod Gates return Suva discussions possible measures .
`` wo n't reacting discussions High Commissioner Prime Minister held , '' Palmer said .
sanctions approved cabinet soon Colonel Sitivene Rabuka staged second coup September 25 .
Implementation postponed hope Rabuka might turn back declaring republic .
Palmer said cabinet happy statement Commonwealth leaders Vancouver Fiji 's membership Commonwealth lapsed .
Prime Minister David Lange Hawaii way home Vancouver .

A.R .
Sendi said Sunday Uganda 's Ministry Industry supports plan build factory roast , grind pack local coffee export .
Construction start December factory ready next October .
said Marketing Ministry authorised Coffee Marketing Board supply company & lt ; Unipack > 24,000 tonnes beans year processing export .
Sendi also told reporters negotiated 69.7 mln French franc loan Banque Industrielle d'Afrique Oriental Paris .
Uganda world 's fifth largest coffee producer , expects produce 200,000 tonnes year .
Market sources say roasted coffee exports benefit Uganda 's economy included 2.38 mln ( 60 kg ) bag export quota assigned country latest International Coffee Agreement .
addition , value roasted coffee substantially higher unroasted beans , said .
U.S. biggest buyer Ugandan coffee , used produce instant coffee .

amount crude delivered Soviet Union might double 200,000 bpd later , said .

Iran pursuing pipeline project protect part oil exports Iraqi air attacks Gulf .

Iran lost refining capacity early Gulf war imports several hundred thousand bpd refined products .

commitments export another 388,390 tonnes year .

TOKYO DEALERS SEE DOLLAR POISED BREACH 140 YEN Tokyo 's foreign exchange market watching nervously see U.S. Dollar drop significant 140.00 yen level , dealers said .
`` 140 yen level key dollar considered lower end reference range .
currency breaks level , may decline sharply , '' said Hirozumi Tanaka , assistant general manager Dai-ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd 's international treasury division .
dollar 141.10 yen midday Friday closes 142.35/45 New York 141.35 .
dollar opened 140.95 yen fell low 140.40 .
1.7733/38 marks 1.7975/85 New York 1.8008/13 Friday , opening 1.7700/10 .
currency 's decline due remarks Sunday U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker , dealers said .
`` dollar fell weekend increased bearish sentiment Baker 's comments , '' said Dai-ichi 's Tanaka .
said stemmed mounting concern cooperation among group seven ( G-7 ) industrial nations implement Louvre accord stabilise currencies might fraying .
dollar 's fall also prompted record one-day drop Dow Jones industrial average Friday weakness U.S .
Bond prices , dealers said .
Baker said Louvre accord still operative strongly criticised West German moves raise key interest rates .
Operators took Baker 's comment indicate impatience G-7 members failing stick Louvre accord due fears increasing inflation .
Rises interest rates aimed dampening inflationary pressures also slow domestic demand .
West Germany Japan pledged G-7 meetings boost domestic demand help narrow huge U.S. Trade deficit , Tanaka said .
U.S. August trade data showed U.S. Deficit still massive 15.68 billion dlrs .
West Germany raises interest rates , would run counter pledge , said .
`` Operators waiting see G-7 nations coordinate dollar buying intervention , '' said Soichi Hirabayashi , deputy general manager Fuju Bank Ltd 's foreign exchange department .
target range set Louvre accord generally considered 140.00 160.00 yen , dealers said .
`` market likely try 140 yen level near future time , operators see G-7 nations failing coordinate intervention , would see Louvre accord abandoned push dollar aggressively , '' Hirabayashi said .
said U.S. Currency could fall low 135 yen soon .

SOVIET INDUSTRIAL GROWTH/TRADE SLOWER 1987 Soviet Union 's industrial output growing slower pace 1987 1986 foreign trade fallen , Central Statistical Office figures show .
Figures Communist Party newspaper Pravda show industrial production rose 3.6 pct first nine months 1987 5.2 pct 1986 period .
Foreign trade period fell 3.6 pct 1986 period exports fell 0.5 pct imports dropped 4.2 pct .
Foreign trade nine months totalled 94.2 billion roubles .
Separate import export figures given .
One factor affecting industrial growth introduction new quality control plan , Western economists said .
Last year 's calculations industrial output included goods , irrespective quality .
new plan , introduced line Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev 's drive modernise economy , special inspectors right reject goods consider standard .
Pravda said 42 mln roubles worth defective goods rejected nine-month period .
figures also showed October 1 , 8,000 cooperative enterprises employing 80,000 people .
200,000 employed private sector , Pravda said , without giving comparative figures .
promotion cooperative private sectors economy important part modernisation campaign , measures introduced recently allow setting small shops private basis .
Labour productivity rose 3.7 pct first nine months 4.8 pct growth January September 1986 .
western economists said treat Soviet productivity figures caution , broadly based West , measures worker output given period .
Pravda said 283.8 mln people Soviet Union October 1 .
January September 1987 period 118.5 mln people employed , rise 4.4 pct period last year .
Average earnings 200 roubles month 194 roubles year ago .

& lt ; Rand Mines Properties Ltd > , one South Africa 's big six mining companies , said statement accident occurred Saturday morning & lt ; East Rand Proprietary Mines Ltd > mine Boksburg , 25 km east Johannesburg .
company spokesman could elaborate short statement .
